Elle veut acheter de la banane dans le Balantacounda, zone réputée dans la culture et la commercialisation de la banane et vendre à Ziguinchor. Mankagno mène cette activité depuis cinq ans et à toujours respecté ses engagements.Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l'entretien de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi N. sells groceries. She is married, but her husband's income from MTN, a local cell phone provider, does not cover the expenses for Esi and her two children. There is great demand for the goods she sells.

Esi plans to use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell. She wants to expand her business so she can increase her profit and provide more income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sarah Namuyomba `s Group

texts.en:
N. Sarah is a 45-year-old widow with 9 children ranging in age from 4 ½ to 27 years old.  The youngest seven are all in school.  She lives and works in Mulago, an urban neighborhood of Kampala near the big city hospital. 
For the past 10 years, Sarah has been dealing in charcoal.  Every two weeks she travels to Luweero, a village about two hours away, to buy 50-100 sacks of charcoal.  After arranging to have it transported back by truck, she sells it from a kabanda, a kind of local kiosk, in smaller increments to people who live in the neighborhood, making a profit on her investment. 
Sarah has been a member of MCDT since 2003 and has received at least 7 previous loans.  With this new loan, she will continue to expand her charcoal business, purchasing more charcoal to sell.  Her eventual goal is to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of coal

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Daouda D. is a young shopkeeper who lives in the Randoulène district of Thies. He is single and has no children, and he has been tending shop for more than 8 years. For the past two years he has been active in IMCEC Thies, taking out loans that he has reimbursed in a timely manner. He is requesting this loan with a view to bolstering his inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

DAOUDA D. est un jeune commerçant qui vit au quartier randoulène à thies .il est célibataire sans enfants et exerce sa profession depuis plus de 8 ans.ilest sociétaire à IMCEC THIES depuis deux ans et prend des prets qu'il rembourse régulièrement.c'est dans le but de renforcer ses stocks de marchandises qu'il sollicite ce pret.

loans.use:
sale of grocery products

VENTE DE DENREES ALIMENTAIRES

loans.name: Siti's Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Siti is 35 years and is married with 3 children ages 6, 4 and 2. She has been selling clothing since 2001. She works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $450 from her sales.

Siti now requests a loan to buy more clothes for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sabah and Hamisa, who also have businesses selling clothing and food.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re- sale

texts.es:
Ana tiene 21 años de edad, estudió quinto de secundaria, es conviviente y tiene una hija de 02 años. Vive en el Jr. Trujillo S/N, distrito de  Mazocruz, provincia El Collao – Puno.

Desde el año 2007 integra el Banco Comunal “Generación 2,000”- Mazocruz. En un inicio con el crédito de S/.300 nuevos soles, compró carne, 02 animales degollados para vender por kilos los días de feria. Quedó huérfana de madre a los 06 años de edad, creció junto a su padre y madrastra, al cumplir los 15 años de edad se fue a la ciudad de Puno para trabajar en restaurantes y auto sostenerse para seguir estudiando, a los 19 años de edad tuvo su pareja y empezó con la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino, alpacas y llamas para engorde, los cuales vende a pie.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelada en 04 cuotas, comprará 02 vacas cada uno a S/.500. Actualmente ella integra una Asociación de Artesanas y trabaja en convenio con el “Proyecto Sierra Sur”. Cuentan con el asesoramiento de una técnica, quien se encarga de buscar mercado en el extranjero, tejen chullos, guantes y medias.  

Su sueño es viajar a la ciudad de Lima al lado de su esposo que está trabajando en esa ciudad e instalar un negocio de acuerdo a la demanda que existe.
texts.en:
Ana is 21 years old, studied until her fifth year of secondary school, is married and has a 2-year old daughter. She lives on Trujillo Street in the Mazocruz district, located in the El Collao province of Puno.

She has been a member of the communal bank “Generation 2000” of Mazocruz since the year 2007. She started with a loan of 300.00 new Peruvian soles, with which she bought meat, 2 gutted animals to sell by the kilo on market days. She lost her own mother when she was six years old, and was raised by her father and stepmother. Upon turning fifteen, she went to the city of Puno to work in restaurants so she could support herself and continue her studies. At nineteen, she met her partner and started to raise livestock such as cattle, sheep, alpacas and llamas, which she fattens and sells on foot.

With this credit of 1,000.00 new Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will buy 2 cows at 500.00 Peruvian soles each. Currently, she is a member of an artisan womens’ association and works in agreement with the Sierra Sur Project. They count on technical accessories, in charge of seeking overseas markets, knitting chulos, gloves and socks.

Her dream is to travel to the city of Lima at her husband’s side, which is where he works, and start a business based on existing local demand.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two cows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
The Chamka Tamao Village bank has 17 members. It is located in the Kampong Chhang Province.

Mrs. Pol C. D. is the village bank president. She was selected to be president by the other members. She is also a pig breeder. As her pigs grow bigger and bigger, she needs more money to buy pig food. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food. Her husband Mr. Udom Samol is a motorbike repairer who earns a small income to support his family.

Mrs. Pol C. D. is 25 years old and the mother of one child. Her child is only five years old and is too young to work or study.

The picture shows the members of the community bank. Mrs. Run L. is not in the picture, so her husband stands in the picture in her place.

All the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. This allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pig food to feed her pigs

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Mr. Nat N. is a farmer in the Choeung Prey village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is 42 years old and the father of six children; one is employed in the garment factory, and the other five children are enrolled in the local school.

Mr. Nat N.'s wife, Mrs. Pom Eang, breeds ducks to earn a living. This business is going well, and she wants to expand it. So Mr. Nat N. requests a loan to buy duck food for his wife’s breeding business.

loans.use: Buy duck food for breeding business

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married and has one child. She sells jewelry at the central market in Nikolaev City. She has 9,000 UAH invested in this business, and her monthly gross income is 4,500 UAH. The business is located at a very good place where many people come by.

Larisa has been in this business for 4 years. She decided to start this business because she likes to sell jewelry. Larisa has great communication skills that help her in business. She would like to develop her business even more.

Larisa would like to get a loan of 2,000 UAH to increase the assortment of goods. This would help her to make more profits during the holiday season. Larisa says she wants to work hard and use every opportunity to increase her family's well-being.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of jewelry for sale

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina M. has been working in agriculture since getting married. She and her husband buy and sell sheep in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Mina and her husband are very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and sheep farming so that they can give their one dear son the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. A good education is the most important inheritance Mina and her husband can give to their son. Mina now finds herself with more expenses than income, and she would like a loan in order to increase their production. Mina and her family are waiting for your your help.

loans.use: Purchase nine sheep and fodder

loans.name: Graciela Alejandrina

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Graciela es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Graciela vende truchas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery garcía, también atiende a pedidos de sus clientes. Además Graciela vende útiles escolares en campaña escolar, talcos, serpentinas en época de carnaval y dependiendo de las campañas.
Gabriela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trucha, talcos, serpentinas.
Los sueños de Graciela son tener casa propia, un restaurante o bodega y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Amor Divino community bank. Graciela is married; she is 39 years old and has four children. Graciela sells trout, walking about the Nery García market as well as on request to her customers. In addition, Graciela sells school supplies during the school year, powders and streamers during carnival and during elections. Gabriela needs a loan of 1,000 soles with which she will buy trout, powders and streamers. She dreams of owning her own home, having a restaurant or a store and seeing her children have careers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trout, powders and streamers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a beautician in her village.  Some of the services that she offers are haircutting, pedicure, manicure, and make-up.  She has been in this business for almost 20 years and it helps her in providing for and supporting the needs of her children and her family.  

Victoria wants to purchase more inventory that she needs in her business, such as cuticle remover, nail polish, powder, scissors, and other beauty products. In order to acquire these items, Victoria is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5000.00 pesos. She dreams to expand her business by having her own beauty salon and an assistant some day.  She also wishes to train those out-of-school youth in her village so that they would have an extra income.  

Victoria is 42 years old and married to Albert, a driver in their community.  They have three children: Jenalyn - 23 years old, a college graduate now working in a department store as a cashier; Maryjoy - 21 years old, a college student; and Albert - 18 years old, also a college student. Victoria loves her family so she sacrifices a lot in order to give them a better life.

loans.use: To increase beauty products inventory

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Issa Diamoutènè  a 38 ans, polygame et père de six  enfants, il réside avec ses quatre  femmes et leurs enfants  à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture et autres, il s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage et de  commercialisation de Pois Sucré et noix de karité il y a environ 10 ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes de l’extérieur.
Les ressources financières lui faisant défaut, il sollicite la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à  son premier prêt individuel qu’il utilisera pour acheter, 20 sacs de pois sucré et 10 sacs de noix de karité. 
ll s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso,  pour venir les stocker dans son magasin situé au nouveau de Médine Sikasso, ensuite il les achemine sur Abidjan et à Bobo Dioulasso (respectivement en république de la Côte d’Ivoire et au Burkina Faso) sur commande des usines de fabrique de jus de pois sucré et de beurre de karité.  
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa Diamoutènè, age 38, is polygamous and the father of six children. He resides with his four wives and their children in Médine, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done several kinds of work unsuccessfully, notably agriculture, he got introduced about ten years ago to the business of storing and marketing sugar peas and shea nuts. With such experience in this domain, he enjoys a fine reputation and receives many orders from abroad.

With financial resources lacking, he’s applying to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, with which he is on his first individual loan. This loan will be used to buy 20 sacks of sugar peas and 10 sacks of shea nuts. Supplies are gotten in towns surrounding Sikasso in order to stock them in his store located in Médine Sikasso. Next he takes them to Abidjan and to Bobo Dioulasso (respectively in the Republic of Cote d’Ivoire and in Burkina Faso) by special order from factories making sweet pea juice and shea butter.

With this loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 250,000 francs CFA. With these profits in hand, he intends to cover most of the expenses for him and his family and to invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar peas and shea nuts

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros tiene 35 años, es madre soltera y vive con su único hijo que está en edad escolar, y es quien motiva su esfuerzo diario. Estudió el arte de modistería y ahora es una de las costureras más solicitadas, por los bonitos detalles que realiza al confeccionar ropa en todas sus variedades. En este campo textil, ya lleva 21 años y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es ser bien detallista y es lo que le gusta a sus clientes, además le es rentable porque trabaja para varias entidades públicas que confían en su buen trabajo y le mandan a realizar grande pedidos. Posteriormente, Milagros quiere tener un bien implementado taller textil. Con MFP, tiene 3 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son unidos y solidarios. El dinero que solicita en esta ocasión lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura y otra parte para el arreglo de su casa.
texts.en:
Milagros is 35 years old, a single mother, and lives with her only son who is school-aged, and it is he who motivates her daily efforts. She studied the art of dressmaking and now is one of the most asked-for seamstresses due to the beautiful details she creates to make clothes of all varieties. In the field of textiles she has 21 years of experience and it is going well. What she likes about her work is to be very detailed and that is what her customers like. Furthermore, her work is profitable because she works for various public entities which have confidence in her good work and they send her large orders. Subsequently, Milagros wants to have a well outfitted seamstresses’ shop.

She has three loans with MFP and she enjoys working with her communal bank because its members are united and supportive. The money that she asks for in this occasion will be invested in the purchase of dressmaking materials, and partly in the repair of her house.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dressmaking materials and home repairs

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Mrs. Luz P., 43 years old, is married and a resident of San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with four children. Her husband is an ambulance driver of the Municipality of Jimenez. In her desire to help her husband, she ventured into pig raising with a start-up capital of 3,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $62) from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is a MIGS member (member in good standing) of the co-op and has take out loans several times already. She's thankful that Paglaum Cooperative is always there in times of need.

Now, she is applying for a 14,900 peso loan to buy sacks of feeds and a piglet. She plans to build a cage for her pigs. She aims to repair their house and hopes that she'll be able to send all her children to college.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell palm oil

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Mrs. Gertrudes B. is a bona fide resident of East Poblacion Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married and blessed with three children who already have their own jobs.

Her business is a room-for-rent / boarding house. It started with only with three rooms available for rent. Now, she's requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 that will be used for the expansion of her rooms for rent. Her business is fully existing and running well so far. Her future plan is to make it a bigger and more comfortable boarding house.

loans.use: To extend her rooms for rent

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de djidjolé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a récemment associé à cette activité le commerce de produits de première nécessité. Son stock de pagnes a baissé de même qu’une partie des produits de première nécessité a péri, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes, et divers produits de première nécessité.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the Djidjolé neighborhood which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She earns her living selling "pagnes" (brightly colored lengths of African print cloth). She has recently added on the sale of staples. Her stock of "pagnes" is down, and at the same time, some of her stock of grocery items went bad. She wants to replenish her inventory and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 15 lengths of "pagne" and various staple goods.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" and staple goods for resale

loans.name: Desideria

texts.es:
Desideria  es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Desideria es conviviente tiene 47 años, un hijo de 16 años, que está terminando de estudiar en la escuela estatal.
Desideria se enamoró de su esposo  el  vendía  pollos, se fueron a vivir juntos y ella empezó a trabajar con él en la venta de pollos  hace mas de 25 años, dice es un buen negocio porque es un producto de primera necesidad.
Desde que Desideria esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar, antes todo su dinero lo invertía y no ahorraba nada, pero ahora aprendió a horrar para conseguir sus metas.
Desideria necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra de congelados  pavita, medallones, huevos, gallinas, bolsas.
El sueño de Desideria es poner una avícola en una avenida principal.
texts.en:
Desideria is a member of the communal bank "Las Luciérnagas" (The Fireflies). Desideria lives with her husband and is 47 years old. She has a 16 year old son who is finishing his studies at a public school. Desideria fell in love with her husband who sold chickens. Twenty-five years ago they went to live alone and she started to work with him selling chickens. She says that it is a good business because chicken is a basic food item that everyone wants. Since Desideria was in Finca she learned to save money. Before she invested all of her money and she did not save anything. But now she learned how to save to acheive her goals. Desideria needs a loan of $550 (1,600 Soles) to buy frozen chicken, chicken breasts, eggs, bags and hens. Desideria's dream is to start a poltury farm.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy frozen chicken, chicken breasts, eggs, hens and bags.

loans.name: Уктам

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Уктам 1958 года рождения, женат имеет пятерых детей. Он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Так же Уктам работает на водоносной станции Сумчака. Жена помогает ему ухаживать со скотом .После откормки скот продается на скотном рынке. Уктам кредитуется в нашей организации более 3 лет. Он успешно закончил предыдущих займов и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Он планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем самым увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Ему очень нравятся условия нашего кредитования и он рад, что есть такие организации поддерживающие общество.

loans.use: на закупку крупно рогатого скота

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok R. has been sustaining her family’s living conditions for years by planting a variety of crops. She is aged 26 and the mother of three teenage children who are going to school. She is married to Theoun, 33, a fisherman.

Sok R. presently grows crops such as cucumbers, cabbages, morning glories, etc. She estimates that she will sell her mature produce after another month. Unfortunately, her crops are not growing well because they still need fertilizer. Sok R. is thus requesting a Kiva loan of $250 to purchase more fertilizer to fatten her crop yield. She proposes to use the rest of loan for her husband to repair his fishing equipment.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to fatten her crop yield and to pay for repair of her husband's fishing equipment

loans.name: Martha Ramona

texts.es: La señora Martha M. tiene la edad de 42 años, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada, su negocio es la venta de ropa y comida ambulante en las diferentes rutas de la capital, también se mantiene en el mercado Israel Levites. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios para sastifacer las necesidades de su hogar, luego para incrementar  opto a préstamo en Afodenic para incrementar su inventario, es su octavo ciclo el cual invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar de anexar un cuarto que tiene y poder estar en  condiciones mejores. Sus planes es poder tener un local fijo donde vender ya que día a día se arriesga a un accidente oh que le roben, también es cansado. Da las gracias a la institución por logros de hacer las mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha M., 42, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is married. She sells food and clothes as a street vendor on the different routes of the capital. She also sells at the Israel Levites market. She started this business with her own funds in order to support the household necessities. Then, to increase her inventory, she opted for a loan from Afodenic. This is her eighth loan cycle. She will buy construction materials to finish adding a room that she has and to be able to put it in better condition. Her plan is to have a fixed location where she can sell because, day to day, she risks an accident or being robbed. She is also tired. She is grateful to the institution for being able to make improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish building a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his livestock by purchasing a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tètevi Senawobgé

texts.fr: Cet homme vend uniquement des pneus d’automobile dans le quartier d’Adakpamé à Lomé ; il a débuté cette activité depuis 1994 et a donc une vie professionnelle assez remplie en expériences. Il commande ses pneus du Nigéria à bon prix ; il exerce également le métier de vulcanisation de pneus dans son atelier de mécanique générale, et a même recruté des mécaniciens de voiture pour l’aider dans sa tâches Il a un besoin urgent en ce moment de lancer une nouvelle commande ; c’est pour cela qu’il compte sur un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des pneus Opel et Bus. Il est marié et a à sa charge 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. A.’s business is selling auto tires in the Adakpamé neighborhood of Lomé. He begin his trade in 1994, so he has considerable professional experience. He purchases tires at a low price in Nigeria. He also repairs tires in his mechanic shop; he even employs auto mechanics to help him in his business. Currently he has an urgent need to place an order for Opel and Bus tires. This is why he has requested a loan from WAGES. Mr. A. is married with two children.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase automobile tires

loans.name: K. Martine

texts.fr: T. K. Martine est née en 1949 à Dassa dans le Département des Collines. Martine est mariée à TOSSA Bernadin. Martine et Bernadin ont cinq enfants tous majeurs et indépendants. La famille vit à Agbodjèdo, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Martine vend des divers (produits contre les moustiques, éponges en fer, savons, allumettes, piles pour les lampes torches, etc.) ainsi que le charbon de bois. Martine vend ses produits à son domicile et aussi de façon ambulante. Martine a déjà eu trois crédits de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursés et lesquels elle a élevé le niveau de son activité. Aujourd'hui, Martine sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé pour pouvoir continuer de développer son activité.
texts.en:
T. K. Martine was born in 1949 in Dassa in Collines County. She is married to TOSSA Bernadin. Martine and Bernadin have five children who are legal adults and independent. The family lives in Agbodjèdo, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Martine sells various goods (anti-mosquito products, steel sponges, soaps, matches, flashlight batteries, etc.), as well as charcoal. She sells her merchandise out of her home and also door-to-door. She has already had three ALIDé loans that she has repaid. She used them to raise her business level. Today, she’s requesting a fourth ALIDé loan to be able to continue developing her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal, detergents, insecticide, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Gairat

texts.en:
K. Gairat is 33 years old, married and has four children. His role as a father, which he has carried out for ten years, has helped him to understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house.

Gairat works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. He has grown and sold apples for more than five years. Gairat dreams that all of his children will be well educated and have a bright future – that is why he works from early morning till late at night.

Gairat wants to borrow $2,500 USD to buy apples and necessary supplies for saving his products because he wants to sell them later when the price for them will increase. This loan request is to make Gairat's dream come true, and he is asking for help from your generous heart.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase apples and necessary supplies for saving his products

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza G.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling green bananas in her community. She is 30 years old, married and has two small children. They are from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. Liza has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Liza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Herlita

texts.en:
Herlita is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. Her oldest child is just 10 years old. To earn a living, she is engaged in the business of rice farming. When she started her business, she used to deal with traders. However, because of the high interest charged by the traders, Herlita’s income could not cover all of her family’s needs. In addition, the the high interest rate did not allow her to save any money, which she has been planning to do for some time now.

So, as soon as she heard about CEVI, she fulfilled her loan obligations to the traders and joined the MFI. For one thing, the low interest rate appealed to her. When she became a member, she was happy to learn that there are many benefits of micro-finance. She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP ($325), which she will use to finance her farm. Specifically, she will use the loan proceeds to buy diesel for the tractor and farming necessities, and to pay the laborers who work at the farm.

loans.use: To improve her business by purchasing farming necessities and by paying laborers

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 43 and is married with two children. Her husband is a printer and also supports the home. Blessing owns a pharmacy where she sells medicine to her customers. She is a friendly woman and she uses her skills to attract more customers to her shop. Blessing has been in this business for a long time. She needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more medical supplies for her shop. Blessing hopes to own a maternity home in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pharmacutical supplies

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Regina is 36 years old and a married mother of three children. Two of her children are currently with their father in Cote d’Ivoire, which is Ghana’s neighboring country, while she takes care of the lastborn here in Ghana. For the last eight years, Regina has run a business selling lingerie for women, such as bras, panties, etc., and it is very profitable. She takes delivery of stock from Accra and sells it in smaller quantities through hawking. She wants to use her loan to buy bales of lingerie and jeans materials to increase her inventory and sales as we celebrate Christmas. She believes this loan will help her save some money to start paying her utility bills and part of the children’s school fees.
Regina is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Oyerepa’, which means 'good wife'. She is pictured standing third from right in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, grocery shop operators, or food vendors. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. The group would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie and jeans materials

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina es una persona dedicada a su familia su entorno familiar está constituido por su esposo y sus tres hijos. Segundina se dedica a la confección tiene un puesto en la Avenida Punata, paralelamente tiene un internet en la zona norte. En el caso de la confección es la única en la zona que se dedica a esa actividad siendo su trabajo de gran demanda, lo mismo sucede en el caso del internet solo existe el de la cliente en la zona, razón por la cual tiene buenos ingresos por sus servicios. Segundina es para gastos de salud, que incurrió para la curación de su hijo, se prestó dinero y lo devolverá con el crédito. Segundina es una buena cliente y con buen comportamiento de pagos en Agrocapital, siendo que en su último crédito solo tuvo un día de atraso en 18 cuotas.
texts.en:
Segundina is a person dedicated to her family; her family environment is made up of her husband and three children. Segundina is a seamstress and has a stall on Punata avenue; in parallel, she offers internet services in the north zone. On the seamstress business, she is the only one offering these services in the area and her services are in high demand. Segundina needs the money for health expenses that she incurred to treat her son; she borrowed money and she will pay it back with this loan. Segundina is a good client with a good payment record at Agrocapital, since in her last loan she was late 1 day once during her 18 payments.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Health expenses

loans.name: Maky Afghan Gul Group

texts.en:
This is the Maky Afghan Gul group, which has four members. Abdul Fata is the group leader. He has a general store and he will use the loan to expand his business and to get ahead. 
The second member is Palwasha who would like to receive a loan for her husband’s fruit cart. He plans to buy more and different kinds of fresh fruit to attract more clients.
The third member is Afghan Gul who wants to take a loan for her son who needs to buy a machine to make candy.
The last member is Mah Khanom who needs to buy wood for her bakery business.
They are all glad and admire this loan process and have requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani.

loans.use: To expand and progress his business

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en:
Batsuh is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two children live at home now.

Batsuh works with his wife as a shoemaker. Currently, they do not have a place of their own in which to live, but they are planning to purchase a plot of land in the future. They live only on the profits from their business and do not have income from any other sources.

Batsuh started his business as a carpenter from his home in 2005. He has operated the shoe repair business with his wife and sister at the Ganbogd market since June of 2009. Since then, he and his wife have worked hard to expand their business. They are planning to work separately from Batsuh's sister and to purchase a plot of land on which to live. Batsuh says, “I would like to create my own workplace.”

The Mongolian Lunar New Year celebration is coming, and demand for Batsuh's services is very high now. For this reason, the number of his customers has increased. He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase shoe-making materials from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia in anticipation of the Mongolian Lunar New Year celebration.

loans.use: To purchase shoe-making materials

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa Argentina, tiene un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Es madre de 3 jóvenes los cuales asisten al colegio, compra sus productos a  camiones repartidores y en el mercado oriental donde los precios le resultan más favorables, su esposo trabaja como sastre, con el esfuerzo de ambos han logrado mantener activo el negocio, pese a que la situación económica se encuentra baja. Actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para su negocio. Su deseo es mejorar su actividad económica y obtener otra fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Argentina manages a convenience store inside of her home. She is the mother of three teenagers who attend high school. Rosa purchases her products from the delivery trucks and at the eastern market where the prices are more favorable. Her husband works as a tailor. Through their efforts, both of them have managed to maintain active businesses despite facing challenges in their financial situation.

Rosa is currently requesting a loan to use as operating capital for her business. She hopes to improve her finances and obtain another source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Tulua

texts.en:
Tulua F. is 56 and married with 7 children (ages 15 - 37).  She owns a business venture which is agriculture.  Tulua has 5 years of experience in this business.  Tulua needs a loan of WST $1700 0.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2007, Tulua joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tulua's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tulua F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.8 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha G. is a 26-year-old parent to her only child, 1-year-old Edcent. At present, she lives with her parents, her husband and their son in her parents’ house. Though her parents are very supportive of her family, Editha still dreams of having her own house where she and her husband and son can enjoy their privacy and live their own lives independently. To be able to achieve this dream, Editha needs to have her own sari-sari (variety store) business and make her own profit. Presently she shares her mother’s sari-sari store and the loan she is requesting now will be used to put up her own store. She plans to build her own small sari-sari store cottage away from her mother’s and purchase grocery items for selling. Editha is very much hoping that someday her business proceeds will enable her to build a home for her own family and they will be independent from her parents.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hean T. is 56 years old and the village bank president selected by the eleven members of this group loan, located I. Preak Ta Choar village I. Kandal province. Each member of the group will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Hean T. and her husband, Mr. Hov Khay, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow vegetables. Mrs. Hean T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a watering machine for the crops; she will use the rest of the loan to grow vegetables. This couple has four children: one is a farm laborer and three are students who also support their parents' business.

loans.use: to buy a watering machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en: Jovencia T. is from the village of Purok 3 A, Kadingilan, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Jovencia is married. To make a living, Jovencia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Jovencia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Jovencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Jovencia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Jovencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S., 50, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. She is a photographer and earns an income of $5 US per day. Her husband is a hair-dresser for wedding parties, earning an income of about $2.50 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new camera to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: buy a new camera to expand the business

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Mrs. Bimala T. lives in the town of Balkhu, Kathmandu. She lives in single family. She has a three member-family, including herself. Her husband, Mr. Dipesh T., works in private office. She has one son studying in a primary school.

Mrs. T. opened her meat shop two years ago in the town of Balkhu. She sells chicken and buff (buffalo) meat in her shop. She opened the meat shop to improve the living standards of her family. Her husband also helps her in her work. Now she is requesting a loan of NPR 20,000 to buy a freezer to store her meats.

loans.use: To buy a freezer to store meat.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn J. is from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 51 years old. Evelyn is married and has 51 adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital for the store

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn I. is from the village of Upper Bandera. She is 28 years old and is single. Madelyn operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Madelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Madelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Mariuxi Janeth

texts.es:
Mariuxi de 32 años, ella es vendedora de productos naturales y vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil. 

A Mariuxi siempre le gusto la medicina pero por la falta de oportunidades y de dinero no estudio lo que tanto había querido, fue hay que decidió trabajar vendiendo productos naturales en su propio local desde la mañana hasta el anochecer. 

Para poder surtir mas su negocio con los productos naturales ella quiere comprar con el préstamo medicinas y productos naturales. En el futuro quiere agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariuxi, 32 years old, sells natural products and lives in an urban area, in Las Orquídeas in Guayaquil. Mariuxi always liked medicine, but because of a lack of opportunity and money she did not study what she wanted so much to do. She then decided to work selling natural products in her own shop from morning until evening. To better stock her business, she wants to buy medicines and natural products with this loan. In the future she would like to expand her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural products

loans.name: Nahashon

texts.en: Nahashon, a 35-year-old father of one, sells cereals such as rice and beans to earn a living.  He has been running the business for a year and a half  and   hopes to someday supply cereals in supermarkets and schools.  Nahashon became a member of Faulu Kenya through Shirley's group and is requesting his first loan of 20,000 KES to expand his business.  He hopes to open other business premises in the future.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: Ena María

texts.es: Sra. Ena María T. Gonzalez, esta por primera vez trabajando con nuestra institución, quien manifiesta que esta muy satisfecha porque se le esta brindando financiamiento para Ampliar su casa y de esta manera y ella solventa y lleva sus proyectos de estar en mejores condiciones en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ena María T. G. is collaborating with our institution for the first time.

She states that she is very satisfied because she is getting financing to enlarge her home that makes it possible for her to carry out her projects for better living conditions at home.

loans.use: To buy 600 paving stones and 3 quintales of iron rods (1 metric quintal=100 kilos)

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia C. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 55 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Leticia owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Leticia joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru:
Parviz H. 35 let. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey .Doch kotoroy 10  let ona uchitsya v shkole i xodit na muziku ,doch kotoroy 6 let toje uchitsya v shkole i novorojdenniy sin  kotoromu 9 mesecev. Parviz yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Agdam ,seychas projivayet v qorode Baku.

Parviz uje 11 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom taksista. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini. Eto uje vtoroy ssud Parviza, on ochen blagodaren lenderam za pervuyu ssudu.
texts.en:
Parviz H. is 35 years old.  He is married and has three children.  His ten-year-old daughter goes to school and studies music.  His six-year-old daughter goes to school, and he has a newborn son, nine months old.  Parvoz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Agdam who now lives in Baku.

Parviz has been driving a taxi for eleven years.  He started this business with his father.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy repair parts for his car.  This is Parviza’s second loan.  He is very thankful to the lenders for his first loan.

loans.use: Buying repair parts for a taxi

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 28 years old. She has one child and has separated from her husband. She has a market stall where she sells different things, but clothes are the dominant commodities she sells and she has been doing this business for about ten years. 

Jacqueline needs a loan to add more items for sale. She says that her business satisfies everything she needs, like food and clothing for herself and her child. She plans to build a house from the profits that will be obtained from this business. In the future, she would like to have a big shop composed of everything her customers may wish for.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.pt:
Armando José A. nasceu na Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique casado pai de 2 filhos maiores de idade. Fez apenas 4ª classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Sofala para a cidade da Maputo cumprindo com o serviço militar Obrigatório. É pensionista do Ministério da Defesa ha mais de 20 anos e recebe 7.081.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversas com um amigo que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros) para melhorar a sua residência.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros empréstimos. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito, para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Armando José A. was born in the province of Sofala in the centre of Mozambique.  He is married and the father of two adult children.  He only finished grade four and didn't continue on in school due to financial conditions.  He lives in his own house with his family and has no other dependents.

He left Sofala for the city of Maputo in serving his compulsory military service.  He has been a pensioner of the Ministry of Defence for more than 20 years, and receives 7,081 MT per month, which he puts towards household expenses, and still manages to put some aside in his bank account.

He has never had loans with other banks.  He got to know about Hluvuku through conversations with a friend who is also a client of this institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 MT, with which he plans to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stone, metal, and other things) in order to improve his residence.

He promises to duly repay in order to be able to apply for further loans.  He is confident that he will repay before the deadline and will ask for another loan to finish the work.

loans.use: purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, stone, metal, and other things)

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with three children. Two of her children attend school and one is too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For more than five years, she has operated a vegetable business, where she sells green vegetable, tomatoes and potatoes. She sells from her home to her neighbors and passers-by.  In addition, she sells kikois (sarong-like wrapped clothing) which contributes to her income. Mwanamkasi faces the major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to sell wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, bananas, tomatoes, onions, potatoes and coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase green vegetables, bananas, tomatoes, onions, potatoes and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is 26 years old, and married with two children — a ten-month old and a three-year-old who attends nursery school. Her husband works in construction. Doreen sells various items in her store, which she has had for three years. She will use the loan to purchase more rice, sugar, cooking oil, salt and soap to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Doreen plans to re invest in her business. She would like to be a supplier to other business people or a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as sugar, rice, cooking oil and salt to sell.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 50 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ofelia (35)  y sus dos  pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena  calidad de vida.Trabajando arduamente este trabajador hombre  a logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus plantas de plátanos y café, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, ya lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar la tierra durante  todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Para más adelante, espera adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de cítricos, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende.Este es el cuarto préstamo de Raúl con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudara bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado.Raúl tiene planeado invertir  los mil soles solicitados en la compra de  abono e insecticidas que necesita para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Raúl, age 50, is a jovial and hard-working man. He lives in his own home with his wife, Ofelia (age 35), and their two young children, whom he wants to give a good quality of life. Working arduously, this diligent man has managed to make his crop fields thrive. Every morning he wakes up very early in order to irrigate and care for his plantain and coffee plants, which he will then sell in the city of Pichanaki as this is where he obtains the best prices for his products. What he likes most about his job is that he can enjoy the freedom of working in his green fields, which he has been doing for 24 years. He considers the most difficult aspect to be working the land all day long, leaving him little time to do any other activity. In the future, he hopes to adapt his fields for citrus production during the time when citrus sells the most. This is Raul's fourth loan with MFP. He knows that this loan will help him considerably with the progress and development of his business, which is why he is ready to make his payments punctually. In his microfinance group, he is a very responsible member, which is why he is very respected. Raul plans on investing the 1,000.00 PEN that he is requesting in purchasing the fertilizer and pesticides he needs in order to improve his crops.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides for crop improvement

loans.name: Jeanne D Arc

texts.en: Jeanne d'Arc owns a business that sells charcoal. She is 34 years old, married, and has three children with one other dependent and her children and her dependent are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a mechanic. Jeanne d'Arc has been selling charcoal for one year.  Her new loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the charcoal business. She dreams of having a capital of five millions in years to come.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a retail business for the last seven years, selling to her neighbours. Sidi faces a major challenge of seasonality. Sidi hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, litres of cooking oil and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, litres of cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Kyandago Development Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
Erikana B. is the leader of Kyandago development group B. He is a business man with a retail shop in Kyandago that has been in operations for four years. He sells sugar, salt, drinks and other general merchandise to the local people and travelers, since he is stationed by the road side outside of his home. He is able to make 200,000/= as monthly profits. Erikana is also a farmer with tea plants and the sale of matooke to the general public and the tea factory in his area. 

He needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for his shop.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Qalakancane Group

texts.en:
Makhosazana is 62 years of age, single and has two children who are 27 and 35. She runs a clothing business in Mtubatuba, South Africa (KZN). She is pictured in the center of the photo, raising her hand.

She has been in her business for seven years and sells new clothes in town. She also receives a child support grant from the government. She says the main challenges to her business are customers who do not pay on time.

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy material of making mats like a saw, needles, etc. She also adds that the extra income from this loan will help her extend her home and take her child to tertiary education. In future she would like to see her business grow and become a supplier.

loans.use: To buy clothing and mat-making materials, e.g., needles and a saw

loans.name: Noem's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 19 members. Mr. NO. was born in 1953. He was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this village will use their money to support their different purposes.

Mr. NO. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice. They also have 2 children who are also farmers. Besides farming, they also earn a living by selling Khmer natural medicine and as a fisherman. Even with these jobs, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. Thus, in order to improve the family's condition, Mr. NO. would like to ask for a loan to buy pig food and piglets for breeding.

loans.use: to buy pig food and piglets for breeding

loans.name: Besse

texts.fr:
Madame BESSE S. est une femme de 63 ans. Elle est veuve sans enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTH MALEME DENTAL depuis le 17 juin 2009. Elle a 03 fois de suite bénéficié de prêt et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté.

Elle fait un petit commerce sur étalage de légumes et de condiment pour cuisine. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra financer son activité de petit afin d'accroitre ses revenus financier et enfin subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Mrs. Besse S. is a 63-year old  widow, without children. She is a member of the Banc Villageois of Sinth Maleme Dental since June 17, 2009. She took out loans three times and always repaid them without difficulty. She sells vegetables and food condiments from a stand. With her loan, she would like to finance her retail business in order to grow her revenue and be able to support herself.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and food condiments for resale

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 47 años, es casado, viven en compañía de su esposa y sus 3 hijos de los 4 que tiene, en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 5 años trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada y desde entonces este trabajo se ha convertido en su fuente principal de ingresos económicos para su familia. Gracias a esta actividad, hoy es independiente, él mismo administra su tiempo y trabaja más tiempo de lo que normalmente se trabaja en un horario fijo, ya que su principal objetivo es ganar lo suficiente para conseguir el progreso. Ahora y como parte de dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ha logrado comprar su propio terreno, ahí pudo construir provisionalmente un espacio para que lo pueda habitar él y su familia,  y que hasta el día de hoy es su domicilio. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ante esto agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de acceder a este préstamo que utilizará adecuadamente. Con el crédito  que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para levantar las paredes en el perímetro de su vivienda.
texts.en:
47-year old Alejandro is married and lives with his wife and three of his four children in his own house. For over five years he has worked as a heavy machine operator. His wages are the principal source of income for his family. Because of this job, he is independent. He himself decides how much he works, and he chooses to work more than if he had fixed hours as his main goal is to earn enough money to continue making progress. 

Because he wishes to provide a better standard of living for his family, Alejandro has managed to purchase a piece of land. He’s been able to build a place for his family which is now their home.

This is the first time that Alejandro is taking out a loan with Kiva partner MFP. He is very grateful to the institution for the opportunity to have a loan which he will use appropriately. He plans to buy construction material to build walls around the outside of his home.

loans.use: to build walls around the outside of his home

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel Agüero Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 27 años, está en Unión libre, vive con sus 4 hijos y su señora que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el dinero realizar la compra de los alimentos para el engorde de sus animales. El quiere crecer en el negocio  cada día y generar las ganancias para bienestar familiar  y crecer como un gran productor de cerdos para la carne. Su meta es creer con le proyecto y seguir adelante con su negocio y asi cada dia fortalecerlo para su crecimiemto.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Manuel Agüero Rodríguez is 27 years old and has a common-law marriage.  He lives with his wife and four children who are his main priorities.  He plans to use his money to buy feed for fattening his animals.  He would like to grow in his business, make profits for the good of his family, and grow as an important pig producer who raises animals for meat.  His goal is to continue moving forward in his business and strengthen and grow it every day.

This is Manuel's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't received any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to look after and fatten his pigs

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Hounsi Jeannette

texts.fr: Née en 1962 au Bénin, Hounsi Jeannette, est mariée à un Comptable du nom de Michel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous à charges et scolarisés. Hounsi Jeannette et son mari subviennent ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Hounsi Jeannette a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Pour faire face aux diverses charges de sa famille, Hounsi Jeannette mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d’année la vente de bouteilles, de pétrole et des cartes de recharge téléphoniques à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Hounsi Jeannette achète des produits de mercerie qu'elle vend à son domicile. C’est au Bénin et au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin, que Hounsi Jeannette achète ses produits. En vue d’agrandir son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Hounsi Jeannette sollicite un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Hounsi Jeannette a bien remboursé les crédits obtenus  précédemment.
texts.en:
Born in Benin in 1962, Jeannette Hounsi is married to an accountant named Michel. The couple have three dependent children who have all received schooling. Jeannette and her husband handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Jeannette attended school up to the secondary level. To cover family expenses, she started selling bottles, kerosene, and telephone recharge cards from her home about twenty years ago. As a sideline, she buys sewing supplies which she also sells from her home. Jeannette gets her merchandise in Benin and also in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. 

Jeannette is seeking a 7th loan from ALIDé to expand her business and better serve her customers. She correctly repaid all previous loans.

loans.use: to buy bottles, cans of kerosene, and telephone recharge cards

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, contando con solo servicio de luz,  ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Froilan es a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (atún, leche, aceite, papel higiénico, etc), en su propio domicilio donde puede atender a cualquier hora y así pueda obtener más ingresos para su casa.  Además se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno que le permite extraer leche para su venta desde hace 5 años.

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1200 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de productos para ampliar su negocio con otros productos y también será para comprar forraje para alimentar a sus animales y sigan produciendo leche, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su préstamo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Froilan desea tener un negocio más grande y contar con más vacas productoras de leche que le permitirá que su negocio crezca y que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Froilan, 40, lives with his wife and children in his own house, which only has electricity.  It is located in the districto of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura.  This area is mainly involved in agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

Froilan has a business selling basic needs items (tuna, milk, oil, toilet tissue, etc.) which is set up in his home so he can attend to customers at any time of the day and, thus, make more income.  He also raises dairy cattle and has been selling milk for five years.

The loan requested through Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN will be used to buy more products to expand the current range offered in the store, and to buy animal feed so the cows can keep producing milk.  With the income he obtains he will pay back the loan and improve his family's lifestyle.  Froilan wants to expand his business and have more dairy cattle so income will increase and his family will get ahead.

loans.use: To buy more products to expand business, and buy animal feed.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 36 years old, single and lives in the Philippines. She makes a living by running a snack shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and candies. She has been in this line of work for four years and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and candies to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 32 years old and married. She has one child.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has been running the variety store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of items like soft-drinks, biscuits and candies to sell in her variety store. Arlene has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Arlene aspires to save enough money so she can send her child to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of items like soft-drinks, biscuits, and candies to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Qaraoglan

texts.en:
Qaraoglan is a hardworking husband and father of two children. He owns a small café which serves all sorts of food and tea. He likes his work and stands out in it due to his attention to detail, the cleanliness of his establishment, the quality of his work and his friendliness. He has three years of experience in this field and his monthly profit is about 300 USD. 
Qaraoglan started his business cooking the national meat dish, which is very popular. Today, he rents a place at the central market of Sabirabad city. He would like to extend his business and purchase new plastic chairs and tables to make his place more attractive to customers. For this purpose, he has requested a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs and tables to improve his café.

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doris, vive con su familia, es madre de dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, es comerciante de ropa, vende en los municipios cercanos a la ciudad, trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano y regresa por las tardes a su hogar.
Ella necesita comprar ropa para el negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo que cubra la inversión en blusas, faldas, ropa interior, camisas formales y para niños, esta compra le ayudara para aumentar la mercadería y tener más surtido el negocio, con la esperanza de que las ventas sean buenas y poder comercializarlas rápido.
Para Doris su principal propósito con el negocio, es tener una fuente estable de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, también poder ahorrar para el futuro de ellos.
texts.en:
Doris lives with her family.  She’s the mother of two children who are 5 and 2 years old.  She is a clothes merchant.  She sells in towns near the city and works every day from very early on returning home in the afternoon.

She needs to buy clothes for the business so is asking for a loan to cover the cost of blouses, skirts, underwear, dress shirts and children’s clothes.  This purchase will help her increase her stock merchandise and have a better selection available hoping thereby that sales will be good and that she’ll sell out quickly.

For Doris, the main reason for the business is to have a stable source of income to cover her children’s needs as well as to save up for their future.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35 year-old Nitta from Gweru, with hand raised. She is married with four children, two attending school and also cares for one dependent. Nitta runs a retail cross-border business selling clothes and accessories. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are crossing the border, import duty and late payments from clients as she usually sells on credit. Nitta has requested a loan of $400 to buy African attire, weaves, jeans and braids. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's lifestyle in term of more disposable income and better living conditions. In the future Nitta plans to own her own shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en: Aynura is 30; she is married with two children. She breeds cattle and sells them for meat profit. As veal is very popular in Azerbaijan, Aynura thinks she chose the proper way to earn money. Her monthly profit is about $150. She applied for a 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) loan to purchase two cattle and fodder. She already took a loan from AqroInvest and completed it successfully.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Patricia Rufina

texts.es: La Sra. Patricia se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir, ella esta sacando crédito por primera vez en nuestra institución, en el momento de la evaluación del crédito la Sra. Patricia demostró una actitud buena, Cortez y amable, La Sra. Patricia, vive en la zona villa nueva Potosí, de la ciudad de la Paz Bolivia, ella en la actualidad vive con su esposo, ambos trabajan confeccionando chamarras ya hace unos 10 años, la Sra. Patricia, saco este crédito para la compra de una maquina ojaladora y además de telas para surtir colores, él taller esta ubicado en la casa de sus papás, uno de sus metas es comprar  su propia casa  y ahí establecer su taller mas amplio, perseverando siempre en el trabajo piensa lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia is a seamstress and is requesting her first loan through our institution.  During the loan evaluation interview Patricia displayed a good attitude and was both courteous and kind.  She lives in the Nueva Potosí residential area in the city of La Paz, Bolivia, with her husband.  Both of them work together and have been making jackets for ten years.

Patricia requested this loan to buy a button-hole sewing machine and different colored fabrics.  The workshop is set up in her parents' house.  One of her goals is to buy her own house and set up a larger sewing shop.  She is committed to meeting her goals through hard work.

loans.use: To buy a button-hole sewing machine and different colored fabrics.
