loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в районе Кумсангир. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети маленькие. Сам он более пяти лет занимается растениеводством. У него имеется небольшой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и злаковые культуры. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 29 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker, and children are little.  Bakhtiyor has been involved in agriculture for over five years.  He has a small plot of land, where he grows vegetables and cereal crops.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y su hija de 2 años, ella tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jabón, detergentes, trabaja todos los días de la semana.
Ella necesita el préstamo para surtir más su negocio y comprar: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, para que sus clientes estén satisfechos, y mejorar el inventario.
La  aspiración de María siempre mantener su negocio surtido aumentar en clientes y darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and two year old child. She has a staples general store. She sells rice, beans, sugar, soap, and detergents. She works every day of the week.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies for her store such as rice, sugar, and beans, so she can satisfy her clients and increase her inventory.

María's dream is to be able to maintain her business, increase her client base, and to be able to give her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and beans in order to supply her business

loans.name: Hildaura

texts.es:
La señora Hildaura es socia del banco comunal Las Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 53 años de edad y es soltera.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, cuenta con un puesto en uno de los mercados de la ciudad.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes tamaños y sabores, 1 paquete de sorbetes, 1 ciento de vasos.
A sus años todavía está soltera y sin compromiso, su único compromiso lo tiene con su hermano que es un minusválido a quien atiende antes de ir a trabajar, espera seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos para ir implementando más su negocio.
Su trabajo es casi  de todo el día, regresa por las noches  para poder descansar y ver cómo se encuentra su hermano, como buena hermana se preocupa que nada le falte.
texts.en:
Señora Hildaura is a member of the communal bank Las Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and single. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos loans for 10 years. She sells soft drinks from a stall located at one of the city's markets.

With the new loan of S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy: 10 cases of soft drinks of different sizes and flavours, 1 case of sherbet, 100 glasses. 

At her age, she is still single and without responsibility. Her sole responsibilty is her brother who is disabled. She attends to him before she goes to work. She looks forward to working with Manuela Ramos so as to continue consolidating her business more.

She works nearly all day and goes home at night to rest and see how her brother is doing, as being a caring sister she worries that he lacks for nothing.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad is a 42-year-old mother of two sons and two daughters.

Four years ago, Suad bought a sewing machine and started a small business at home sewing clothes and curtains to add another income source to the family. Now Suad has applied for a loan in order to buy another sewing machine to be able to raise her productivity level and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Flora Alicia

texts.es:
Flora, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. tortilla, este negocio tiene 10 años D. estarlo administrando, aprendió en su familia a hacer las tortillas, para luego en su propio hogar este oficio le ha permitido tener ingresos para solventar las necesidades D. la familia.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. materiales como maíz, leña, cal, permitiéndole esta compra abastecer el inventario y teniendo una mayor capacidad para atender la demanda.
La aspiración D. Flora es que a través del negocio pueda sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Flora lives with her husband and three children.  She dedicates herself to making and selling tortillas.  She has been managing her business for 10 years, having learned how to make tortillas from her family.  Later, from her home, this traD. has allowed to generate income to help support the family’s needs.  

Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy materials such as corn, wood, and lime.  This purchase allows her to supply her inventory, and facilitates her ability to better tend to customer demand.  

Through her business, Flora aspires to help get her children ahead.

loans.use: buy corn, wood, and lime.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: La señora Blanca Azucena  solicita  un préstamo para reparar paredes de su casa de afuera ya que algunas tienen cuarteaduras y hoyos en algunos lados de la vivienda. Blanca Azucena quiere prevenirse antes  que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. Ella tiene 3 dependientes económicos de los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y para poder cubrir los gastos trabajan en maquiladora 10 horas diarias de Lunes a Viernes. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción como lo es cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Mrs. Blanca Azucena is requesting a loan to repair the outside walls of her home, since some of them are cracked and pitted. Blanca Azucena wants to fix the problem before it gets worse and she has to spend even more money on it. She has three dependents to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. In order to be able to cover their costs she works 10 hours a day in a maquiladora, Monday to Friday. In order to make her repairs, she needs to buy construction materials such as cement and sand, and to pay for the labour.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair some walls.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Mrs. Chi is 32 years old and is a loving mother of 4 single children, living in Kompong Speu province. She has worked for a garment factory as a part of the sewing staff since 2000. From this business, she typically gets a monthly salary of $65. Her husband is a local policeman in the province. 

Mrs. Chi wants to take out this loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband. This loan will enable her husband’s business to run smoothly. Mrs. Chi wishes to provide her children with great opportunities to join university after they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo e invertirlo en mercadería para surtir el negocio, su intención es tener siempre los productos que los clientes le demanden, para satisfacer los gustos y obtener mejores ventas e ingresos para su familia; su compra sera en detergentes, productos no perecederos como enlatados, arroz, frijoles, azucar, cafe instantaneo, sopas instantaneas y mas.
El está agradecido por este apoyo que le permite fortalecer su negocio y hasta el momento ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Edwin is asking for a new loan to stock his store with merchandise. His goal is to always have the products that his customers want, to satisfy their taste and improve his sales and income for his family. He will purchase detergents, non-perishable goods like canned goods, rice, beans, sugar, instant coffee, instant soups, and other things. 

He is grateful for the support that helps him strengthen his business and so far has been very punctual in his payments.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, rice, beans, sugar, instant coffee and instant soups.

loans.name: Aleu

texts.en: Aleu is a 40-year-old married man with three children. He has been engaged in the farming business for over ten years. He is a very industrious and patient father. He works hard to provide for the necessities of his family. Aleu is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm business. In the future, he hopes that his business will expand to provide good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm business

loans.name: Remedio

texts.en:
Remedio, aged 50, is a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Jesselyn, a caregiver and mother to their three children. The eldest child is already in high school while the other two are still at home. Remedio, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remedio operates a rolling store. His rolling store is basically a small household products store, which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails, plastic flowers and basins to the local neighborhood. He drives the rolling store within the local community to sell the products. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy pails, plastic-ware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers and other items to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Remedio hopes that his business will continue to be successful and dreams of having a permanent store. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God that he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy stocks of plastic-ware products and other items needed in his business

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es: María Dolores tiene 40 años de edad y vive en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar, el cual está conformado por su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 18, 10 y 7 años de edad. Los tres se encuentran estudiando y son la inspiración de la señora  María. Ella se dedica al comercio de perfumería tanto para dama como para caballero. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en su hogar de residencia el cual  ha sabido adecuar de acuerdo a las instalaciones de su casa de tal forma que pueda atraer la atención de los clientes. La señora María es muy reconocida en la zona donde habita ya que se caracteriza ´por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y sobre todo honesta. Muchas personas prefieren sus productos ya que ofrece variedad, calidad y buenos precios. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos de la señora María, esto la impulsa a estar muy atenta y muy pendiente del rumbo de su negocio es decir trata la manera de estar siempre un paso delante de la competencia de tal forma que su negocio sea el líder en perfumería  en la zona. Todo esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL institución con la cual está muy agradecida por la ayuda económica que le brindo en el pasado para establecer su negocio. En esta ocasión solicita este préstamo para la compra de variedad de perfumería de tal forma de que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan y estén satisfechos con su servicio. De esta manera espera vender más productos y   mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia; principalmente a sus hijos que cada día sus necesidades son más grandes.
texts.en:
María Dolores is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her family, which is made up of her life partner and their three children, ages 18, 10 and 7. All three children are in school, and they are María's inspiration.

She sells perfumes for both men and women. Her business is located in her house, and she has been able to adapt the business to the facilities in her house so she can attract the attention of her customers. In the area where she lives, María is very well-known for being a hardworking, responsible woman and above all an honest woman. Many people prefer her products since she offers variety, quality and good prices.

This business is María's main source of income. That motivates her to be very attentive and always watching the business's direction. In other words, she is always looking to be a step ahead of the competition so her business will be the area leader in perfumes. All this has led her to ask INTEGRAL for a loan. She is very grateful to the institution for the economic help it gave her in the past to start her business.

This time she is asking for the loan to buy a variety of perfumes so her customers always find what they are looking for and so they are satisfied with her service. In this way she hopes to sell more products and increase her income, which will allow her to offer better living conditions to her family, especially her children, whose needs grow everyday.

loans.use: to buy perfume.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Rosalia has a pigpen and she sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rosalia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 43 year old married woman who has 3 family members from Marka Amman Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell, she wants to expand her project.In the future she would like to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: El joven Álvaro tiene 19 años de edad, vive en su casa de su mama, no tiene hijos, es un joven que quiere superarse económicamente para tener un futuro mejor. Este año terminó el colegio y quiere estudiar Administración Agropecuaria en la Universidad. Actualmente él se dedica a la siembra de maíz blando, maní colorado y ají rojo en terrenos alquilados,  el diario vivir de Álvaro es muy sacrificado y agotador ya que son varias actividades que tiene que atender teniendo el cuidado de no perjudicar sus estudios.  Los ingresos que obtienen no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de sus estudios, por ese motivo el tomo la decisión de solicitar un crédito para  aumentar la siembra de maíz, aprovechando la disponibilidad de terrenos de su madre y hermano, que están de acuerdo en alquilarle. Con esta inversión él quiere mejorar sus ingresos que le permitirán seguir estudiando  y tener un futuro mejor que le permita formar una familia digna.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 19 years old, lives in his mother's house, and does not have children.  He is a young man who wants to succeed financially so that he can have a better future.  He finished high school this year and wants to study Agricultural Administration at the university.  

Currently he works planting soft corn, peanuts, and red peppers on rented land.  Álvaro's daily life is tiring and he makes many sacrifices since there are activities he has to do while being careful to not harm his studies.  The income he ears is not enough to cover the cost of his studies, so he decided to request a loan to increase his corn crop.  He plans to make the land available to his mother and brother who agree to rent them.  

With this investment, he wants to improve his income so that he can continue to study and have a better future that will allow him to have a respectable family.

loans.use: to prepare the land and purchase agrochemicals.

loans.name: El Buen Provecho Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por cinco socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Maritza mujer de 42 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos de 17 y 11 años, su negocio es la venta de cajeta y comida desde hace 16 años. Su hijo mayor y su compañero le ayudan a elaborar las cajetas que las comercializara posteriormente ambulante, es cliente de la institución desde hace 1 año y medio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de coco para las cajetas y materia prima para la comida como carne de res, de pollo, de cerdo, queso, plátano maduro, plátano verde, aceite, arroz, frijoles, leña, carbón, etc. Leslie mujer de 27 años de edad su negocio es la elaboración y venta de cepillos de lavar ropa, Aura mujer de 23 años su negocio la elaboración de cepillos, Elizabeth mujer de 35 años su negocio es la elaboración de cepillos y  Sonia mujer de 28 años y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The group is made up of five enterprising members.  One of them is Maritza, 42.  She's married and has two children, ages 17 and 11.

She has sold "cajeta" [caramelized milk candy] for 16 years.  Her oldest child and her companion help her make the cajeta, which she later sells on foot.  She has been a client of the institution for a year and a half.

She'll invest the loan in buying coconut for the cajeta as well as ingredients such as beef, chicken, pork, cheese, bananas, plantains, oil, rice, beans, firewood, charcoal, etc.

Leslie, 27, makes and sells clothes brushes.  Aura, 23, makes brushes.  Elizabeth, 35, makes brushes.  Sonia, 28, sells cosmetics and new clothing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Nhóm 2-Kim Sơn-Hoàng Giang Group

texts.en:
Thông tin trưởng nhóm	1			
		2	Vui lòng điền tên của khách hàng	Nguyệt	
		3	khách hàng là nam hay nữ?	Nữ	
		4	khách hàng bao nhiêu tuổi?	38	
		5	Tình trạng hôn nhân của khách hàng? 	Có gia đình	
		6	khách hàng có bao nhiêu con?	2	
		8a	Vui lòng điền năm mà khách hàng trở thành thành viên MFI 	2008	
		8b	Công việc kinh doanh chính của khách hàng HIỂN TẠI là gì? 	Nông Nghiệp	Chăn nuôi gia cầm, gia súc 
		11	Khách hàng tham gia vào công việc kinh doanh chính của mình được bao nhiêu năm? 	>10	
		12	Liệt kê ra 3 điều khách hàng mong ước nhất hoạc cần nhất? 		
			i.	Làm ăn tốt hơn	
			ii.	Sản phẩm làm ra bán được với giá cao	
			iii.	Gia đình khoẻ mạnh, hạnh phúc	
			Khách hàng sống trong khu vực nào?	Nông Thôn	
			Tên của huyện/thị xã?	Huyện Nông Cống 	
			Chủ kỳ vay	4	
			Khách hàng có phải người dân tộc thiểu số không?	Kinh	
			Hoàn cảnh kinh tế	Hộ kinh tế trung bình	
			Những khó khăn (ngoài thiếu vốn)	Nhu cầu thị trường thấp	
			Ngoài TCVM TH, khách hàng có thể vay vốn ở nguồn khác không?	Có thể	
			Hoàn cảnh gia đình trước khi tham gia TCVMTH (điều kiện kinh tế, thu nhập, nguồn nước uống/sinh hoạt, nhà vệ sinh)	Điều kiện kinh tế trung bình, chưa có nhà vệ sinh tự hoại	
			Sau khi tham gia TCVMTH, anh/chị đã/dự định sử dụng vốn vay để tạo thu nhập như thế nào	Mua thức ăn chăn nuôi, mua con giống

loans.use: vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en: I am 50 years old says                Mrs. Modupe E..  Because of my deep love for children, I decided to invest in children’s clothes ten year ago. I need $400 to support my business.

loans.use: To buy more baby wears for sale

loans.name: Hélène

texts.en:
Born on September 19, 1977 in Lomé, Mrs. Hélène N. is married to an automechanic with whom she has three (03) children. Although she has a very average education, she has a business of selling cloths which helps her husband with the household needs, since his work is not very successful.

A courageous and dynamic woman, rigorous and a good manager of finances, she would like to increase her capital to purchase cloths in the department stores and increase her profit that will in turn help her with her family's needs. She is asking for a $500 loan, which will help her buy and sell high-quality loincloths.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 19 septembre 1977 à Lomé, Madame N. Hélène s’est mariée à un mécanicien de voiture avec qui elle a eu trois (03) enfants. Commerçante de pagnes avec un niveau d’étude très moyen, elle aide son mari dans les charges du foyer, les activités de ce dernier ne marchent pas tellement. Femme courageuse, dynamique, rigoureuse et dotée d’une capacité de gestion des finances, elle désire augmenter son fonds de commerce pour s’approvisionner en pagnes dans les grands magasins afin de réaliser un profit maximum pour mieux aider son mari dans les charges du foyer. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un financement de $500 qui lui permettra d'acheter et de vendre des pagnes de grande qualité.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase storage tanks for his dairy farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her tomato business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Mrs. Elizabeth O. is 32 years old, married and a mother of two children. She is a leader of one of LAPO's unions.  She is currently in the 4th stage of a loan. She has a tailoring shop and also sells provisions. She is an industrious woman that has the zeal to boost her business.  In addition, she has 6 years of experience in running a business and hopes to buy more crates of drinks and tailoring materials with a US $400 loan.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials and crates of drinks

loans.name: Isabelina

texts.en:
Ms. Isabelina A. is 29 years old, married and has two children. Her husband sells a variety of merchandise to other vendors in neighborhoods near Limpio, Paraguay, where they live. Both Isabelina and her husband work hard to ensure the success of their store. Their two children also help in the store when they are not studying.

Isabelina has had her despensa, or convenience store, for five years. It is located in a new neighborhood of the city of Limpio. The store has been very well received. As of right now, Isabelina wishes to improve her store and expand business, which will therefore improve her own life and the lives of her children. She has used the help that she has received from the Foundation to purchase merchandise, especially meat and cleaning products, which are unavailable in other establishments in this part of the city.

Isabelina’s dream is that she will continue to improve her store and be able to provide a good education for her children. She wants to ensure that her children have the opportunities that she never had.

loans.use: To buy sugar, yerba mate (tea), noodles, sodas and other common products.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Gulbahor is 44 years old. She is married and is raising 4 children. Her husband works, and Gulbahor also has a business at the local market. Her range consists of small goods. She has been working with MicroInvest-Tajikistan for more than a year. She is hoping to receive a loan in order to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Гулбахор 44 года, она замужем и воспитывает 4 детей. Ее муж тоже работает, а сама Гулбахор занимается бизнесом на местном рынке. Ее ассортимент составляют мелкие товары. С Микроинвест сотрудничает более 1 года. она собирается получить новый займ для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S., 32, makes baskets and typically earns about $2 each day. Her husband is a mobile construction foreman who earns about $6 per day. Mrs. Heng S. has four children. Two of them are enrolled in school and two are too young to attend school.

She would like to use this loan to to purchase bamboo to make more baskets to sell. She will use some of the loan to build the rest of her house and install tiles and a roof to protect the family from flooding during the rainy season.

loans.use: Purchase bamboo to create more baskets to sell

loans.name: Upper Kawuga A(2061) A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is K. Khadija. She is currently in the business of selling used clothing and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to increase her inventory stock. K. is 29 years old and she is married. She has 3 children ranging in ages from 2 to 10. All three of her children go to school. Each week, K. makes approximately UGX 30,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to buy new cloth materials and fabrics.

K. is joined in her small group by Justine Nabbagala, Prossy N., Prossy T., and Teddy N.. Justine Nabbagala is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to purchase a new sewing machine. Prossy N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to add to her stock. Prossy T. is currently in the business of selling firewood. She is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to start a charcoal business. Teddy N. is currently in the business of selling hardware and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to increase the stock in her hardware shop.

loans.use: To expand the businesses

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin T. is a low-income vulnerable person. He is 20 years old and lives in the Saatli town in the south-central area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Elchin rents a small shop in the local bazaar of Saatli town and sells food. The business is very successful but he needs capital to increase the inventory of his shop. Elchin has no collateral to apply to the commercial banks. That's why he applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan of $500. This credit would allow him to buy and sell more goods and to provide himself with the necessities of life.

loans.use: To increase the volume of his grocery business

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema K., age 54, is married and has 6 children (ages 30, 28, 26, 20, 18 and 14). Her business is a function hall, where she sells soft drinks and beer. She started the business 4 years ago. She works from 6am to 1am daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $424.

In the past, Gema has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase on business. She hopes for a new loan to buy chairs, tables, and empty crates for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, tables, and empty crates for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Luque Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreuneuring Women called “La Esperanza” (hope) decided to amplify the number of members. They set up a meeting and invited many friends from the town. There they shared with these women their previous experiences in the committee and explained to them how the committee changed their lives. Their hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and a new committee emerged - “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women).

The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women members of a committee the energy and motivation to reach success.

The committee is formed by 17 women whose entrepreneurial activities include: sewing workshops, grocery stores, hair salons, sales of cloths, perfumes, chipas, food, drinks, lingerie, medicines and candies.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of: outfits, drinks, fabrics, threads, lingerie, meat, vegetables, oil, bread, napkins, natural medicines, bijouterie, flour, eggs, cheese, shampoo and others.

loans.use: Purchase of: outfits, drinks, fabrics, threads, lingerie, meat, vegetables, oil, bread, napkins, natural medicines, bijouterie, flour, eggs, cheese, shampoo.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco owns a grocery store where he offers a great diversity and great quantity of products.  Grocery stores in Paraguay are considered very lucrative businesses because they are a meeting point for people in rural areas of the country. 

Francisco’s wife’s reparation payment allowed them to collect the sum of money to be able to open their small venture.  Occasionally, Francisco sells merchandise as a traveling salesman. 

Francisco’s family is made up of his wife and his two children who go to school.  All of the members of his family help at the store in their free time.  The money from this loan will be used to purchase products for the store such as flour, pastas and oil among other things.   Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.


Francisco es dueño de una despensa donde ofrece una gran diversidad y cantidad de productos. Las despensas en Paraguay son consideradas negocios muy lucrativos, porque para la gente de las zonas rurales del país las despensas consisten en un punto de encuentro. 
El pago de indemnización de la esposa de Francisco fue lo que les permitió reunir toda la suma de dinero para poder abrir la microempresa. Ocasionalmente Francisco se dedica a vender mercaderías de forma ambulante. 
La familia de Francisco esta conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos que van al colegio. Todos los miembros de la familia ayudan en la despensa en sus horas libres. 
El dinero proveído por el crédito será utilizado en la compra de mercaderías para la despensa tales como harina, fideos, aceite entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, rice, pasta, cooking oil, milk products, meat, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Maria is an innovative person who is always looking for a way to improve her business. She has 3 children: Carlos Jesús, a 22-year-old college student, Brenda Lizeth, a 14-year-old middle school student, and Juan David, an 8-year-old elementary school student.

Because she lacked a steady job that would allow her to earn an income, she decided to start a business. She has always liked to be a responsible person who wishes to give each of her children a college education so that they can have better opportunities in life.

She started back in March of 2002, selling tacos in front of her house. She later set up a space on the corner of her house, where she was able to arrange some tables and chairs for her customers’ comfort. Starting in July of 2005, she started making banquets for all occasions, and little by little, she was able to obtain china and flatware with the profits from the taco sales, thus offering a more complete service.

She needs a loan of $975.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase the supplies she needs to make tacos and to purchase table cloths so that she does not have to rent them, thus increasing her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es una persona innovadora que siempre está viendo la forma de mejorar su negocio. Tiene 3 hijos: Carlos Jesús de 22 años estudiante universitario, Brenda Lizeth, 14 años, estudiante de secundaria y Juan David, de 8 años, estudiante de primaria.

Ante la falta de un empleo seguro y estable que le permitiera tener un ingreso decidio emprender su negocio, ya que siempre le ha gustado ser una persona responsable y desea darles una carrera universitaria a cada uno de sus hijos para que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.

Comenzó en Marzo de 2002, vendiendo taquitos en la parte de enfrente de su casa, posteriormente acondiciono un lugar en la esquina de su casa donde se pudo instalar mejor acomodando algunas mesas y sillas para que los clientes pudieran estar mas cómodos. A partir de Julio de 2005 comenzó a elaborar banquetes para todo tipo de fiestas y poco a poco fue adquiriendo loza y cubiertos con las ganancias que le dejaban la venta de tacos y de esta manera puedo dar un servicio mas completo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus tacos y poder comprar también manteles y no tener que rentarlos, de esta forma obtendra mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She sells foodstuffs and drinks and she has been in this business since 1999. She learnt this business for 2 years. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more provisions and drinks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Abdulwosah

texts.en:
Abdulwosah is an uneducated man who works in agriculture. He lives in a household of 9 members, including his brother's family. Wosah lost his brother during the war in Kabul, 6 years ago. He is also supporting his brother's family. He has been involved in agriculture for more than 10 years. He used to be able to support his two families well, but things are not very good now. He is faced with lots of economic difficulties in his family, so he wants to expand his business.

He needs money here to expand his business to help these two families. He wants to take out an individual loan to complete his seed stock and ready all his land for cultivation to work hard and make a better income to support his family.

He is happy about this loan. He would like to thank Kiva and the lenders that make this opportunity possible in this poor country where people are faced with lots of problems. He hopes to be successful in his business in the future.

loans.use: To complete his seed stock

loans.name: Ruly Mary

texts.es:
Ruly es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales. Ruly es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Ruly junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de peones a quienes renumera de acuerdo a la producción, sus ventas lo realiza en el mismo lugar y también lo reparte a domicilio. Ruly en algunas oportunidades se dedica a la agricultura de verduras variadas.

Ruly necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña y el pago de peones. Ruly sueña con mejorar su negocio, tener capital propio, construir su casa de material noble y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ruly is a member of the Trigales (The Wheatfields) village bank. Ruly is 32 years old with two children and works with her husband manufacturing handcrafted bricks in the Compania community, which is 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. They hire some day laborers to assist them who they pay depending on their production. They sell the bricks in the same locale where they're produced but also deliver them directly to their customers. Sometimes, Ruly will also work growing and selling various vegetables. Ruly needs a loan of $675 which she will invest in the purchase of firewood and in the payment of day laborers. Ruly hopes to grow her business, have her own capital, build a legitimate house and that her children will grow to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood and payment of day laborers

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Mohira Z. is married and has two small children.  When she realized that her husband needed help feeding and housing their family, she began selling men's clothes and shoes at a local market.  One each week, Mohira purchases goods from another city at wholesale prices and sells them at retail prices to her clients.  In order to increase her upfront purchases and turnover rate, Mohira is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long T., 36, is married and has 4 children, one of whom works, two are students, while the youngest one is still too young to attend school. She lives in the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Since 1996, she has been earning income making and selling different types of baskets - a skill that she learned from her parents. Long T.'s average earnings are US$2 per day, while her husband, working as a construction worker, makes US$5 per day. The couple is also supported by one of their children who works as cleaner. In a typical month, the family spends around US$45  on food, US$7 on utilities, US$15 on their children’s education, and US$10 on transportation.
Currently, Long T. would like to take out a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Bulera Development Group

texts.en:
Francis L. is one of the executive members of Bulera Development Group in Mityana. He is a farmer with plantations of matooke (plantains), beans, maize, and groundnuts both for sale and home consumption. In addition to this, he has animals which include cows, goats, and pigs that have over the time helped him in increasing his income.

This is the sixth time he is seeking a loan from Pearl Micro-finance and he is happy that these loans have been fruitful for his business and family. Francis would like a loan to help him with employing labor on his farm and plantations for improved yield come next season.

loans.use: paying for labor on his farmland

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Hường  25 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương ngoài chăn nuôi chị Hường còn đầu tư vốn để thu mua phế liệu. Công việc phát triển thuận lợi đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập ổn định. Hiện nay ngoài  thu mua phế liệu gia đình chị còn có thêm nghề rửa xe máy nên kinh tế đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hường mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua phế liệu về tái chế lại và cung cấp cho các nhà sản xuất.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Hường, 25 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2004. Since becoming a member of the Fund, Mrs. Hường has been able to start a recycling business in addition to raising animals. Her business collecting scrap materials has grown steadily and now brings in a dependable income for her family. And recently, her family has been able to start yet another small business washing motorbikes, so that their total monthly income has risen to 3,500,000 VND (204 USD). In the next lending cycle, Mrs.Hường hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to invest in buying up recyclable scrap materials which she can sell to industrial producers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Recycling scrap materials

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Justina es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Justina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado cerca al mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes al por mayor y menor. Además Justina se dedica a la siembra de papa en sus terrenos propios.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 3400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra d azúcar y arroz.
Los sueños de Justina son seguir trabajando y hacer mas grande su negocios, sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Justina is a partner of the Communal Bank called "Musuq Rumi" which means New Stone in Quechuan. Justina is a live-in partner; she is 45 years old and she has 3 children. Justina has a shop in a rented premises located close to the wholesale food market of the city of Ayacucho, where she sells wholesale and retail groceries. Justina also sows potatoes in her own land. Justina needs a loan of 3400 soles ($1050) and she will use the money to buy sugar and rice. Justina's dream is to keep on working and to make her business grow and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Fagbemi

texts.en: Fegbemi O. is 38 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and their only child.  Each day, Fagbemi sells a variety of foodstuffs in a market to many regular customers.  In order to expand his business and increase his profit, Fagbemi is requesting a loan of $700, which he will use to purchase a greater number of food items for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en: P. is the leader of a group of three borrowers. She is the mother of three children; all of them are students. She is married to Oliryae, 41, who works as a teacher in a secondary school. P. has been selling several kinds of sweets in the market since 2002. She is good at making a tasty sweet and she earns a good income for her family. She now wants to upgrade her transportation. So she is taking a loan to buy a tourist car for her and her family. The other group members are S., 34, who works in the hospital as a cleaner and is applying for a loan to buy a water pump for her husband's farm; and M., 48, who sells vegetables in the market and is looking for a loan to invest in her business. They all live in Battambang Province, Cambodia. P.'s granddaughter is also in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a tourist car for her and her family

loans.name: Iris Jisseye

texts.es:
La Sra. Iris Castellanos es perito mercantil y contador publico, cuenta con un negocio de utiles escolares y trabajos secretariales, encuadernados y laminados, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y gracias a Dios todo les esta saliendo bien. ella tiene mucha experiencia en las actividades que realiza en su negocio.
es importante mensionar que ella vive con su madre y es la responsable de los gastos de su mama en vista que su madre es de la tercera edad y no es conveniente que trabaje por su edad. ella se siente muy agradecida con su madre porque por un gran sacrificio logro que ella se graduara, siendo madre soltera la saco adelante. 
su mayor anhelo es instalar un ciber cafe grande y ella confia en Dios que lo va a lograr en corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iris Castellanos is a commercial technician and a public accountant. For 2 years she has been in the business of school supplies, secretarial work, binding and laminating. Thanks to God, everything is going well. She has a lot of experience with the work. It is important to mention that she lives with her mother, and she is responsible for her mother’s expenses. In light of the fact that her mother is elderly, it is not advisable that she work at her age. Iris feels very grateful to her mother because she sacrificed a lot as a single mother so that Iris could graduate and get ahead. Her biggest goal is to open a cyber café. She puts her trust in God, and she believes she will achieve this goal in a short amount of time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of photo copier, buy pencils,cards, staples, paper, markers, folders, and more

loans.name: Lutfillo

texts.en:
K. Lutfillo is 38 years old. He is married and the father of 5 children. Lutfillo is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Lutfillo is in agribusiness for more than 13 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. His loving wife is also engaged in this business. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money for the well-being of his family. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni. With the desire to realize his plan, Lutfillo appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a computer, programs and books

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Husain is a 23 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Hussain has owned a barber shop for four years. Hussain requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a new seat and beauty products for his salon. This is the first time that Hussain has requested a loan. 
Hussain is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty starting his business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hussain will use the loan to purchase a new seat and beauty products for his salon.

loans.name: Gullomiddin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 

Гулломиддин мужчина в возрасте 48 лет имеет троих детей.Он вместе с женой имеет высшее образование.Сам работает в сельской школе директором , а жена учительница начальных классов.Гулломиддин из-за мизерной заработной платы дополнительно занимается куплей и продажей скота.У него сейчас две коровы и три барана.Для увеличения бизнеса откорма и продажи скота хочет получить в Арванде кредит.На снимке Гулломиддин в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Gullomiddin is 48 years old and has three children. His wife and he have a higher education. He works as a principal at the local school, and his wife is an early grades teacher. Because of the miserly salary, Gullomiddin is also involved in livestock sales. He currently has two cows and three rams. He wants to obtain a loan from Arvand in order to expand his business. The photograph shows Gullomiddin on the disbursement day.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
La señora María Esther tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, en el departamento de la Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, cerveza y ropa. Cuando inició en Manuela Ramos empezó con la venta de productos de belleza, luego, pasado un año y medio, empezó con la venta de cerveza, negocio que creció con el apoyo de su padre y del Movimiento Manuela  Ramos, ahora se mantiene muy bien en su negocio, reconoce que tiene momentos difíciles pero que ha aprendido a salir adelante, lo que le permite invertir en diferentes productos, hasta invertir en la venta de ropa. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Sus productos de belleza los obtiene mediante catálogos, la cerveza la provee la fabrica distribuidora de cerveza y su mercadería (ropa) la compra en la ciudad de Lima. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 S. que recibió de su Banco Comunal Virgen de Fátima, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza de catálogos para su stock.
Con este crédito de 700 S., lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como ropa y cerveza.
María tiene como sueño instalar un bazar en donde pueda ofrecer las prendas de vestir con total comodidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Esther is 48 years old and lives in the Moche District of Trujillo Province, Department of Libertad, Peru. She completed her elementary school education and has 3 children who are financially dependent on her.

María sells beauty products, beer and clothing. When she started with Manuela Ramos, she began selling beauty products and, a year and a half later, also began selling beer. She has been able to grow her business with the help of her father and the support of Manuela Ramos. Her business is doing well, but she admits that she has had some difficult moments and has learned to keep moving forward. She would like to offer different products and invest in selling more clothes. María’s business is located in her home.

Her beauty products are ordered through catalogs, beer is acquired from a distributor, and her clothing stock is purchased in the city of Lima. With her first loan of 300 S., provided by the Virgen de Fátima Communal Bank Group, she ordered beauty products from catalogs to increase her inventory.

She is now requesting a loan of 700 S. to buy more merchandise, such as clothing and beer. María dreams of opening a boutique where her customers can shop for clothing in total comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and beer

loans.name: Абдучалил

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Абдучалил мужчина 52 лет, который кредитуется с 2006 года.Он проживает и торгует на рынке города Костакоза.Его ассортимент составляют разные головные платки и шарфы.Для закупа шифоновых платков Абдучалил хочет получить очередной кредит.На снимке Абдучалил в день подачи заявки н займ.

loans.use: на закуп женских платков

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell breads and fritters

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal El Sol.
Francisca es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, Francisca se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos, que elabora en un horno artesanal de leña, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado Santa Clara.
Francisca necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y leña.
Los sueños de Francisca son mejorar su horno con maquinas modernas.

loans.use: Para la compra de harina y leña.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase alcoholic drinks.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Mrs. Julia S. is 51 years old and married to Romeo S., Sr. They live in Barangay III, Tangub City. She is blessed with eleven children but only four of them live with her because the rest have their own families. For their income, her husband drives their own bicycle with a sidecar, locally known as “trisikad”, with an average income of not less than $3 a day.

On a little parcel of land at Hoyohoy, Tangub City, they cultivated and planted abaca and vegetables from which they earned an average net income of not less than $110 a month. As a fourth-cycle loaner in our coop under the PDP-LP Program, Julia is applying for a loan of Php 3,000 to finance her mini-abaca plantation in the highlands of Tangub City. She is hoping that someday her agri-business will prosper so that she can purchase additional parcel of lands for their abaca culture and production.

loans.use: Cultivation of mini abaca plantation

loans.name: Rekele

texts.en:
Rekele C. sells fish at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil to sell. Rekele is 29 years old and is widowed. She has 4 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
N. Sarah is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a friendly and hardworking lady who is married with four children, the eldest aged 15 years. She also takes care of one sibling.

Sarah has a retail shop in Salama that she has been running for some time now. She is happy that, through using loans, she is able to make considerable profits through the increased stock. She has been successful because she is able to treat her customers well.

In future, Sarah wishes for the shop to expand more so that paying her children’s school fees is no trouble. She needs a loan to be able to boost her business so that she can make more profits from it.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 47-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Gil who is engaged in a trucking business and they have five children of whom most are presently studying. Their family lives in the village of Sitio Guingab, Tumauini, Isabela.

Carmelita ventures into the selling of various kinds of soap in her village and from her business she generates an income that is enough to meet the needs of their children.

Carmelita is borrowing PHP 5,000 to use as additional capital to buy more soaps for her retailing business. She hopes to obtain her loan to purchase more items to offer to her customers. It will surely make her business more profitable.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to purchase more soap to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old and married with four children between the ages of four and 13. All her children go to school. She resides in a rented four room house where she stays with eight people. Mary takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water, and gets three meals a day.

Mary works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She incurs transport costs to and from buying charcoal from villages. Mary has a charcoal store in Ndeeba town and pays 30000/= for monthly rent charges. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 30 customers a day and sells to all categories of people, both in wholesale and retail. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, medication and school fees. Her major business challenges are transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching out to her because she works in an area that floods. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for three years, now servicing her tenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She aspires to see her business grower bigger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Tusooka Kwavula Group 1, Lugazi

texts.en: Jane N. is 48 years old and married with four children of ages that range from 10 to 22 years old. They are all in secondary and primary school. She also takes care of her parents. Jane has had a restaurant in the Kitega commercial centre for fifteen years and she is able to make 200,000/= as weekly profits from her food sales. Before opening up a restaurant, Jane was an accountant and her income could not sustain her family like it does today. She says that she is successful because of her loans that help her restock more food stuffs and enable her to buy new utensils. She also has good customer care skills displays her products to her customers. She hopes to become a wholesaler in the future and also hopes to help her children attain higher levels of education. Jane needs a loan to increase her business capital so that she can have a steady supply of products for her customers. She is a very hard-working woman.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs for increased stock.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Madame Mariama D. est une femme mariée, âgée de 45 ans, qui habite a Ouakam et évolué  dans le milieu du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle vit dans une famille  dans le village de   Ouakam dont la particularité est que tous les membres sont des pêcheurs. Par conséquent la procuration en poissons n’est pas chose difficile pour elle.
Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour renforcer son capital  .Ainsi elle pourra se procurer de bons poissons très recherchée  par la classe la plus favorisée  de la population. Son  financement lui permettra de progresser dans son activité  et d’accroitre ses revenus. Elle  est mariée  et mère  de 6 enfants. L’assistance de son mari ne lui permet pas de couvrir toutes les dépenses. Par conséquent   avec ses bénéfiques  elle va pouvoir gérer  les gouters  des enfants, leur habillement et certaines dépensés  extra.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique apprécié
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama D. is a 45 year-old married woman, who lives in Ouakam and has advanced in the commercial world for more than ten years. She lives in a family in the village of Ouakam, and the particularity of this family is that all its members are fishermen. Consequently it is not difficult for her to get fish. She is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs to strengthen her capital. She will thereby be able to get hold of good fish which are much sought-after by the most favoured class of the population. This funding will allow her to develop her business and increase her income. She is married and has six children. The participation from her husband does not allow her to cover all the expenses. Consequently, with her profits she will be able to afford the children's snacks, their clothing and certain other expenses. In its ongoing vision of participating actively to the battle against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the backing of its lenders, is successfully providing support to people to carry out lucrative income generating activities; this will in turn contribute to a welcome socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Ana Guadalupe tiene 43 años de edad, casada y con un hijo, su esposo trabaja como supervisor  en una gasolinera esso, el negocio de ella es la venta de prenda de plata como oro laminado, ropa, zapatos, desde hace seis años se dedica solo a su venta, cuando inicio lo hizo con parte de su liquidación  de trabajo y con el apoyo de su esposo para poder ayudar a cubrir los gastos de alimentación, ya que todo esta caro y hay que tener la iniciativa de obtener mejores entradas para poder subsistir y poder lograr los objetivos propuestos. Por falta de capital no tiene ropa solo prendas es por eso necesita invertir en ropa para uniformes para poder vender como: faldas, camisas, pantalones, calcetas, camisolines y comprar variedad de prendas para aumentar el inventario del negocio el cual espera a largo plazo llegar  atener una pequeña tienda en su casa. Contenta con el financiamiento ya que gracias a este préstamo comprara la mercadería para vender y sastifacer al cliente con las necesidades, ya que muchas de estas prendas las da al crédito de la quincena debido a la falta económica de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana Guadalupe is 43 years old. She is married with a son. Her husband works as supervisor at an Esso gas station. Her business is selling silver jewelry items such as gold laminate as well as clothing and shoes. She has been engaged solely in selling for six years. When she started, she did it with a part of the severance from her job. With the support of her husband, she was able to help cover living expenses, since everything is expensive and you must have initiative to get better income and be able to get by and obtain your goals. Due to a lack of funds, she has no clothing, only jewelry. This is why she neds to invest in clothing for uniforms to be able to sell such as: skirts, shirts, pants, socks, undershirts, and to purchase a variety of clothing to grow the business' inventory. Her long term goal is to have a little store at her house. She is happy with the financing since thanks to this loan she will purchase merchandise to sell and satisfy clients with what they need. She sells a lot of the jewelry on two week credit due to the financial need of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school uniform clothing such as: skirts, socks, and various jewelry items for her clients.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn R., age 47, is a long-term businesswoman who currently resides with her other family members in a wooden house located in a commune, in the province of Siem Reap. Here she owns a small business buying and selling mature rice. In addition, she raises pigs fR. home to earn extra profit. She is married with four children, two of whom are married and the remaining two are single.

Her husband, the chief provider for the family, buys cows to fatten for a while before selling them to earn income. Yoeurn R. is requesting a loan to increase the financial capital for her rice and animal trading.

loans.use: To increase financial capital for her rice and animal trading

loans.name: God's Will Group

texts.en:
Kuku D. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called God's Will. She is 35 years old and married with 5 children, aged 1-16 years old.  Their educational levels are kindergarten to 10th grade. Kuku was not able to attend school due to poverty. She and her family live in the Bernard Farm community in Paynesville, Liberia. 
 
Kuku's business is the sales of fish. She buys her fish wholesale from fishermen and sells retail on a tabletop to residents of her community in Paynesville.  She has been running her business for 5 years and hopes to grow her fish business in the future.

Talking to her customers in a nice manner is the secret to Kuku's success in business.  Kuku will use this loan to purchase additional fish for resale.  She dreams of providing her children with a good education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kuku is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for resale.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena se dedica a la venta de ropa ya que anteriormente trabajaba en la zona franca como obrera  y al cerrar estas ella se dedico a esta actividad la cual tiene 3 años de experiencia ella es madre soltera única sostén de su hija.
Las ventas las realizas por encargos ya que ella distribuye muestra en revista y las personas que miran y le gustan las muestras se las encargan.
Este crédito es para la compra de ropa de verano ya que se acerca dicha época en este sector y donde tiene ya productos encargados
texts.en:
María Elena sells clothing; she used to work in the tax-free zone as a laborer. When it shut down she started selling clothes; she's been in this line of work for 3 years now. She is a single mother and the only source of support for her daughter. Her sales are based on prior orders. She shows samples in magzines to her customers who look them over and decide what they want to order from her. She will use the funds to buy Summer clothing because the season is about to start in this area and she already has pending orders on hand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long O. is a 43-year-old married mother who resides in a commune located in Kompong Tom province. Here she established a small family home in 1995. To seek a daily profit, Long O. breeds a few pigs in a pigpen next to her house. Additionally she goes to the forest with her husband to carve firewood to sell for extra income. To earn additional income, Long O. needs a loan for capital to accumulate more pigs to raise. Long O. has four children: two are employed and other two are students.

loans.use: To accumulate more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
C. is 26 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for more than six years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is married to Run Sok, 30, who fishes in and around the lakes of his community.

Currently, the quantity of fish caught is declining due to the lack of fishing gear. This is why C. has requested a loan in order to purchase more equipment for her husband to use when fishing. With the rest of the loan, C. will buy an old vehicle to provide transportation for her family. Note: C. was not available for a photograph so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment and a vehicle

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto D., 43, is making sure that his family has enough provisions for their daily needs. He makes sure that he provides well so that his family can have a better life. He has been managing his own fruit stand for quite some time now.

Modesto has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than a year now. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. He is consistent in paying his dues because he uses the money he borrows to expand and improve his business.

Now with your help, he would like to access a 10,000 Philippine peso loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital for his expanding business to buy larger quantities of his regular products and new products needed to continue his business operations. He dreams that his business will continue to grow so that he can have a good and comfortable life with his family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy products needed to continue his business operations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn C., 41, is making sure that her family's daily needs are provided for. Married to Daniel C., an overseas Filipino worker, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Roselyn has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy groceries needed to replenish her current product inventory. 

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also hopes that she will be able to renovate her house because of all her hard work on her business.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries needed to replenish her current product inventory.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mr. Um H. is a middle-age man whose wife we see in this photo. They have three children, all of whom are students who live at home. Um H. makes a living buying and selling rice in bulk. He purchases rice directly from farmers and sells it to middlemen, who then sell it to vendors who offer it for sale in local markets. His wife helps H. in his work, and they both supplement their income by raising pigs and various other crops. Because his livestock business is doing well, he is applying for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and sell. He will also use a portion of the loan to grow his own rice crop during the coming planting season.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell, and plant his own rice crop

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther S. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in the restaurant.  Esther is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is an engineer. She has one child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase more chairs, tables, and foodstuffs in order to expand her restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in the restaurant

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy Q. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. She has been involved in farming for seven years already. She helps her husband maintain their rice farm and sell their harvest to the market. A few years back, she opened a small bake shop located at their house. She says she and her husband decided to venture into this kind of business so they would have another source of income that would sustain their family, especially their children's education. 

Daisy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment and also supplies for her bake shop. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Daisy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment, and also supplies for her bake shop.

loans.name: Robbie

texts.en:
Robbie B. is from the village of Bugo, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 25 years old. Robbie is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Robbie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts in the local community. Robbie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Robbie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robbie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Robbie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell

location.town: Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, de 22 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de sus 3 hermanos. Cada día es nuevo para este joven trabajador que se dedica a las labores agrícolas, siembra papa, arveja y maíz  junto a su padre y hermanos. Desde que era muy pequeño aprendió las técnicas agrícolas necesarias para obtener una buena producción, y le gusta mucho realizar esta labor porque ya se acostumbro a despertarse temprano, y dirigirse a vigilar los cultivos, además se siente cómodo trabajando a lado de su familia, ya que todos juntos siembran y luego cosechan, para tiempo después recoger todos los productos y trasladarlos a comercializar al mercado mayorista de su ciudad, donde ya tienen compradores fijos que les ofrecen regulares precios. Es por eso que esta muy satisfecho con la actividad que realiza, y para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, pues quiere mejorar sus ingresos. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además dice que el trabajo de su grupo comunal marcha bien, pues todos los integrantes son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Walter tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de semillas de arveja, así como, abono y fertilizantes que necesitará  para mejorar  y aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Walter is 22 years old. He lives with his parents and three brother. Every day is new for this young worker who does agricultural work. He plants potatoes, peas and corn with his father and brothers. He learned the farming techniques required to get a good harvest when he was very young, and he loves his work because he is used to getting up early to go and oversee the crops. He also feels comfortable working alongside his family; together they sow, harvest and gather the goods to take them to the wholesale market in their city, where they already have regular customers who offer them fixed prices. That's why he is very content with his job, and in the future he plans to farm in greater quantities in order to improve his income. This is his third loan with MFP and he is very grateful to the people who have made this loan possible as it will enable him ot continue to work. He also says that the work in his loan group is going well, because all members are very responsible in their loan repayments. Walter plans to invest the rquested loan in the purchase of several bags of pea seeds, as well as manure and fertilisers to improve and increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds and bags of fertilisers

loans.name: Chagnaa

texts.en:
Chagnaa C. is a 50 year old widow who lives with her five children in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son, Bayanmunh, attends university and her three youngest children go to the local secondary school.  

Chagnaa has been operating a dairy retail business in her town since 2005. She sells her dairy products at the central market in her town.
