As a secondary income provider, she also purchases sacks of coal for 2,000MNT and resells them for 2,500MNT. She usually sells 6 coal sacks per day. Chagnaa is a very humble and quiet person and she hopes to one day have her own yard for the family's ger. She is requesting a 750,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products for increase her business working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products.

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es: La Sra. Katerine, es una ama de casa emprendedora que decidió emprender su propia actividad económica, montando una pequeña tienda de barrio, la Sra. Katerine cuenta con todo el apoyo de su esposo El Sr.  Miguel ya que desde hace bastante tiempo ella a venido colaborando con los gastos familiares. La Sra.  Katherine se acercó por nuestras instalaciones debido a la necesidad que tenía de ampliar y surtir su tienda, ya que en la zona cuenta con un gran número de clientes. Una vez hecha la investigación correspondiente se procedió a aceptar dicho crédito ya que la Sra. Katerine cuenta con un buen Historial Crediticio y con domicilio conocido en la Zona de la Villa 1ro de Mayo, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Katerine is an entrepreneurial housewife who decided to start her own business by opening a small neighborhood shop. Katerine has the support of her husband, Miguel, since for quite a while she has been helping him with the family's bills. Katerine approached our facilities due to the need to expand and stock her store since she has a great number of customers. Once the corresponding investigation was made, she proceeded to accept the loan since Katerine has a good credit history and has a known address in the May 1 area of town. She is very thankful to the institution for the support provided.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Jorge Ernesto

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Jorge Ernesto A. Herrera, es un cliente que por primera vez el esta trabajado con nosotros, el esta adquiriendo este crédito para comprar hierro estándar  5qq, 100 unidades de piedras canteras y 14 bolsas de cemento y tambien cubrir pago de mano de obra de la construcción en reparación de su vivienda es un asalariado pero tiene la oportunidad de optar del financiamiento y proyectarse
texts.en:
Jorge Ernesto A. Herrera is a client who is working with us for the first time.  He is acquiring this loan to buy 5 quintales (1 quintal=46 kilos) of standard iron rods, 100 paving stones, 14 bags of cement and also to pay labor costs involved in home repairs.

He is a salaried employee but has the opportunity to opt for financing and go forth.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie A. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 47 years old. Josie is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Josie owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for fattening and sale. Josie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells her raised pig.

In 2009, Josie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Josie is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Josie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Esther Wairimu

texts.en:
Esther Wairimu, aged 52 years, is married to Michael, and together they have four children. She lives on one of the estates in the Nairobi Eastlands area, and she sells her traditional wrap-overs and fabrics at the Masai open-air market. She has been in this business for eight years and is a hardworking lady.

Esther was introduced to KADET by one of the credit officers in charge of the Eastlands branch, and she has applied for a loan. She plans to use 25,000 KES to buy more wrap-overs and 25,000 KES to buy traditional fabrics to sell. With the extra income generated Esther plans to add more stock and sell more, as the market operates twice a week on an open-air ground.

Esther's dream is to buy a shop in town from which she can run her business.

loans.use: To buy traditional wrap-overs and fabrics

loans.name: Bernard Wanjohi

texts.en:
Bernard is 41 years old and married to Lucy Wambua. They have three children who wholly depend on them. Bernard has been in the farming industry for a period of 9 years with an income of 15,000 KES a month.

This is his second loan with KADET, and he wants to use the loan to buy fertilizers and pay for weeding and harvesting labour. 

He hopes educate his children and to purchase and own a rice farm, as he is currently leasing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labour for weeding and harvesting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products (beer, soft drinks, eggs, potatoes, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Almakan's Group

texts.en:
Almakan A., 37, is the leader of this group. She is married to a builder. The couple has two sons.  The elder son is 34 and works at a mill, and the younger is still a schoolboy. 
In order to make a living, the family is engaged in poultry keeping. This business makes a small profit during the year. Almakan began this type farming just a year ago. 
In order to increase income, the family intends to purchase 20 hens to produce eggs. For this purpose Almakan needs to get a loan. In the future she wants to develop her business by increasing the total number of hens and by selling eggs.

	 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase hens

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 20 year old single ambitious man from Baalbeck.  Ali has been working as a Tractor driver since 2004.  He owns a tractor and he is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, to do the necessary maintenance to it.  It’s his main source of income.  

Ali didn’t finish his education due to his parent's financial situation.  He works hard on improving his business through buying more tractors and expanding his business.  His clients are people dealing with construction.  They might be neighbors, friends and relatives.  He hopes he can  make his dream come true.

loans.use: To do the necessary maintenance to his tractor.

loans.name: Yuly

texts.es: Yuly, de 26 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rolando (26)  y sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando arduamente esta emprendedora mujer ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos de  café y plátanos  los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, ya lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Para el futuro  espera poder adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café.Es  el tercer préstamo de Yuly con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudara bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes, para mejorar la productividad  de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Yuly is 26 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Rolando (26) and her three young children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through her hard work, this enterprising woman has managed to make progress with her crops.  Every morning she gets up very early to irrigate and care for her coffee and banana crops which she will later sell in the city of Pichanaki since this is where she obtains the best prices for her products.  What she most likes about her work is enjoying the freedom of working in her fields.  She has been in this business for 8 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to work her land.  In the future, she hopes to be able to prepare her land for planting a lot more coffee.

This is Yuly's third loan with MFP.  She knows that this loan will help her in making progress and developing her business and, for this reason, she is prepared to make her loan repayments on time.  Yuly is a very responsible member of her community bank which means that she is very well liked.  She will use the 800 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more manure and fertilizers, to improve the productivity of her land.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers to improve her crops

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”YANAPAKUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. María Raquel; ella tiene 35 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de jugos ella vende de forma ambulatoria la socia realiza diferentes tipos de jugos como de papaya, plátano con leche, fresas con leche entre otros más la socia está feliz ya que este es un negocio extra que tiene ya que la socia también trabaja en un restaurante en el distrito de Cachimayo ella trabaja los fines de semana y los días hábiles esta con su negocio de jugueria aunque este horario puede variar, la socia está feliz con sus dos trabajos ya que mediante estos ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio como papayas, plátanos, naranjas, fresas, entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Maria Raquel. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of one son. She sells fresh fruit drinks itinerantly. She sells various types of drinks such as papaya, banana with milk, strawberries with milk, and others. She is very happy with this extra business. She also has a restaurant business in the district of Cachimayo which she runs on the weekends. On weekdays she carries out the sale of juices although her schedule can change. She is happy to have both jobs because it is through them that she is able to support her family. 

She requests a loan to purchase more ingredients for her business including papayas, bananas, oranges, strawberries, and other products.

She is happy with the loan and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make fresh fruit drinks.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont toutes  mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans et en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à N’TDJILLA un des villages de la sous préfecture de NIENA  région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les calebasse avec  DJENEBOU D.. 
DJENEBOU D.  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  80 calebasses aux  marchés des villages voisins. Les calebasses sont revendus au  marché de T’DJILLA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détails. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Dembagnouma group are all married women, on the average 32 years old, with four children. They live mostly in monogamous families in N’tdjilla, a village in the Sub-prefecture of Niena, Region of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).
They are on their third loan cycle with the microfinance institution Soro Yriwaso, with the goal of being able to meet customer demand. The previous loans have been properly repaid. This women’s group sells various items, for example, gourds, as Djenebou D. does. 

Djenebou D. plans to use her loan to purchase 80 gourds ast the nearby markets. She retails her gourds at the N’tdjilla market and out of her home to a customer base composed of both women and men, for cash. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 15,000 West African Francs, which will be used for everyday family expenses. Her goal is to increase her sales volume by better meeting her customers’ needs.

loans.use: Purchasing gourds

loans.name: Gigilyn

texts.en:
Gigilyn is a married woman who lives in Bais City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a buy and sell business.  Her husband Alejandro, who is 47 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have three children who are 26 to 32 years old. All of them have their own families. Gigilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gigilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 30,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 for additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future renovation of their house. Gigilyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 29 años, vive al lado de su esposo Carlos de 33 años, que es albañil y su hija pequeña; juntos se esfuerzan a diario por salir adelante. Desde hace dos años, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas (papas y hot dog fritos) en su carrito sanguchero que saca todos los días afuera de la casa de su hermano, ya que se ubica dentro de zona muy transitada y comercial. Le gusta mucho su labor, pues le permite trabajar durante pocas horas, de 6 de la tarde a 11 de la noche, y así obtiene buenas ganancias diarias. Dice que prepara todo desde el mediodía sin descuidar sus labores del hogar, pero lo que todavía no ha podido concretar es adecuar un lugar para que sus comensales degusten de sus platillos  con tranquilidad, es por esta razón que le gustaría comprar mesas y sillas en el futuro. Ella necesita invertir el crédito en ingredientes al por mayor para continuar con su negocio sin problemas, además empezará comprando dos  bancas para que sus comensales se sientan cómodos. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lidia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que le hacen falta para su negocio como (papas, aceite, huevos, hamburguesas) asimismo comprar gas para su cocina, del mismo modo desea comprar dos bancas para la comodidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lidia is 29 years old and lives with her husband Carlos, 33, and their young daughter.  They make a daily effort to get ahead.  For two years now this hard-working woman has been selling hamburgers and "salchipapas" (hot dogs and french fries) out of a cart that she parks every day outside her brother's home which is in a very busy shopping area.  She enjoys her work, which she does from 6:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m., and obtains significant daily earnings.

Her work preparations begin at noon, after she has done the housework.  She hasn't been able to find an adequate place where her customers can enjoy their food in a calm atmosphere so she would like to buy tables and chairs in the future.

She needs a loan to purchase cooking ingredients in bulk so she can keep the business going without difficulties and she wants to buy two benches for her customers so they are more comfortable.  This is her second loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time since she does not want to disappoint the lenders who are helping her get ahead.  Lidia plans to use the loan to purchase ingredients for her business (potatoes, oil, eggs, hamburgers), cooking gas and two benches.

loans.use: To purchase non-perishable goods and cooking gas

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is married to M. R. who sells cotton. He buys cotton from different farmers and supplies different shops in the market at profit. He is the only person earning income in the family. Kosar herself is a housewife; she prefers to stay at home and performs her household responsibilities. She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both are illiterate for the reason that Kosar and her husband couldn’t afford their education. 

Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to help her husband, who wants to buy more cotton to supply more shops. This will help him fulfill larger orders on time and make more profit. He has more than nine years of experience in this field and Kosar is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to him and upgrade her family’s living style. 

Kosar lives in Mian Channu which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture.

loans.use: to buy cotton for selling.

loans.name: Liza's Group

texts.en:
Liza K. K. is a member of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a small village on the south coast of Isykul lake. She is 41 years old and unfortunately is a widow. Liza has two sons, both of them are of pre-school age (under seven). 

In 2009 Liza started a business sewing Kyrgyz national clothing and selling dressmaking supplies. She started with an initial investment of 5000 soms and now earns 1500 soms per month. With money received from this loan, Liza will purchase materials and fabrics needed for sewing. In the future, she wants to give her children a good education and improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es: El banco esta Las ESTRELLAS esta conformado por 8 personas 6 mujeres y 2 varones un grupo que viven el zona Ballivian de el alto, otro grupo vive en la zona central y se dedican al comercio minorista en diferentes tipos de productos. La presidenta es la señora Mayda se dedica a la costura de polleras en su domicilio tiene un hijo  y vive en la casa de sus papas ha sido elegida en la directiva por sus compañeras, por su responsabilidad y  por conocer a la mayoría de las socias y ha sido la coordinadora en el grupo para su conformación. Con el dinero del crédito comprar telas e hilos para la confección de polleras ya que se acerca la fiesta de su zona y le hicieron pedido, es una persona muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: This communal bank is "Las Estrellas" ["The Stars"]. It is made up of 8 people: 6 women and 2 men. Some of the members live in the Ballivian area of El Alto, and another group lives in the central zone. They work in retail trade, offering various types of products. The president is Mayda, who works making polleras [traditional skirts] in her home. She has one child and lives in her parents' house. She was chosen for the leadership committee by her fellow members thanks to her sense of responsibility, and because she knows most of the members and coordinated the group as it was being formed. With the funds from the loan, she will buy fabric and thread to make her polleras, since her area's festival is approaching, and people have placed orders with her. She is a very hard-working person, always thinking about the well-being of her family. All of the members are responsible and hard-working people who are grateful to the institution for the support provided to them.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to make polleras [traditional skirts].

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha nació en la ciudad de Pisaq, Perú. Ella tiene 43 años edad y tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, Martha vive en la ciudad Taray y ella nos cuenta que en el mes de febrero del año 2010 la ciudad de Taray sufrió un desastre natural pues el rio se desbordo y los pobladores perdieron sus negocios y se cayeron sus casas. (Taray se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola).

Su actividad económica principal de Martha es la venta de artesanía en el mirador y ella también se dedica alquilar terrenos para cultivar maíz y papa. En esta oportunidad Martha requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercedaria como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas, guantes de lana de alpaca que son muy cotizados por los turistas que llegan al centro de venta. 

Martha pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el cuarto y medio de año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Martha was born in the city of Pisaq, Peru. She is 43 years old and has 4 children. Currently, Martha lives in the city of Taray and she tells us that in February 2010 the city suffered a natural disaster when the river overflowed its banks and the people lost their businesses and their homes collapsed. Taray is 45 minutes from the city of Cusco and is known for beautiful countrysides, and for being a tourist, farming and ranching region.

Martha's main business is selling crafts at the lookout. She also rents land to be able to grow corn and potatoes. On this occasion Martha needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as sweaters, scarves, and wool gloves that are very in demand by the tourists who arrive at the sale center. 

Martha is part of the village bank "Señor de la Agonía de Taray” in the Arariwa Assocation. The village bank has been operating for 4.5 years and it's going very well.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, scarves, and gloves made from alpaca wool

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nélida tiene 23 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo en una casa alquilada. L. actividad agraria lo aprendió desD. que era una niña, y hace 4 años ha incursionado en L. venta D. animales. Es así que estos animales lo adquiere en una etapa no mayor D. los 6 a 8 mese D. nacidos para su alimentación integral, y así conseguir el peso exacto para su venta. Su esposo es quien L. ayuda mucho en este negocio, pues D. requiere D. esfuerzo para el bien y porvenir D. sus dos pequeños hijos. Al cabo D. un tiempo, son exhibidos éstos animales en L. feria ganadera que se realiza cada fin D. semana. Por otro lado también se dedica al cultivo D. papa y maíz, que luego D. meses están listos para su recolección y venta. Su mayor motivo para continuar en ambas actividades es poder darle lo mejor a sus hijos, por tanto su mayor anhelo es tener su casa propia en L. ciudad. Ante esto espera D. su apoyo económico para poder comprar más animales como un toro y ovejas. Este es su segundo crédito en MFP, pero espera D. su aporte económico para poder concretar sus objetivos. Por otro lado nos manifiesta que el haber trabajado con su grupo comunal le ha permitido aprender sobre invertir y ahorrar su dinero y por ello esta agradecida. 
Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. carneros.
texts.en:
Nélida is 23 years old and lives with her 2 children and husband in a rented house. She learned agriculture since she was a little girl and 4 years ago she started selling animals. Nélida gets animals no older than 6 to 8 months old to feed and gets them to an exact weight to later sell. Her husband helps her a great deal in the business since it requires a lot of work, they work hard for the wellbeing of their two young children. In due course, the animals are shown in a cattle market that takes place every weekend. She also partakes in agriculture, by sowing potatoes and corn, after a few months they are ready to be collected and sold. Nélida’s greatest reason for continuing to work in both fields is to be able to give the best to her children and her biggest wish is to have her own home. She hopes for your financial support to be able to buy more animals like a bull and some sheep. This is Nélida’s second loan with MFP and hopes to have the money to be able to follow through and achieve her goals, she says that working with her communal bank has allowed her to learn more about investing and saving her money and for that she is grateful.

With the loan, Nélida will buy sheep.

loans.use: buy a bull and some sheep.

loans.name: Khlok

texts.en: Khlok was born in 1962 and now lives in Siem Reap Province. To make a daily income she sells a kind of Khmer cake. She has operated this business since she was single. From this, she is able to earn around $2.50 profit a day to support her other financial expenses. She always receives help from her husband who works as a domestic cultivator as well as a musician for extra income. Usually, he can generate income of about $2.90 each day. Khlok planted rice crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and to pay for plowing. She hopes to use the rest of her loan funds to repair her broken motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer, pay for plowing and repair her broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Mpande Yempilo Group

texts.en:
Philisiwe is 39 years old and single. She has four children between the ages of 9 and 21. Philisiwe runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal in Empangeni, South Africa. In this photo, she is pictured raising her hand. 

For the past six months, Philisiwe has been in the snack-selling business. She also receives income through the government’s child support grants. Philisiwe is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner WDB to buy chips and snacks to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family’s standard of living because buying additional inventory for her new business will help her manage to put food on the table for her family. 

Philisiwe comments that she thinks WDB and Kiva will help her a lot by improving her life. In the future, she would like to see her business grow and she would like to sell additional products.

loans.use: to buy chips and snacks

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 60, is a farmer. She is a single mother with six children; two are studying, three are working, and the last is a hairdresser; she has her own shop. This family can make $15 for their income per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $99 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fee, and $20 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 for supporting her daughter who has a hairdressing shop to buy some stuffs and equipments for using in her shop because only this career can make good benefit to support the family. In the future, she would like to extend her daughter's shop more bigger so that she can make more benefit.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing equipment for her daughter's shop

loans.name: Chomrouen

texts.en:
Chomrouen is 25 years old and married.  He is a math teacher in a state school. His wife is a biology teacher in the same school. Their income is $6.50 per day. Every month, he has to spend $66 on food and $10 on electricity. 

Chomrouen is requesting a loan for $1,000 to buy farm land and enter the agricultural field. He was doing farming during his spare time, so that he would earn more income for meeting his expenses. They have a strong commitment to improve themselves to be good teachers in the future by receiving more training and studying.

loans.use: to purchase a farm land.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: L’emprunteur est un mécanicien auto. Il a son atelier de réparation mécanique prés de la route nationale et a implanté, avec un prêt de 150000F de l’IMCEC, une canT. de vente de pièces détachées à coté de son atelier. Ces deux activités très complémentaires lui assurent des revenus assez consistants pour prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille notamment de ses trois enfants tous inscrits dans des établissements d’enseignement privés. Il sollicite un autre prêt de 400000f afin d’augmenter son fonds de commerce en achetant 4 cartons d’huile moteur , 2 cartons d’huile moto, 30 croix, 1 carton de cartouches et 1 carton de bougies. Son ambition est de construire un magasin de vente en gros de pièces détachées complètes.
texts.en:
This borrower is an auto mechanic. He has a repair shop near the national road. Next to his workshop, he has set up, with a loan of 150,000 francs from the micro-finance institution IMCEC, a stall selling replacement parts. These two businesses complement each other very well and ensure revenues substantial enough to support his family, especially his three children, who are all enrolled in private schools. 

He is requesting another loan of 400,000 francs to increase her working capital by buying 4 boxes of motor oil, 2 boxes of motorbike oil, 30 crosses, a box of cartridges, and a box of spark plugs. His ambition is to build a wholesale store selling complete replacement parts.

loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of of motor oil, 2 boxes of motorbike oil, 30 crosses, a box of cartridges, and a box of sparkplugs

loans.name: Prekelo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Kereen from Gweru. She is married with three children aged 11, 22 and 24. The youngest is attending school.  

Kereen runs a hair salon boutique. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges faced are financial constraints. Kereen has requested a loan of $400 to buy hair weaves. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family’s cash flow and quality of life. In the future Kereen plans to have significantly expanded her business.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves for resale.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further improvement of her clothes sewing business. With the loan, she will purchase a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete the orders on time and increase her profits. She is 30 years old and she started this business to financially support her husband who has a construction supplies business. He makes contracts with different construction companies and fulfills their orders to earn an income.  Abida is the mother of four children. She couldn’t educate them due to financial constraints. Along with her business, she performs her daily routine tasks very well.
 
She is very hopeful that her business will improve a lot after investing the loan into it. She has been doing her business for many years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Abida.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
A sus 47 años de edad Julio se considera un hombre muy emprendedor quien vio la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia, y es así como nace su negocio, Julio vende frutas y verduras en las calles de la ciudad de Medellín en el departamento de Antioquia, allí procura prestar un servicio agradable y ofrecer productos con muy buena calidad y buenos precios.

Hoy en día Julio necesita un capital de inversión con el cual comprar una sombrilla que lo proteja del clima y evite que sus frutas se vayan deteriorando ya sea con el sol o la lluvia, igualmente quiere surtir su negocio comprando mas variedad de productos los cuales le generen mas ingresos y así pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo, sin embargo en este momento no cuenta con el dinero para realizar dichas compras. Sueña con llegar a tener un negocio más grande con el cual poder generar empleos y ayudarle a más personas a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 47 years old, Julio is considered a very enterprising man who saw the need to generate income for his family, and this is how his business was born. Julio sells fruit and vegetables on the streets of the city of Medellín in Antioquia, where he strives to provide friendly service and offer high quality produce at good prices.

These days, Julio needs investment capital to buy an umbrella to protect him from the weather and prevent his produce from deteriorating in the sun or rain. He also wants to supplement his business by buying a wider variety of products, and thus generate more income to improve the quality of life for himself and his son, but at the moment he does not have the money to make such purchases. Julio has dreams of owning a bigger business with which to he can create jobs and help more people to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase an umbrella, and stock a higher quantity of produce

loans.name: Robie Jane

texts.en:
Robie Jane is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 2 children. 
Robie Jane has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of used clothing.
Robie Jane is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es:
Fidel, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 y 12 años, el  tiene una tienda de productos básicos (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz) y un molino nixtamal y por eso todos los días trabaja de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para crecer más su tienda ya que anteriormente la tenía bien surtida, debido a la crisis bajo en ventas y en clientes debido a que no tenía suficiente variedad para ofrecer y ahora tambien tiene variedad de frutas y verduras para obtener más ventas. La compra de fidel sera en gaseosas, jugos, galletas, aceite.
El sueño de Fidel es incrementar sus ventas debidas que tendrá mas variedad y seguir teniendo créditos futuros para seguir trabajando con la institución y de esa forma podrá darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel lives with his wife and his two children aged 8 and 12.  He has a store where he sells basic household products (rice, beans, sugar and corn).  He also has a mill for grinding 'nixtamal' (corn used in making tortillas).  He works every day, from Monday to Sunday.

Fidel will use his loan to further grow his store.  He used to have a well-stocked store but, owing to the crisis, his sales and customers dropped because he didn't have a large enough variety of products to offer his customers.  He now also has a variety of fruit and vegetables in order to obtain more sales.  Fidel will use his loan to buy soda, juices, cookies and oil.

Fidel's dream is to increase his sales by having a greater variety of products available and to continue taking out future loans so that he can continue working with the institution and, in this way, provide his family with the best.

loans.use: to buy soda, juices, cookies and oil

loans.name: Mari Luz

texts.es:
MARI LUZ
La señora Mari, es socia del banco comunal Las Divinas. Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 46 años de edad, sola, tres hijos.
Cuenta con un taller de carpintería, tiene a su cargo un maestro carpintero, un ayudante que elaboran los muebles que lo venden en blanco.
Con su nuevo préstamo de   S/.1,700.00 nuevos soles comprara: 6 tablones de madera cedro, 10 tablones de madera capirona, 2 kilos de cola, 2 kilos de clavos.
Para mantener esta carpintería a flote tiene que salir a buscar sus clientes, y también se encarga personalmente en la compra de las maderas  y la supervisión del armado de los mueble, el taller lo tiene en el interior de su casa por el espacio que necesita para este trabajo.
Espera que Manuela Ramos sigua apoyando a las mujeres trabajadoras, que tiene que mantener a su familia solas.
texts.en:
Mari is a member of the "Las Divinas" community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 46 years old, single, and has three children.

Mari owns a carpentry workshop and has a master carpenter and an assistant working for her who make the furniture which they sell.

Mari will use her new loan for 1,700 soles to buy 6 planks of cedar wood, 10 planks of capirona wood (capirona is a native hardwood tree), 2 kilos of glue and 2 kilos of nails.

In order to keep her carpentry workshop running, Mari has to go out and find customers.  She also personally takes care of buying the wood and supervising the assembly of the pieces of furniture.  Her workshop is located inside her home owing to the space that is needed for this work.

Mari hopes that Manuela Ramos will continue supporting hard-working women who have to provide for their families on their own.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Doviko

texts.en: Doviko, 38, is a married father of five children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Formerly a butcher, he has been in the transport business for 15 years. His business hardship is high fuel prices, and his goals are to have a bigger truck and to educate his children. Doviko is requesting this loan in order to service his car.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Ana Lisseth

texts.es:
Ana, vive con sus tres hijos de las edades 9, 7 y 5 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender antojitos como: yuca, pasteles, atol y por las tardes vende pupusas en su casa, los dias sábado y domingo.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una cocina para hacer comida rápida como: papitas, hamburguesas, tacos y a si podrá obtener  clientes y tendrá más ingresos económicos. 
El sueño de Ana es tener su negocio estable e incrementar en sus ingresos y que sus  hijos sigan estudiando y darles una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her three children aged 9, 7, and 5. She sells street food such as yucca, pies, atol (a local warm drink made from corn), and on Saturday and Sunday afternoons she sells pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) from her house. 

Ana needs a loan to buy a stove so that she can make fast food such as fries, hamburgers, and tacos. In this way she would gain more customers and earn more money.

Her dream is to have a well-established business and a bigger income. She hopes that her children will continue at school and that she will be able to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 34 years old and married with 3 children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Gloria has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for 6 years.

Gloria aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Mila has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 9000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her shop.

Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es: Kharym es la secretaria del grupo María Elena Moyano. Este grupo de 7 integrantes escogió su nombre en honor de una heroína peruana.  Kharym de 25 años de edad soltera y con una niña,  tiene un negocio en que prepara buffet  de bocaditos y buffet de comida criolla para eventos sociales, comenzó con este negocio hace mas de 2 años a raíz de que no había este tipo de servicios en la zona donde vive, con el tiempo le gustaría ampliar su negocio a otros distritos y así poder expandirse y ser  más conocido su negocio, con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compra de mercadería como bandejas y utensilios de cocina. Así como el señor a Kharym cada integrante de este grupo tiene una meta por cumplir y un desafío por realizar el cual es la mejoría económica en sus hogares y un negocio estable.
texts.en: Kharym is the secretary of the “María Elena Moyano” group.  Its seven members selected this name in honor of a Peruvian heroine.  Kharym is 25 years old, single, and has a daughter.  She has a business where she prepares hors d’voures and Creole food for social events.  She started this business more than two years ago because this type of service didn’t exist in her zone.  She would eventually like to expand her business to other districts and in this way have her business become better known.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in merchandise such as trays and kitchen utensils.  Like Kharym, each member has goals to meet and challenges to overcome, which include improving the financial situation in their homes, and having a stable business..

loans.use: to buy utensils.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Savy is 39 years old.  She is a widow and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She is a rice farmer.  It has been necessary for four of her children to stop their studies in order to find jobs.  They are employed at a garment factory and earn about ten dollars a day to support the family.  Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Savy is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.  In the future, she would like to run a small breakfast store from her home to generate more income to support the family.  In addition, she would like to build a kitchen and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, 47, is married with two children and resides in Mantik, Tangub City, in the Misamis Occidental province of the Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. Marites has been in this business for two years and each month, she earns 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP).

Marites has requested a loan of 14,000 to purchase products for resale. She has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Marites wants to expand her business and to ensure her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for resale.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La  Señora Guadalupe, tiene 67 años de edad, no tiene  hijos a su cargo convive con su esposo, Su actividad principal es la venta de Joyas de oro como ser cadenas, aritos, pulseras, anillos y esclavas desde hace más de 14 Años. Doña Guadalupe, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cadenas, aritos, pulseras, anillos y esclavas ya que se aproxima las festividades del día de la madre para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes los que prefieren de sus producto por la buena atención y precio que les brinda a sus clientes, con el préstamo que reciba Doña Guadalupe, le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Doña Guadalupe es una persona mayor y trabaja afanosamente  para manejar todo en orden en su hogar y darle atención a sus clientes, con los ingresos de su negocio logro darle el estudio a sus hijas las que hoy en día son profesionales universitarias y cuentan con sus trabajos como maestras de educación.
Doña Guadalupe uno de sus sueños es ampliar su  negocios y vender una variedad de producto.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de cadenas, aritos, pulseras, anillos y esclavas para su negocio

loans.name: Kancharisun Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KANCHARISUN”; Este banco se ubicado en  la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Mary tiene 69 años es casada y tiene 02 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de locería como ollas,sartenes,cubiertos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez es profesora cesante , siendo de esta forma que la socia se dedica  a la venta de locería ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de sartenes para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de muebles, venta de materiales de construcción y trabajadores de instituciones públicas y privadas.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "KANCHARISUN." This bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Mary is 69 years old. She is married and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling kitchenware like pots, pans, and flatware, among other things. Mary has been working in this business for a good amount of time and it has gone well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She is also an unemployed teacher, which is why she is making her living selling kitchenware. Mary is a responsible and determined person, which is how she supports her family.

Mary is requesting this loan to purchase frying pans for her business.

The other members earn their livings selling furniture, selling construction materials, and working at public and private institutions. The member who appears in the inset photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting.

Mary is grateful to those who are part of her dream through this medium, and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: to buy frying pans for her business.

loans.name: Ezelina

texts.en:
Ezelina is a young, 29-year-old mother, married with 4 children, who was born like many others into a poor family. She did not have the opportunity to go beyond 7th grade in school. At age 17, she became pregnant for the first time by a boyfriend who did not want to take on the responsibility, and so Ezelina stayed in her parents' home. It was another start to difficulties in life and, as she tells it, she saw a world full of uncertainties. A few months later, she asked her father for support in the amount of 100 meticais (US$4) to start a business to be able to support the child she was eagerly expecting. At that point, business was not going well (yet another frustration) and she chose to look for a job at kiosks and, with the typical problems of a first pregnancy, she couldn't handle the work hours and had to return to the business that she had been doing. Conscious of the first failure, she contacted a group of women to hear about their experiences with the use of credit and to learn to save.

She currently has a business that performs well and operates in a precarious mini-store and plans to remodel as soon as she obtains a refrigerator to expand the business with a range of products.

She plans to enroll her older child in a secondary school, continue to bring a varied selection of essential products close to her customers and improve the conditions of the mini-establishment. This business is the only source of income for a family made up of six (6) people.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Gueguegue, Boane,Maputo,Mozambique Nome do cliente Ezelina cochissana B. Sector de actividade: Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 30.000,00mtn ( 1.155 USD) Aplicação do empréstimo: Construçao de mini loja com material convencional e compra de um congelador Data de início: 17/11/2006 Duração: 14 meses Ezelina é uma mãe jovem de 29 anos de idade, casada e com 4 filhos, que nasceu tal como as outras de uma família pobre. Não teve possibilidades de ir para além da 7 classe na escola. Aos 17 anos contraiu a primeira gravidez de um namorado que não quis assumir a responsabilidade, assim sendo, Ezelina permaneceu em casa dos pais e era mais um princípio de dificuldades na vida e, segundo conta, via um mundo cheio de incertezas. Poucos meses depois, solicitou ao pai um apoio no valor de 100,00mtn ( 4, usd) para iniciar um negocio para poder sustentar o filho que esperava com ansiedade. Nesse momento o negócio não correu bem ( foi mais uma frustração) e optou por pedir emprego em quiosques e, associado aos problemas típicos de uma primeira gravidez, a carga horária não conseguiu suportar tendo voltado aos negócios que fazia. Ciente do primeiro fracasso, contatou um grupo de mulheres para receber experiências sobre o uso de crédito e aprendeu a fazer a poupança.

Neste momento tem o negócio com bons rendimentos e opera num mini estabelecimento precário e pretende remodelar assim como adquirir um congelador para ampliar o negócio e produtos diversos. Pretende inscrever o filho mais velho num colégio, continuar a colocar variados produtos de primeira necessidade perto dos seus clientes e melhorar as condições do mini estabelecimento. Este negócio constitui a única fonte de rendimento para uma familia constituida por seis (6) pessoas.

loans.use: To buy refrigerator and products

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: "Uncle Steve", as he is called by his customers, lives in a community call Abokobi in Accra, Ghana, and operates a retail shop in his community. He sells general items in his shop. He wants to open another branch in a nearby community. He is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to enable him do so.

loans.use: Working capital to open a second shop

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson lives on a farm that is owned by his father. He and two brothers work the lands with their father, who is now getting older and cannot work as much as he once was able to. On his lands he has cattle and he also grows rice. He hopes that he can continue to make profits with his work so that one day he can save up for his own home. He has three children who live with him, two of whom are still in school. He hopes he can continue to educate his other children, now that his oldest has graduated as an agricultural engineer.

He is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Buena Suerte de Salitre Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Buena Suerte Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season on the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina has a business selling leather purses from a little market stall at the Rushski Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. An experienced entrepreneur, she has been developing her business over the past seven years. Loans Marina has received from Nadiya Ukraine have been instrumental in helping her through the years. During her entire partnership with our organization, she has never been delinquent with a loan. Marina has requested a short term loan of $300 to help her purchase some additional inventory. We look forward to many more opportunities to continue assisting Marina as she develops her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine and beauty shop supplies.

loans.name: Bertha Yannet

texts.es:
Bertha's husband works in transportation as a truck driver, and so he's travelling constantly. The income that he earns is divided among various expenses. Upon seeing the need from her household, since that at times they don't meet all the requests of their children, she decided to begin selling shoes through a catalog and forming a clientel.

Presently, one of her acquaintances is offering to sell her a small local grocery shop, which excites Bertha, since she needs to have stability in her business and not make expenses for transportation. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $575 US dollars to pay back over a period of six months. With this loan Bertha will be able to take advantage of this great opportunity that has been presented to her. Bertha greatly appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El esposo de Bertha trabaja en el transporte como camionero, así que él viaja constantemente, por lo tanto los ingresos que adquiere el esposo se ven divididos con los gastos que tiene cada uno. Y al ver la necesidad que tienen en su casa, puesto que a veces no les alcanzaba para los materiales de uno de sus hijos, decidió ponerse a vender zapatos por catálogo y así fue haciendo clientela.

Actualmente entre una de las conocidas le ofrecieron el traspaso de un local de abarrotes, lo que entusiasmó a Bertha, ya que ella necesita tener estabilidad en su negocio y no gastar en el transporte, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $ 575 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con esto Bertha podrá aprovechar la gran oportunidad que se le está presentando. Bertha agradece mucho por tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy business space at a local grocery store

loans.name: Tajueleen

texts.en: Tajueleen S. is 30 years old, married with 4 children and comes from Afromedia in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells kpomon (cow skin) at the neighborhood market. She has been a LAPO member for 2 years. She is requesting for a loan to buy more kpomon (cow skin) to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cow skin to sell

loans.name: Eisha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam!  This is 30 year-old Eisha N..  She is married with three children aged 7 and 9, and has two other dependents who are her niece and nephew.
 
In 2000, Eisha established a livestock business and in 2007, added a grocery business to her workload.  Eisha has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $850 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.  She thanks you for your support.

Eisha is a perfect example of why microfinance works and why the large majority of clients repay their loans.  A lot of people who hear about microfinance (or kiva.org) for the first time, ask anxiously, “But how do you make sure people pay back?  Won’t they just take the money?”  The implication is that the clientele who access microfinance (usually the ‘poor’) are less trustworthy, efficient or educated than ‘ordinary’ people.  Whether or not this is true is somewhat irrelevant for a number of reasons.  

Firstly, most MFIs have due diligence processes in place to assess client risk, as well as measures such as collateral arrangements and group lending (where a defaulted loan is borne by the group as a whole) to address this risk.  More important than any of these deterrents, however, is an incentive.  The incentive clients have to start a business, build a business, and repay their loan so that they can get another and another and another… The incentive to have on-going access to financial services from which they had previously been excluded.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock and grocery stocks.

loans.name: Uun

texts.en: Uun, 39, is the mother of 4 children and she has a small shop where she sells snacks, etc., earning about $7 a day. Her husband, U., works at a construction site as a coolie and earns a very small income. She is asking for a loan of $125 to expand her business and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little snack shop

loans.name: Tun

texts.en: Mrs. Tun S., 35, is a mother of three children and has opened a small business (cleaning motors and cars). Normally she earns $4 a day of profit. Her husband, to supplement the household income, works at the Ministry of Environment. His salary is $40 a month. Then after his work he always takes time to help at his wife’s business. So now this couple needs some money to purchase some tools for cleaning motors and cars, which cost around $100.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning tools

loans.name: Rukaya

texts.en:
Rukaya is 30 years old and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. She has been selling groceries including canned fish, canned tomatoes, soft drinks, biscuits, pens and maize to her community members in Obuasi for the past six years.

Rukaya says her previous loan from Sinapi enabled her to add variety to her store's inventory and life is becoming more meaningful as she has started saving for her children’s school fees. She wants to use her loan to expand her store as it  is currently small and also to buy more inventory.

Rukaya is member of the group called “Nyame Nhyira” (meaning God’s Blessing). The group uses peer pressure on members to re-pay their part of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and expand her store.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Mr. Juan Carlos is married, has three children of 2, 14, and 18 years of age, lives in South Laureles and is 41 years old.

His wife is a housewife and he works as an insurance agent for a S. S. consulting company in Diriamba.

With the loan he will replace the roof of his house since it is in bad shape and he does not want to expose his family to getting wet. In the future he would like to build a house for his children and educate them to be good people in the community,

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Juan Carlos, es casado le tiene tres hijos de 2, 14 y 18 años de edad, el habita en los Laureles Sur y tiene 41años de edad.

Su esposa es ama de casa, el se desempeña como agente de seguridad en una institución del consejo S.S. de Diriamba.

Con el préstamo va a cambiar el techo de la vivienda ya que esta en mal estado y no quiere exponer a su familia a mojarse. a futuro es hacerles una casa a sus hijos y educarlos como personas de bien ala comunidad.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Mrs. Veronica V. was born in General Articas in 1965. She lives with her two children, Ramona Soledad, 15, who is studying media in the National College of Luque and Claudio, 22, who works for Corrugadora del Paraguay (a paper and plastics company). She has run a small grocery store for 15 years and also has a hair salon in her own home. With the loan she bought a motorcycle for her son Claudio so he will have greater mobility.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Veronica V. nació en General Artigas en el año 1965. vive con sus dos hijos, Ramona Soledad de 15 años, quien esta cursando la media en el Colegio Nacional de Luque, y Claudio de 22 años quien trabaja en la Corrugadora del Paraguay. Dirige una despensa desde hace 15 años y además una peluquerìa en su propio domicilio. Con el préstamo compró una moto para su hijo Claudio a fin de lograr una mejor movilidad del mismo.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Berta's Group

texts.en:
Berta and Rufilia are members of the Village Bank Tarpuy, which means "Sowing" in Quechua. Berta lives with her partner/boyfriend, is 44 years old and has 4 children. Berta travels to the different fairs of the region twice per week where she buys cereals, which she stores and then sells in November when the prices have risen.

Rufilia is married, 37 years old, and has 5 children. Rufilia buys cochineal, tara, and leather from a stand at the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho, and then sells them to middlemen who take the products to Lima.

Berta and Rufilia need a loan, which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, kiwicha, tara, cochineal, and leather. The dreams of Berta and Rufilia are that their children finish their studies, and that they have secure jobs and capital to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase wheat, barley, kiwicha (cereal), tara (dye derived from a plant), cochineal (dye derived from an insect), and leather.

loans.name: Nida Juana

texts.es:
Nida is a very responsible mother, and is very dedicated to her work. She puts all her effort into her small brick factory, and she has been doing this hard task for 8 years. Over this time period she has acquired a lot of experience making a large quantity and variety of bricks. The motivation for her effort is her young son, Alexander, who she wants to give greater opportunities in life. Nida is sure that getting more raw materials to make bricks, such as sawdust and guano, will allow her to increase brick production, and this is why she is looking for your support with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Nida es una madre muy responsable y comprometida con su trabajo, pone su mayor esfuerzo y dedicación en su pequeña fabrica de ladrillos, lleva ya 8 años con esta ardua labor, en este tiempo logró adquirir amplia experiencia elaborando incansablemente gran cantidad y variedad de ladrillo.El motivo de su esfuerzo es su pequeño niño, Alexander, a quien desea brindarle mejores oportunidades de vida. Nida está segura que adquiriendo mayor materia prima para la fabricación de sus ladrillo, tales como aserrín y guano, le permitirá ampliar la cantidad de producción de sus ladrillos, con este objetivo recurre a la búsqueda de tu apoyo con la presente solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his brick factory/Compra de materia prima para su fábrica de ladrillos.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla Nyawoulé est âgé de 25 ans et célibataire. Il réside à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Komla  tient depuis plus de 3 ans, un atelier d’exploitation des noix de palme destinées à la préparation de l’huile. Avec cette chance de Kiva, il peut commencer à tellement améliorer la qualité de sa vie.
texts.en:
Komla Nyawoulé is 25 years old and single. He lives in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. For three years Komla has had a work space for processing palm nuts used to make oil. With this opportunity from Kiva, he can begin to really improve his quality of life.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm nuts to make and sell oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of grain (food for cows and hens) and corn

loans.name: Panama (Nom D’Une Personne Honoré De Leur Village) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe P. est un regroupement de 6 femmes âgées de 40 ans en moyenne, mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants vivant dans le village de Kimparana préfecture de San région de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali)

Les membres du groupe P. sont des spécialistes de la teinture d’habits. Très sollicitées pour la qualité de leur production, elles reçoivent des commandes importantes d’une clientèle de plus en plus importante. Pour faire face à cette demande importante elles décidèrent de rejoindre le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a de cela deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 150.000 FCFA pour le cinquième prêt. En plus de cette principale activité, elles mènent d’autres activités comme la vente d’encens (déodorant naturel apprécié pour l’odeur de sa fumée) et de henné (plante dont les feuilles permettent de noircir les pieds et les mains). Elles s’approvisionnent en bazin (tissus blancs très appréciés en Afrique de l’ouest) à Bamako en achat groupé pour les teindre en motifs et couleurs différentes sur place à Kimparana. Les produits finis sont vendus sur place à Kimparana et à Koutiala à une clientèle variée. Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 180 000FCFA tout le long du prêt qui servira à faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The P. group is an association of six (6) women, whose average age is 40 years. They are married and each are mothers to five (5) or more children. They live in the village of Kimparana, a prefecture in the San region of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The members of the P. group are specialists in dying clothing. Their high quality products are in much demand and they have been receiving major orders from an ever growing clientele. To meet this growing demand they decided to join the loan program of the Soro Yiriwaso (microbank) two years ago.The amounts of their loans has gone from a first loan of 50,000 francs CFA to their fifth loan of 150,000 francs CFA.

Besides their principle business, they manage other activities such as the sale of incense (natural scents known for their odour and smoke) and "henné" (plant leaves that darken the hands and feet). They buy "bazin" ( a white cloth, popular in West Africa) in the city of Bamako as a group purchase, then dye the product to various designs and colors (to customer request) in Kimparana. The finished products are sold in Kimparana and Koutiala to a wide range of clientele. They each expect to earn a profit of 180,000 francs CFA over the life of the loan which will be used to meet ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "bezin" (white cloth) for dyeing

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Pham Thi X. lives in Hung Yen commune, Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province.  She is 31 years old and she has three children.  She has been a member of TYM since 2002.  Now her main income is from pigs and growing rice.  For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow 10 million VND ($600 US) to buy more pigs and repair breeding facilities.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and repair breeding facilities.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is single. He is an entrepreneur from Mukachevo. Alexander owns a business selling cell phones and accessories in one of the local stores.

Alexander is an optimist. His cheerful personality, experience working in the technical sphere and unique ability to guess customer preferences make loyal clients come back to him again and again. Alexander has been in this trade for about 2 years.

Alexander has about 40,000 Grivnas in inventory. However he would like to get a new loan to expand the assortment of his inventory for the holiday season when cell phones sell really well. Rich experience in retail and the good location of his business will guarantee stable income for Alexander. The loan will not only help Alexander get good profit and promote the growth of his business, but also give him an opportunity to save some money for personal purposes.

This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase his turnover capital

loans.name: Dong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đồng Thị D. năm nay 48 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Ban đầu chị D. vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi, đến năm 2000 chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư mở của hàng ăn. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều tham gia kinh doanh dịch vụ hàng ăn và đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị D. mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh hàng ăn và chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đồng Thị D., 48 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 1996. At first, Mrs. D. used her loans only to raise animals. Then, in 2000, she made the bold decision to use a loan to open a restaurant. Today, both she and her husband work in their restaurant, which has become their main source of income, earning them about 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. D. hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND (875 USD) to invest in her restaurant and also in raising animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant

loans.name: Gabriela Edith

texts.es:
Gabriela es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Gabriela es soltera, tiene 28 años y vive con sus padres, Gabriela junto a su mama tienen un recreo en su casa en donde vende comidas típicas los días sábados y domingos. Además Gabriela es docente y esta trabajando en un jardín en la ciudad. Gabriela piensa implementar un negocio de fotocopias.
Gabriela necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de insumos de fotocopiadora.
Los sueños de Gabriela con tener un multiservicio con todos los servicios, ampliar su recreo.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the Community Bank "Pura Vida".

Gabriela is single, is 28 years old and lives with her parents. Gabriela, together with her Mom, have an area in their house were they sell traditional foods on Saturdays and Sundays. In addition, Grabriela is educated and she works in a public park in the city. Gabriela thinks of setting up her own photocopy shop.

Gabriela requires a loan in the amount of 900 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of photocopier accessories. Gabriela's dream is to have a multi-service business supplying all major services, to expand her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase photocopier accessories.

loans.name: Mariefe

texts.en:
Mariefe is engaged in a direct-selling business. Through venturing into said business, Mariefe can help her husband in generating income for their daily living. Her husband, Eric is busy with their farming business. They have three children namely, Ericson, 9 years old, in grade four, followed by Chelsea Claire, 7 years old, in grade 2, and the youngest is Shane Gwyneth, 5 years old, already in kindergarten. Mariefe said that sometimes they experience problems financially but prayers help them surpass all the hardships they encounter.

In Barangay (township) St.Tomas, Alicia, Isabela, where her family is living, Mariefe maintains her direct-selling business. Through an AVON product brochure, Marife is able to get orders from her regular customers and later on purchase those orders through the company branch in Cauayan City. She used to spend almost PHP 100 back and forth for the transport fee. She wanted to maintain her good performance as an AVON lady/dealer by purchasing more products. But, time has not always been a friend to her because some of her customers have delayed in paying. This is the reason why she wants to borrow additional business capital amounting to PHP 4,000 to pay for the products she ordered from the shop. This would be of great help to her business and her family if approved.

loans.use: Payment for Avon products

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.en:
Cattle are raised in order to be butchered, to obtain derived products, as well as to be used for agricultural tasks. Yusufjon has been dedicated to cattle farming for 2 years. He started this business as a young man, with his father's support. He is presently the father of 3 children of various ages. He makes a great effort in order to meet the needs of the children in his charge and to bring sustenance to his humble home. His greatest need now is to buy young cattle for expanding his business. For this reason, Yusufjon turned to IMON International, in order to obtain loans that will allow him to purchase these animals and make his business advance.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.
