These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina D. is thirty-five years old. She is a married mother of three children. All three of her children are currently in junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Faustina is a food vendor. She sells a local dish called ‘banku’ in her community. She prepares the food in her house and sells it on the street in the evenings. Banku is prepared from corn dough and served hot with soup. Faustina says she procures the raw materials such as maize, fish, and vegetables from the local market. She has been in this business for four years and wants a loan to procure the raw materials in bulk. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and give her children the best education.

loans.use: Procure raw materials in bulk

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is married and lives in Vinogradovo. She sells women’s lingerie in the central marketplace of her home town. Her vending location is a kiosk is located at the entrance to the market which makes it attractive to customers who are passing by. Tetyana has been in the trade for four years. Currently, she has about 25,000 Hryvnia in inventory. Her income is about 5,000 Hryvnia.

Tetyana is seeking a loan of 7,000 Hryvnia. She is hoping to see her business expand even more. Tetyana is known as an entrepreneur of integrity and determination. We believe her commitment to her venture and personal characteristics will help her repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Nancy es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Nancy vende golosinas, canchas (bocaditos) con juguetes que ella misma prepara con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos, los juguetes los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima sus ventas son al por mayor a las tiendas. Además Nancy junto a su esposo tiene una mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte publico.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes y arroz.
Nancy sueña con tener una tienda mayorista de pasamanería y golosinas, que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Virgen de Cocharcas Communal Bank. Nancy is 39 years old, married and has four children. She sells sweets and snacks which she prepares with the help of her husband and children. She also sells toys which she gets in the city of Lima and sells wholesale to the stores. And what's more, Nancy together with her spouse has a mototaxi with which they provide transportation to the public. Nancy needs a loan of 1,500 Sols that will be invested in the purchase of toys and rice. Nancy dreams of having a wholesale store for general merchandise and sweets, and that her children will become professional people.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys and rice.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 49 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their four children. Adel has been working in construction for thirty years. Adel requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third cycle and he has always on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his work. Adel is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties He decided on doing his business because he learned it since he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his work by purchase a sophisticated machine.

loans.use: Adel will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Mame Diarra

texts.fr: mame diarra est une jeune fille agée de 27 ans qui fait du commerce pour subvenir à ses besoins personnels;elle s'approvisionne en parfums chez une de ses tantes et les revend au détail chez ses clients ;elle sollicite ce pret pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle
texts.en:
Mame Diarra is a young woman of 27 who works at selling perfume to support herself. She gets the perfume from one of her aunts and retails it to her customers. She is asking for this loan so that she can satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of perfume

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi  4 est constitué  de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Massoukou,  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles  sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités agricoles. Elles font exclusivement la culture d’arachide qui reste la principale culture de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 10 hectares.
La production sera vendue au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes, au comptant surtout à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 4 souhaitent la continuation de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et ambitionnent avoir des montants plus élevés c’est à dire à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
Benkadi 4 is composed of 10 married women who average 29 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Massoukou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to realize their farming activities. They exclusively grow peanuts, which is still the main crop in the area. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold, mainly for cash, at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 45) per campaign. The women of the Benkadi 4 group wish to pursue their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, and ambition to obtain higher loans.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah I. is 30 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She sells provisions and dried fish. She is hoping for a loan in the amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more provisions and dried fish to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Зебинисо – женщина , которая  занимается продажей посуды и глянцевой посуды. Она по профессии работает учительницей по предмету математики. Зебинисо хочет получив деньги завести партию пластмассовой посуды для кухни. Она торгует на воскресных базарах.
Зебинисо устраивают все условия и критерии нашей организации.
texts.en:
Zebiniso is a woman who sells crockery and glazed dishware. She works as a math teacher. Zebiniso sells at the Sunday markets, and is seeking a loan to buy a stock of plastic kitchenware. She meets all of our organization’s qualifications and criteria.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her product offerings

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn L. is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old and married with one child. To make a living, Erlyn is starting a business offering motorcycle transport services in the local community.

Erlyn has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that will improve her living situation and ability to engage in these business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair her motorcycle, and she will reinvest her earnings into the business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M. is 27 years old, married and has been blessed with two daughters. Sarah runs a business selling old and new sacks in Sega market, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last four years. The family also owns a matatu for passenger service that plies the Mshomoroni-kengeleni route, which supplements their daily income.

She was introduced to KADET by another client in a different group and she has applied for her first loan. She plans to purchase more sacks for sale with the money.

Sarah hopes to become a leader in the sack business in Mombasa city.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Purchasing an assortment of sacks for both retail and wholesale trade.

loans.name: La Simpatia 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Teresa B. (far right in photo) is an entrepreneur who lives in Bayaguana, Dominican Republic. Bayaguana is a large town about 40 miles northeast of Santo Domingo. Despite its size, Bayaguana is a prisoner to its location in the interior of the country. It lacks reliable electricity and has no potable water and is somewhat difficult to reach even by truck.

Teresa is the coordinator for the solidarity group called La Simpatia (Charm), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group. She is 60 years old and has three grown children. Teresa has a small general store from which she sells food to her neighbors. She focuses on the staples of the Dominican cuisine: rice, beans, oil, and flour. With this loan, Teresa hopes to expand her business to include some basic interior decorations to sell, such as curtains and shades. This will make her business more attractive than thO. just offering food.

Teresa hopes that with her profits she can make repairs to her home so that life is a little more comfortable. This is Teresa’s sixth loan with Esperanza, and she has a perfect repayment record over the three years of thO. loans. Thank you for lending to Teresa and La Simpatia group!

loans.use: To buy curtains and shades to sell in her shop

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero owns poultry and rears the birds to sell. She has been in this business for nine years. She is 49 years old and a widow with five children. 

Vero hopes for the loan of N40,000 to purchase more poultry. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more poultry to rear and sell

loans.name: Natividad Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Natividad R. tiene 43 años de edad, es Casada de oficios de artesanía,  “Elaboración de cortes típicos” cuenta con tres telares, habita junto  a su Esposo, y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 14  años de elaborar en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chorajche, del cantón Pasajoc del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Natividad R., 43, is married. She makes typical skirts, and she has three looms. She lives with her husband. They both do the same work, and they have two employees to help them with the work. For 14 years she has been making skirts in her home, which is locted in the Paraje Chorajche in the Cantón Pasajoc, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Current customer demand is growing, but the economic condition in which she finds herself is not sufficient to increase her capital. That is why she came to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will buy raw material to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to get her family ahead and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make typical skirts

loans.name: Domingos Xavier

texts.pt:
Domingos Xavier T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, capital de Moçambique tem 56 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 19, 17, 14 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 4º ano de seminarista dos padres da igreja católica não continuou devido a falta de meios financeiros, porque perdeu os pais muito cedo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém além da sua família.

Nunca mudou de residência, construiu no terreno deixado pelos pais depois da morte. Tem um negocio próprio desde 1962, aprendeu no tempo colonial com os portugueses, vende mais cerveja que custa 25.000.00mt. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mes e poupa algum no banco comercial Barclays.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outras instituições de créditos, conheceu a Hluvuku através das mobilizações feitas pela supervisora da sucursal de Boane. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria da sua loja (refrescos, cerveja e outros) para responder a procura que é cada vez crescente e consequentemente os seus rendimentos. Os seus primeiros empréstimos foram de 5.750,00mt,15.000.00mt, 25.000.00mt e 18.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro pretende solicitar empréstimos para reiniciar actividade de criação e venda de patos, actividade que vem desenvolvendo de uma forma menos intensa.
texts.en:
Domingos Xavier T. was born in Matola, Province of Maputo, capital of Mozambique, he is 56 years old, he is married and has 3 children who are 19, 17, 14 years old, they all go to school. He studied up to the 4th year of seminary of catholic church, but couldn't finished because of lack of financial resources, because he lost his parents too early. He lives in his own house with his family and he doesn't support any other relative. He never moved from his home and built in the same land his parents left after their death. He has his own business since 1962, that learned during the colonial times with the Portuguese, he sells more beer that costs 25.000MT. And gets a profit of 4.500MT a month and is able to save some of it at Barclays commercial bank. He never had any other loans with other institutions, he learned about Hluvuklu thru walks done by the supervisor of the Boane branch. This is his 5th loan for 15.000MT which he expects to use to buy merchandise for his store (beverages, beer and others) to answer the increasing demand and therefore his income. His first loans were for 5.750MT, 15.000MT, 25.000MT and 18.000MT all for the same activity. In the future he wants to request more loans to start again the activity of raising ducks, which is an activity that he has been working on in a less intense way.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell beverages and beer

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel, 29, has a rice farming business in Surallah, South Cotabato. Being single, he devotes much of his time to focusing on his farm's development. He started farming in 1998. With more experience in farming, he is confident of having a good harvest.

Manuel joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan that will be used for his business. He would like to request 8,000 Php to purchase farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 46 years old and is married with five children with ages between 5 and 20 years. She has operated her business of selling beverages and cooked food in her restaurant/kiosk for five years. The hours of her business requires that she work from early in the morning until late in the evening (after the last customer leaves, typically).

Eugenie is intent on growing her business. To do this, she is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase some new equipment to be used in her restaurant and to increase the quantity and variety of food and beverages she sells. This, she hopes will result in more customers.

If this strategy is successful, Eugenie, with the additional profit from this business, will be able to continue to build a secure future for her large family.

loans.use: To purchase some new equipment and supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Man Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Man Kumari N. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Sanepa. In her shop she sells different types of groceries such as rice, maize, noodles, snacks, etc. She opened her grocery store to strengthen the economic condition of her family. Now, she is requesting an Rs 15,000 loan to buy more groceries for her store.

Mrs. N. lives with her husband and two children. Her Husband, Mr. Raj Kumar N., works in a private office. They have one son and one daughter, both of whom are studying in primary school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: 15 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal "15 D. Diciembre" esta representado por la señora Nancy y conformada por 15 miembros que van participando ya en su tercer ciclo demostrando siempre puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Todos los miembros tienen actividades comerciales como la crianza y comercialización D. cerdos, la venta D. comida, ropa, refrescos, frutas, cosméticos y al servicio D. peluquería y lavandera. 

Nancy que es la presidenta D. este lindo grupo se dedica a la cría y venta D. chanchitos tiene una experiencia D. 2 años en este rubro, Martha se dedica a la venta D. soda desD. hace 1 años atrás, Maria Isabel venD. cosméticos desD. hace 2 años atrás, Juana venD. empanadas desD. hace 2 años atrás, Maria Renee venD. comida y tiene experiencia en el rubro D. 1 año, Cristina es comerciante D. ropa desD. hace 5 años atrás, Sonia también es comerciante D. ropa solo que a diferencia D. Cristina tiene menos años D. experiencia solo cuenta con 2 años, Martha se dedica a lavar ropa desD. hace 15 años atrás, Angel venD. refresco D. manera ambulante él se encuentra en este rubro desD. hace 2 años, Maria del Carmen se dedica a la venta D. comida tiene una amplia experiencia en este rubro(24 años), Yessica Denise se dedica a la venta D. frutas desD. hace 10 años atrás. Lucinda es promotora D. cosméticos y tiene una experiencia D. 7 años, Carola se dedica a la producción D. alimentos específicamente prepara cena para vender tiene experiencia en este negocio D. 1 año y por último está Rosa Liliana quién también es promotora D. cosméticos desD. hace 5 años atrás. 

En cuanto al entorno competitivo se pueD. mencionar que es difícil pero las socias saben como salir adelante con su negocios ya sea saliendo a mercados periféricos o diversificando su mercadería para poder obtener el ingreso necesario para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. alimento balanceada al por mayor, herramientas D. peluquería mas modernos, insumos, materiales y mercadería D. verano para la época. En cuanto a sus expectativas ellas trabajan para la educación D. sus hijos y para poder darles un hogar mas estable por lo que siempre piensan en el futuro y el bien estar D. sus familias; por lo tanto su mayor expectativa es que ellos puedan salir con una profesión y así mejorar cada día mas.
texts.en:
The 15 D. Diciembre Communal Bank is represented by Nancy and comprised of 15 members. They are in their third cycle, and the have always been punctual and responsible with their payments. All of the members have commercial activities like raising and selling pigs, selling food, soft drinks, fruit, cosmetics, and hairdressing and laundry services. Nancy is the president of this lovely group. For the past two years, she has been raising and selling pigs. Martha has been selling soda for the past year, Maria Isabel has been selling cosmetics for the past two years, Juana has been selling empanadas (meat pastries) for the past two years, Maria Renee has a year of experience selling clothing, Cristina has been selling clothing for five years, and Sonia also sells clothes but has just two years of experience. Martha has been washing clothes for the past 15 years, Angel sells drinks on the street and has two years of experience in this area, Maria del Carmen has a lot of experience (24 years) selling meals, and Yessica Denise has been selling fruit for the past 10 years. Lucinda sells cosmetics and has seven years of experience, Carola has been serving dinners for a year, and finally, Rosa Liliana also sells cosmetics, which she has been doing for the past five years. As far as competition goes, it is difficult. But, the members know how to get ahead with their businesses. They go to outlying markets or diversify their merchandise to be able to get the necessary income to support their families. The loan is to buy balanced food wholesale, more modern tools for hairdressing, supplies, materials, and summer merchandise for the season. As far as expectations go, they work to educate their children and to be able to give them a more stable home. They always think of the future and the well being of their families. Their biggest expectation is that their children are able to become professionals and improve more each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Marie Hélène

texts.fr: Marie Hélène N. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte Anne depuis 8 ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 16 fois de suite. Elle fait un petit commerce de couscous, de citron et d'huile de palme. Elle soutien son mari pour la prise en charge de la santé et scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Marie Hélène N. is a 44-year-old woman, married and mother of five children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” loan group in Sainte Anne for eight years, and has acquired quite some experience with credit loans, since she has benefited from 16 previous loans. She runs a small business selling couscous, lemons and palm nut oil. She assists her husband in ensuring their children’s healthcare and education.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her income-generating activity

loans.name: John

texts.en:
N. is 48 years old, married with three children, and lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She is hardworking and believes that women are helpmates and need to support their man in keeping the home.

N. is a petty trader: she sells drinks, snacks and spiritual items in order to make additional income. With the profit from the business she is able to save a little money and assist her husband in running the home. Her husband is a business man and is also trying to meet his financial responsibilities.

N. hopes to expand her business by buying more drinks and snacks to sell. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Iris Etelbina

texts.es:
La Sra. Iris Etelbina R. P. es obrera en una fábrica de elaboración de puro en el Municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de cemento para repellar las paredes de la sala de su casa de habitación, ya que dichas paredes no están afinadas.

Ella tiene ocho años de estar trabajando en esta fábrica en la elaboración de puros para exportación hasta hoy en día para así tener un ingreso mensual estable y cubrir con sus gastos familiares. Antes de dedicarse a esta labor ella era estudiante de secundaria

 Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las siete de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. 

Iris P. espera que con la compra de dichos materiales de construcción ella pueda mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y darle una mejor presentación y así tener un hogar mas digno para ella y su familia.

Esta joven es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales están en edad escolar y a los que le toca cubrir con los gastos escolares con la ayuda de du esposo también.

Este es el crédito numero cinco que ella solicita en un periodo de de cuatro años. Ella dice mostrarse contenta con el resultado positivo que ha obtenido con los financiamientos ya que ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda así como a logrado sacar adelante los estudios de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Iris Etelbina R. P. is employed as a laborer in a cigar factory in Condega. She is asking Ceprodel for funds to buy cement to coat her living room walls because they are rough and unfinished. She has worked at the for export cigar factory for 8 years in order to have a stable monthly income to meet family expenses. Prior to this employment, she was a middle school student. She works Monday through Friday from 7am until 5pm. Iris P. hopes that the purchase of these building materials will make it possible for her to improve her living conditions so that her house will have a better appearance and her family will have a more proper home. This young woman is married and has two, school-age children; she and her husband must pay for all their educational expenses. This is her 5th loan in 4 years. She says that she is happy with the positive results she has gotten from the loans because she has managed to improve her home’s condition as well as pay for both her children’s schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ley

texts.en: Mrs. Ley N.  is married with a young child who is enrolled in primary school. She currently stays at home to care for the child and raise a few pigs to earn a living. Her husband (shown in the photo) is skilled in decorating wooden objects by hand. He produces beds, armchairs, windows and other furniture ordered by his customers. He faces a difficulty sending his finish products to his customers because he does not have a vehicle for transportation. He has discussed this with his wife and they have decided to request a loan of $700 USD to buy a motorcycle to connect with an existing trailer so that they can transport the furniture.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to connect with existing trailer for transporting furniture

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin M., is 32 years old and her husband, Mr. Savuth Thorn (they are pictured together), is 32 years old. They live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1992 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One of the children attends school while the other one is still too young.
 
Sophoin and her husband have been selling vegetables for three years. They buy them from farmers in their village and transport them to sell at Koki market. Sophoin is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a brick room under her wooden house.

loans.use: To build a brick room under her wooden house

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
DagvaD. D. is a 63-year-old widower. He lives alone in a "ger" (a yurt or Mongolian nomadic housing tent) in Arhangai, one of Mongolia's central provinces. 

DavgaD. operates a taxi service in his town. He has operated an inter-city transportation business for many years, beginnin when he was very young. He has been running his taxi service since 2001 and is an experienced driver. DavgaD. says, "Operating a business and being active helps me to stay healthy and be happy." 

He is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase four tires and other spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase tires and spare parts for his car

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine O. is a 35 year-old business woman. She is married with five children and she has six dependents too. She is a resident of Unjuku upper village, Nebbi Town Council.

Christine owns a fashion and design boutique which has a tailoring school attached to it located along Uringi Road in Nebbi Town Council. She has been running the business for over ten years.

Christine will use her loan to purchase a new sewing machine and more fabrics (materials) to make dresses (clothes) for sale. Her dream is to expand her business to accommodate many customers.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and more fabric to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon M., 46, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Roberto M., a businessman, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn money so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own handicraft business while also selling L.P.G. fuel and mineral water in containers.

Corazon has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000. This amount will be used as added capital for her expanding business, enabling her to buy more products to be incorporated into her current product inventories.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Sabiha's Group

texts.en:
Sabiha is the wife of A. and she lives in Lahore, a city of historic places in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over twenty-five years. 

She is a very good mother, takes care of her family and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife. Her husband has a clothes-selling business. He purchases clothes from the city Faisalabad (city famous for its textiles) and sells them at different cloth markets and in the community as well. He has ten years of experience in this business. 

Sabiha is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the loan amount in her husband’s business. He will purchase fabrics in bulk and increase the sales of his business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. is currently in the business of selling tea in the evening beside the street and is requesting a loan to stock more sugar, milk and tea leaves to make tea to sell.  Jane is 37 years old and is married to a husband who is a builder. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase more chairs and tables. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more sugar, milk and tea leaves to make tea to sell

loans.name: Sharoti

texts.en: Sharoti is a young lady who is 30 years old and married with four children aged 4 to 12 years. She lives with her family of seven, which includes her children and her parents. Education for the children is a high priority in the family. Sharoti operates a stationery shop where she sells books, papers and other scholastic items. She has operated the shop for five years now, having established it with the savings she made at her first job as a primary school teacher. She says that during holidays, sales are low but she hopes to open up a branch in another town to increase turnover. The purpose of the loan is to purchase books, printing and photocopying paper and a printer for her stationery business.

loans.use: To purchase books, paper and a printer

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 29 years old and married with one child. She designs and prints cards, brochures, and newsletters — a business she started five years ago.  (She was previously employed as a secretary.) She is now earning a better income from her business and hopes some day to open a graphic design college. Florence has requested a loan of 95,000 KES to purchase a printer and cartridges. She describes herself as focussed, ambitious, and hardworking. She has developed a savings habit since joining Faulu Kenya Limited.

loans.use: To purchase a printer and cartridges

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto García M.    un joven   de 29 años de edad  que vive con su esposa y  4 hijos  en una de Reserva habitada por uno de los grupos  Indígenas más importantes de Costa Rica los  “Guaimí”.    Está Ubicada en San Vito de Coto Brus una zona caracterizada por su elevada Ubicación y por estar a solamente una hora del Parque Internacional La  Amistad. Sus principales actividades económicas son la Agricultura, la artesanía y el Turismo  el cual ha aumentando en los últimos años.
El negocio de Don Jacinto siempre ha sido el ganado de doble propósito, el vende sus productos dentro de su comunidad a muy buen precio. Los vecinos aseguran que el producto de Don Jacinto siempre se ha caracterizado por ser de muy buena calidad. 
El necesita  ¢200.000 (doscientos  mil colones) para comprar una ternera  que ya conoce pero que no había  podido comprar  por falta de dinero. Ahora con este préstamo espera obtenerla y sacarle el mejor provecho y generar ingresos que le  ayuden a mantener a su familia.
Don Jacinto es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Ku Kwata, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y está muy satisfecho con esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Jacinto García M. is a young man, 29 years old, who lives with his wife and their four children on a Reserve inhabited by one of Costa Rica's most important indigenous groups, the Guaimí. It is located in San Vito de Coto Brus, an area characterized by its high altitude and only an hour away from La Amistad International Park. The main economic activities are agriculture, handcrafts and tourism, which has increased in recent years. Don Jacinto's business has always been raising cattle for both meat and dairy sales. He sells his products in his community at a very good price. The neighbors state that Don Jacinto's products have always been of very good quality. He needs ¢200,000 (two hundred thousand colones) to buy a calf he knows of but has not been able to buy because he lacked the money. Now with this loan he hopes to obtain the calf and profit from her and earn money to help him support his family. Don Jacinto is a member of the Ku Kwata Communal Bank, on of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and he is very pleased about this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Fadenkene Group

texts.fr:
FADENKENE est un regroupement de cinq femmes toutes mariées,  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et  5 enfants, qui  vivent dans des  familles polygames  à LOULOUNI, une sous-préfecture de la région de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur douzième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’accroitre leur chiffre d’affaire et de satisfaire leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femme mène  diverses  activités telles la transformation du manioc en atiéké  avec MAMOU S..
MAMOU S. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  30 chargements de charrette en manioc qui seront transformés en atiéké. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Loulouni et dans les villages  voisins. 
L’atiéké est vendu en détail   et en gros au marché de Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour  subvenir au besoins quotidiens  de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de s’acheter une charrette et un âne, en plus aménager son point de vente.
texts.en:
Fadenkene is a group of five married women, who average 40 years of age with five children each and who live in polygamous families in Loulouni, a sub-prefecture of the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their twelfth loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of increasing their turnover and satisfying their customers. This group of women have a variety of businesses, including the preparation of "atiéké" (a couscous-like dish) made from cassava, which is carried out by Mamou S.. With her loan, the latter is planning to buy 30 barrowloads of cassava which will be made into atiéké. She gets her supplies from the market in Loulouni and in neighboring villages. The atiéké is sold on a retail and wholesale basis at the market in Loulouni to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,000FCFA, of which part will be used for savings in order to cover her family's daily needs and the rest invested in her business. Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to satisfy her customers more, to buy a cart and a donkey, and also to do up the place where she sells her produce.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cassava for the preparation of "atiéké

loans.name: Perla Blanca

texts.es:
La  señora Perla P. D. R., es D. la Ciudad D.  Guayaybi, es casada  tiene casa propia, propietaria D. una despensa en su propio domicilio ademas tiene una peluqueria cuenta con clientela bien formada, con buen ingreso mensual, posee buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
 Según ella que empezo con su peluqueria, pero su anhelo era D. tener una despensa., al correr D. los tiempos con el esfuerzo consiguio ahora ya cuenta con su despensa bien surtida., agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya por la ayuda que le brinda gracias a eso compra mas mercaderias para satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes, su sueño es tener un local comercial mas amplia para obtener mas clientes asi aumentar sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Perla P. D. R. is from the city of Guayabi. She is married and has her own house. She owns a store that is in her house and she also has a barber shop. She has a well established customer base and good monthly income. She has good personal and commercial references. According to her, she began with her barber shop but her wish was to have a grocery store. In time her efforts led to her being able to get the store and now she has a well-stocked store. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the help it provides for it was thanks to it that she bought more merchandise to meet her customers’ needs. Her dream is to have a larger commercial space to attract more customers and increase her monthly income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es:
Luis Francisco M., trabaja como ayudante en la dirección de administración del centro de insumos para la salud. 

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de Materiales de construcción para reparar el techo de su casa de habitación.
Tiene dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
Ha tabajado dos prestamos con ceprodel y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación.
texts.en: Luis works as an administration assistant at a health products center. He is requesting the loan to purchase construction material to repair the roof on his home. He has two school-age children. He has had two loans with Kiva partner Ceprodel, and these have helped him make improvements on his home.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen resides in Gujranwala, which is famous for its dairy industry in Pakistan. She is a 44-year-old housewife who spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household work. She is married to L. M. who is a government employee and earns a meager income. She is a mother of four sons and three daughters. She couldn’t educate her elder children due to poor financial condition but as her elder son started working, she has managed to enroll her last four children in school and they are continuing their education. Her son is involved in the furniture making & selling business. He makes furniture on orders and earns a good profit on each order. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, her son will buy wood, nail and furniture polish in bulk quantity. The bulk quantity will enable him to make more furniture on time and earn maximum profit.  

Nasreen is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she has built a good credit record and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails and furniture polish for furniture making & selling business

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Argentina G. G.  tiene  una Pulpería desde hace 2 año, es casada su esposo Trabajaba vendiendo madera, tiene una persona a cargo que depende de ella y de los ingresos del esposo. 

Es Primera vez que tiene un crédito en CEPRODEL, el cual utilizará para la inversión en mercadería como es la compra de 2 pacas de ropa usada y un quintal de arroz.
texts.en:
Mrs Rosa Argentina G. G. has had a small grocery store for 2 years.  She is married and her husband works selling wood.  She has one person in her care who depends on her and on her husband's income.

This is the first time that she has had a loan from CEPRODEL.  She will use it to invest in merchandise such as the purchase of 2 packages of second-hand clothes and 100 lb of rice.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is married with seven children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to have a healthy family and a good standard of living for his family. He has been operating a bar business for the last ten years which he started on a small scale by selling local brew to get where he is now. He hopes to expand since he hasn’t had any challenges yet, and that is why he intends to use the loan funds to buy beer to sell at his pub.

loans.use: Buying beer to sell at his pub

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena R. C. tiene 36 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con los padres y con un hijo vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene  1 hijo 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Maria   se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 95años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para tener sus propios cultivos.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Maria Elena R. C. is 36 years old.  She has a common-law husband and lives with her parents and child in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has one child.

The 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) community bank is located in Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Maria has been growing corn, rice and beans for 5 years. She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to buy her own land so that she can have her own crops.  She likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: Farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon is widow and has five children. After the death of her husband, she had to find some way to provide for her children. That is how she became a market vendor. Today Guljahon sells children’s clothing and footwear. Her prices are always reasonable. She has been in business for ten years. Financial assistance has helped her business grow and expand. 

Guljahon is requesting a loan of $2,000 to purchase clothing wholesale to sell over this Christmas season. Her business is the only source of income for her family. That is why she is determined to work 24/7 to provide for their needs and stimulate the growth of her trade. One of her plans is to open a new vending facility in the local market and hire an employee to help her run the business. We believe her natural liveliness and enthusiasm will help Guljahon achieve her goals and continue as a successful entrepreneur.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new goods in order to increase the range of goods for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old single man living with his mother. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a DJ and party organizer for almost 15 years. He takes on weddings, ceremonies, and private parties. He took out a first Kiva loan to purchase a musical instrument and he is thankful for the results. 

Currently, his business is getting bigger and he wants to take out a new loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional musical equipment. Please note that the borrower was very punctual and repaid on time during previous the loan period.

loans.use: to purchase additional musical equipment

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch R. is a 54-year-old single woman, and she earns her living by cultivating rice crops. She was married, but she has been divorced from her husband for years. Currently, she lives with her three children, two of whom are single, and one is married. She has two children who work in various jobs and they share their salary with Uch R. every month. 

In the past, Uch R. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Right now, Uch R. hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. With the rest of her loan, she will buy seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy two cows for plowing the farmland.

loans.name: Estelma Ely

texts.es:
La Sra. Estelma Ely L. L. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña tienda de venta de cosméticos y otros porductos para belleza. a sabido administrar su negocio pues luce bien ya que ofrece varios productos a sus clientes, su fácil acceso le permite ser muy visitado esto le hace tener excelentes ventas y por ende buenas ganancias, también realiza ventas de manera ambulantes en las diferentes aldeas y caseríos circunvecinos.
Estelma tiene las riendas de su casa sola ya que su esposo trabaja en los Estados Unidos desde hace mas de 10 años,  aun así no pasa esperanzada a lo que su esposo gana y le envia, si no que trabaja duro para sacar adelante su hijos y mejorarles las condiciones de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estelma Ely L. L. is a merchant. She has a small cosmetics and beauty products store. She has managed her store wisely because it has done very well and she has a variety of products to offer her clients. Her accessible prices have made her store very popular and she perceives excellent sales and excellent earnings.  She also makes her sales itinerantly to the different districts and communities in the region. 

Estelma is solely responsible for the household. Her husband has been working in the US for more than 10 years. But she doesn't depend on what he sends her.  Instead she works hard to support her children and to improve the quality of their lives.

The loan will be used to purchase more merchandise in order to supply her business and satisfy client demands.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont  toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans et  en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à T’DJILLA, un des villages de la sous préfecture  de NIENA région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de canaris à l’image de BIBA F.. 
BIBA F. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 30 canaris. Elle s’approvisionne au village de T’DJILLA auprès des femmes productrices de canaris. Les canaris sont revendus au  marché de T’DJILLA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the SABOUGNOUMA group are all married women, averaging 40 years of age and 4 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in T’DJILLA, a village in the NIENA sous-prefecture in Sikasso Region, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their third loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. Previous loans were repaid without problems. This group of women sells "canaris" (pottery containers), as does BIBA F..

BIBA F. intends to use her loan to buy 30 "canaris". She gets her supplies in T’DJILLA, from women who manufactures "canaris". She resells them for cash, and sometimes on credit, at her home and at the T’DJILLA market, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20), to be used to pay for the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To buy "canaris" (pottery containers)

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man with three children.  He has been quarrying for sixteen years.  In his business, he has employed five people.  He was previously employed in a quarry before he decided to start his own business.  He has been able to get knowledge running his business through the trainings offered by Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to own a lorry to transport the stones in the future. He will use the 50,000 kes to hire an excavator.

loans.use: To hire an excavator

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; la socia tiene 36 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende diferentes productos como arroz,aceite,azúcar,leche,golosinas entre otros más, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio del cual se siente feliz, a la vez la socia también vende productos de belleza como perfumes,colonias,cremas entre otros la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercaderia para su tienda de abarrotes y comprar mas productos de belleza para sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank ” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”. The bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo,  which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Valentina. She is 36 years old and has a partner and 2 children. The member alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells different products such as rice, oil, sugar, milk and candy, among other things. The member has already had a good time in this business for which she feels happy. The member also sells beauty products such as perfumes, colognes, and creams among other things. The member is a very happy person with a lot of desire to move forward for her family.

The member requests this loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store and to buy more beauty products for her clients.

The member is happy because of the loan and promises to fulfill her payment installments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her grocery store and to buy more beauty products for her clients.

loans.name: Kitembe Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Lawrence is a thirty-six-year old married man with three children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married to a teacher and they both contribute to the welfare of the family. He lives in his own house and, in total, there are thirteen family members.

For two years he has been trading in alcohol. He started by selling four jerrycans per week but he now sells fifteen despite the challenges of transport and competition from other alcohol brands. He is a member of Kitembe Tukwatanize group which literally means "we should cooperate". His desire is to set up a bar and also to supply the western region of the country.

Lawrence intends to use the loan to purchase alcohol for sale.

loans.use: to purchase alcohol to sell

loans.name: Rabih

texts.ar: ربيع طبيب يعمل في مهنته هذه اكثر من 15 سنة متزوج وعمره 64 سنة له 3 اولاد يتميز بحبه لهذه المهنة له عيادة خاصة به لكنها في منطقة في ضيعته حتى يخدم بها اهل ضيعته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ماكنة لتبييض الاسنان من الخارج فهو طموح ويحب ملاحقة التطور في العمل وشراء المعدات الجديدة حتى يقدم من خلالها الخدمات لأهل منطقته وضيعته له زبائن ايضا من محيطه ومن الخارج يتميز عمله بالنظافة والدقة والجدير بالذكر انه يمتلك خبرة واسعة في هذه المجال وهذا ما يميز عمله يحلم بأن يقيم مركز طبي كبير في ضيعته ليخدم من خلاله اهل ضيعته وخاصة الفقراء منهم
texts.en: Rabih is a 64 year old dentist. He is married with three children. He loves his work and owns a private clinic in his neighbourhood where he serves his neighbours. He wants a loan to buy tooth- whitening   equipment from abroad. Rabih wants to get state- of – the art equipment to keep abreast with the latest in his work and to better serve his neighbourhood. He has many customers from his neighbours and those who know him. He is known for his exhaustive experience and professionalism. Rabih wishes to open a large medical centre to serve all people in his neighbourhood, especially the poor.

loans.use: to buy tooth-whitening equipment for his dental clinic

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno.  Es soltera, tiene 63 años de edad y 2 hijos menores. Cuenta con grado de instrucción primaria incompleta.
María se dedica a la venta de comidas, prendas de vestir como casacas, chompas y también golosinas. Trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, con lo que pudo incrementar mercadería a su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará ropa, artefactos, DVD, licuadoras, radios y otros, para luego venderlos.  María trabaja sola en su negocio.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando con el negocio y poder abrir otra tienda donde pueda ofrecer más productos..
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, la orientación para el uso del préstamo, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Puno. She is 63 years old, single, and has two children. María was not able to complete her elementary school education.

She sells food, sweets, and clothing such as jackets and sweaters. María has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan in the amount of 300 PEN was used to increase the inventory of her business.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy clothing, appliances, DVDs, blenders, radios, and other items to sell at a later time. María works alone in her business.

Her dream is to continue working in her business and open another store where she can offer more products. The things that she likes about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loans, the guidance provided on how to utilize the loan, and the promptness and responsibility of her group.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, appliances, movie discs, blenders, radios, and other items.

loans.name: Yara

texts.es:
La señora Yara es socia del banco comunal Las Dalilas del Distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos, tres mayores y 2 menores que todavía están a su cargo.
Se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos y perfumería por catálogo, y recién lleva 6 ciclos trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará 1 cuarteto de sombras, 2 rubores, 1 delineador de labios, 2 talcos para damas, 4 desodorantes, 1 crema para manos, 1 crema para cabello, 1 crema anti-arrugas, 2 colonias para después del baño, 2 bloqueadores, 1 perfume de mujer, 2 perfumes para hombres.
Tiene que tener mercadería en su vitrina para poder ofrecer a sus clientes, que a veces acuden a ella para hacer algún regalo y sacarles del apuro.
Está educando a sus hijos sola con su trabajo, agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de pertenecer a su familia y más que todo por la confianza que no piensa defraudar.
texts.en:
Sra. Yara is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Dalilas” in the District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and has five children. Three of them are adults and the other two are minors who are still under her care.

Yara sells cosmetics and perfumes through catalogs. She has participated in six loan cycles with Manuela Ramos. With this new loan of 2000 PEN, she will buy a four-pack of eye shadows, two blushes, one lip liner, two talcum powders for women, four deodorants, one hand crème, one hair crème, one anti-wrinkle crème, two after-bath sprays, two sunscreens, one perfume for women, and two colognes for men.

Yara keeps her merchandise in a display cabinet so that she can offer them to her customers. There are times when they come to her when pressed for time and need to purchase a last-minute gift.

Yara is raising her children alone and her work enables her to support them. She is grateful for being given the opportunity to be part of the Manuela Ramos family. Most of all, she is thankful that everyone has the confidence that she will not disappoint them.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, and toiletries.

loans.name: Sop Coumba Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 27 mars 2008, il est composé de 21 femmes qui habitent le même village. Les principales activités que les femmes mènent sont le petit commerce et l'embouche ovine.


Coumba est la responsable du groupe, elle est mariée mère de deux enfants mais a aussi la charge de sa belle-sœur et deux neveux.Elle est habillée en vert debout à droite sur la photo. 

Elle achète les arachides et le niébé dans son village; elle fait la transformation artisanale de l'huile d'arachide et revend ses produits dans les villes voisines. Elle a une expérience de plus de onze ans dans ce domaine.

Avec son prêt elle souhaite acheter des arachides et du niébé en grande quantité pour augmenter ses revenus.

Elle appui son mari et son fils dans les dépenses familiales et renforce son épargne avec les bénéfices réalisés.
texts.en:
This group was created on March 27, 2008 and is composed of 21 women who all live in the same village. Their primary activities are petty trading and raising goats. 

Coumba is the leader of the group. She is married and the mother of two children but is also responsible for her sister-in-law and two nephews. She is wearing green, standing on the right in the photo.  

She buys peanuts and "niébé" (black-eyed peas) in her village. She prepares homemade peanut oil and sells her products in neighboring towns. She has more than 11 years' experience in this field. 

With her loan, she wants to buy large quantities of peanuts and "niébé" so that she can earn more. She helps her husband and her son in supporting the family and will be able to put aside more savings with the profit she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy "niébé" and peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta is from the village of Tinaclaan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Marrieta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marrieta owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Marrieta has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marrieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marrieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marrieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed and breeding livestock to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marrieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed and pigs to raise

loans.name: Bassma

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 30 years old, married and has four children. 

Bassma has been a tailor since 2000; she makes and repairs women’s clothing. She has more than 10 years experience, a good reputation, is committed to her work and loyal to her clients. 

She is requesting a $1,000 loan to buy a sewing machine and to purchase additional goods as a tissue and buttons. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, tissue and buttons

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina sells coffee and tea. He buys the coffee and tea from Vietnam and sells it in other provinces. His wife Net sells food at home. They have been married for over twelve years, and they live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

This is Lina's second Kiva loan. This loan request is for $1,000 to put an addition on his house.

loans.use: To put an addition on his house.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for nine years. He is 36 years old and married to Serah. He has four school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. This is his third loan. He has paid the other loans well and in good time. He intends to use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and pay labor costs.

In the future, Samuel hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Oscar Javier

texts.es: Oscar Javier tiene 41 años vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que dependen de él. El brinda el servicio de taller de refrigeración, el comenzó en su casa con el tiempo comenzó a trabajar en el ingenio San Antonio como contratista fue con el paso del tiempo que ya no pudo seguir porque lo jubilaron. Ahora el continua ofreciendo el servicio de manera personal. El financiamiento es para comprar productos como aceite para bombas, detector de fugas para gases refrigerantes y otras herramientas. Su deseo es acondicionar su local con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
Oscar Javier is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two dependent children. He has a workshop where he provides refrigerator repair services. Oscar started this business at home, but then he began working as an engineer for the city of San Antonio on a contract basis. After some time, he was not able to continue and is now retired. However, he still continues to offer personal service.

This loan will be used to buy items such as oil pumps, gas leak detectors, refrigerants, and other tools. His wish is to remodel his shop so that it has adequate conditions.

loans.use: to purchase oil pumps, gas leak detectors, refrigerants, and other tools.

loans.name: Rising Group

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Lydia from Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. She is married with three children, two attending school. Her son works in South Africa. She also cares for one dependent. 

Lydia runs a cross-border clothing business selling clothes and shoes. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenges faced are late payments and competition. Lydia has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothes from South Africa. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase disposable income and improve family's quality of life. In the future Lydia plans to have her own shop and employ people.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Novelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Novelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Novelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Jaime Wilbert

texts.es:
Jaime, es empleado de la alcaldía municipal de su localidad, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, el cubre los gastos del hogar por medio de su salario, por el momento la necesidad de Jaime es solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos para el hogar y pagar por las reparaciones del vehículo.
Dicho préstamo le ayudara para mantener el carro en buenas condiciones, transportando a su familia con más seguridad, su aspiración es mejorar la condición de vida de su familia, apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan superarse y tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jaime is a municipal government employee in the town where he lives with his wife and three children.  He covers his household expenses through his salary.  

At the present time, Jaime needs to apply for a loan in order to buy products for the home and to pay for vehicle repairs. This loan will help him maintain his car in good condition, and transport his family more safely.  

His goal in life is to improve his family's standard of living, and to support his children so that they can excel and have a better future.

loans.use: To pay for repairs to the family vehicle.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 36 years old. He is married and supports four people in his family. He is a farmer and he has been doing this work for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

Jeremiah learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan. He is planning to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers. He has repaid his previous loan successfully. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, to increase his wheat production and to educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and to buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. He is a hard working man who can do more, if supported financially

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Veronica Isabel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León la Señora Veronica Isabel tiene un negocio como otra alternativa económica desde hace 10 años, también labora en una institución en la localidad con 3 años de laborar. Es soltera y con 3 hijos  a los  que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. 

Unas de las necesidades que presenta la señora Veronica hoy en dia  es de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha permanecido en mal estado y en época de invierno se nota más la necesidad antes planteada, es por eso que tomó la decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora, por tal razón acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar  un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción comoláminas de zinc y pago de mano de obra,  para iniciar la  mejora de la vivienda en la reparación del techo, para mejor seguridad de la vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindará mejores condiciones a sus hijos.

Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporcionará a su familia un techo digno donde vivir  y mejorará la condición de sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the town of Telica in the department of León, Verónica Isabel has had a business for ten years, as an economic alternative.  She also has worked for three years in administration.  She is single with three children for whom she needs to provide the necessary conditions for them to develop.

One of Verónica's current needs is to improve the condition of her home, which has been in bad shape.  It's more noticeable in the winter season, so she decided to start the improvement.  This is why she approached CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy construction materials such as corrugated metal and labor, to start the home improvement with the roof repair, for better home security.  With this work she will be able to give her children better circumstances.

It's important to emphasize that doing this work will give her family a home worthy of living in and improve conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal to improve the roof.

loans.name: Ninoska Yamaly

texts.es:
Ninoska tiene 21 años de edad, esta soltera y vive con sus padres, Ninoska se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion,  desea invertir el credito en compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio, ya que sus clientes le estan pidiendo que tenga mas variedad de productos, y ella no quiere que sus clientes opten por comprar en otro lugar.
el sueno de Ninoska es graduarse de la Universidad.
texts.en:
Ninoska is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She has a business selling everyday consumer products from a store in her home.

Ninoska wants to invest this loan in the purchase of groceries to restock her business since her customers are requesting that she carry a wider variety of products. She does not want her customers to go shopping elsewhere.

Ninoska’s dream is to graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Cirila; la socia tiene 41 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 4 hijos; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia cambio de negocio actualmente ella se dedica al negocio de venta de mana (es como ojuelas a base de maiz),la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria,ella vende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de mana. La socia requiere el crédito para comprar mana y tambien comprar maiz para preparar mana.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is Cirila; she is 41 years old and married with four children.  She works in retail.

Cirila changed businesses.  Currently she works selling "maná" (it's like a pancake made with corn).  She works as a street vendor and sells from 9 a.m. until 6 p.m.  With this business she gets her children ahead.

Cirila wants to expand and improve the business selling maná.  She needs the loan to buy maná wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy maiz to prepare corn pancakes.

loans.name: Agustín

texts.es:
El señor Agustín tiene ya más D. diez años dedicándose a la reparación y ventas D. lavadoras y secadoras D. ropas. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar las partes D. las maquinas y así poderlas vender a un buen precio, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el ingreso del negocio, porque es la fuente D. ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Don Agustín desea mejorar su negocio y las ventas y así podrá tener más ganancias, y podrá darle es estudio necesario a su hijo.
texts.en: Agustín has been repairing washing machines and clothes dryers for over ten years.  He asks for a loan to buy spare parts for the machines so that he can sell them at good prices because he currently lacks the necessary capital for this investment and he doesn’t want to decapitalize the business because it’s his family’s source of income. Agustín wants to improve the business and sales so that profits will be higher and be able to proviD. his son with the necessary education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for washing machines and clothes dryers.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Josefa has been in this business for two years. Josefa earns more income from livestock, from selling peanuts and from a sari-sari (variety) store.

Josefa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
