Edgardo is 46 years old and married with three children. He is from Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. 

Edgardo owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of food products in his local community. Edgardo
has been in business one year and earns 6000 PHP a month. In 2011, Edgardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Edgardo is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Antonia Leticia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Junio.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Antonia,  tiene 31 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, el mayor estudian en escuela y el más pequeño en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es mecánico. Ella hace unos años estudio belleza en una Academia de la localidad.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ganar sus propios recursos se dedica a realizar trabajos de belleza, realiza todo tipo de trabajos como cortes de cabello, tinturados, manicure, pedicura, entre otros trabajos, trabaja todos los días y a las horas que sus clientes requieran de sus servicios, ella realiza sus trabajos tanto en su casa como a domicilio. Son seis años que viene dedicada a esta actividad y nunca le ha faltado trabajo en estos años.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, esmaltes y tigueras, cepillos, peinillas, etc. que necesita para ir aumentando sus servicios. Esta desde el inicio que se creó el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido de mucho para ir comprando sus herramientas y con esto mejorar sus ingresos.

Su sueño es tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The members of the 5 de Junio Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as City of the Royal Tamarinds. 

Here we meet Sra. Antonia, 31, who is married and has two sons, 9 and 4. The older one studies at school and the younger is in kindergarten. Her husband is a mechanic. Several years ago she took a beauty course in a local academy.

Antonia is a housewife who, in order to earn her own funds, offers beauty services. She does all kinds of work such as hair cutting, coloring, manicures and pedicures among others. She works every day and at the times when clients require her services. She works in their homes as well as in her own. She has been doing this job for six years and she has never lacked work during this time.

She will use this loan to purchase tints, nail polish, scissors, hairbrushes, combs, etc that she needs to continue expanding her services. She has been a member of the communal bank since its inception and is its treasurer. She enjoys it because the loans have enabled her buy her tools and with them to improve her earnings.

Her dream is to have a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy tints, nail polish, scissors, hairbrushes, combs, etc.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Vannak, 27, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Vannak bakes bread to sell and her husband is a construction worker. Vannak is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a sugarcane squeezer machine to produce sugarcane juice to sell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to purchase a new trailer to transport the sugarcane machine. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a sugarcane squeezer to produce sugarcane juice.

loans.name: Kasangaki

texts.en: Kasangaki is 34 years old, married and the father of two children. They live in Hoima, Uganda. He has no other dependents and his family goal is to educate his children up to university level. He is a farmer and has also traded in produce for the past three years. He faces the challenge of new taxes being levied on his goods. His business goal is to own a food store. Kasangaki needs a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sufficient stock to enable him  provide mobile agro-vet products supply to  small scale farmers in rural areas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ann would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Mr. Antonio is 66 years old. Ever since 30 years ago he has been doing the trade of fixing car door locks and handles, window and door seals, windshield washers, and windows and tint glasses, in which he has stood out because of his good service and honesty. His business is in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, in northern Mexico.

Since he finished elementary school he worked to help his parents. He has learned this business from experience. He started offering his services in the street but now he has the chance to rent a shop in which he has been getting known and he has earned many clients.

At the moment, Antonio needs a loan of $275 which he will employ to buy supplies and parts necessary to continue offering his services. He offers to pay back this quantity in 3 to 6 months.

You can help improve the life of this family and contribute to the growth of this business. Antonio sincerely appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


El señor Antonio tiene 66 años de edad, se dedica desde hace treinta años al oficio de arreglo de chapas y elevadores, colocación de empaques, limpiaparabrisas, vidrios y polarizados, en los cuales se destaca por su buen servicio y honestidad, en la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León, al norte de México, desde que salio de la escuela primaria trabajaba para ayudad a sus padres y con base en la experiencia ha aprendido este negocio. Empezó ofreciendo sus servicios en la calle pero ahora tiene la oportunidad de rentar un local en el que se ha dado a conocer y ha ganado muchos clientes.

En estos momentos Antonio necesita de un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra los materiales y refacciones que necesita para continuar ofreciendo sus servicios, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia y contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, Antonio agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her tomato-selling business

loans.name: Cresty

texts.en: Cresty S. is an experienced trader who sells yams to people in her neighborhood and has a shop in the market. She is from a rural area in Edo State, aged 32, married, and the mother of 5 children. She is a LAPO member. She has been in this business since 2000. She needs $400 to buy more yams to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more yams

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en: Haidar is 32 years old and the father of 2 children. He lives in Nabatieh, in south Lebanon and earns a living by working in his barbershop. Haidar enjoys his job and likes being in contact with his clients who have become his friends. He decided to start selling perfumes, creams and other beauty products to extend his business services. He also needs new barber tools so he can work more efficiently. Haidar is always striving to enhance his business.

loans.use: To buy the needed tools and beauty products for his barber shop

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
This is Mrs. Neema D., proudly displaying a new delivery to add to her collection of intricately patterned batik cloths and stylish local dresses. However beautiful her cloths may be though, there are many other shops in Dar es Salaam selling similar stock, so competition is stiff. Neema therefore wants to strengthen her business by diversifying. She requires a loan of $275 so that she can also begin selling tailoring supplies such as buttons, pins, zips, needles, lining…small things, yes, but things that are in high demand in Tanzania, where most people have their clothes custom-made (this is actually cheaper and obviously much more interesting!) and then mended when they tear or fray. Neema hopes that this new venture will generate a constant turnover that will enable her to continue assisting her husband to support their family of three children.

About the microloan partner:

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Neema would like to diversify her business by purchasing and selling tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Rindy

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Rindy, 39, is a widow with six children—two sons and four daughters. Two of her children work in a garment factory, three children attend the local school, and other child works on the farm. Her husband died many years ago. She and her family lives along National Road number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Rindy started her farm when she was young. Currently, she grows tomatoes to sell in the market. All her children help her on the farm whenever they have free time.

Ridy requests this loan for $200; it's her first loan request from MAXIMA. She will use this money to expand her tomatoes farm.

loans.use: Expand tomatoes farm

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng, 40, is the mother of 3 children and has a small grocery store at her house. She makes $20 a day. Her husband, U., sells cassavas at the market and earns $6 a day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of $125 to add her inventory and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her inventory

loans.name: Banda B3B C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hamidah W.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Hamidah is 35 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from age 7 to 22 and her children go to school. Each week, Hamidah makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her children's education. Hamidah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hamidah is joined in her small group by Harriet N., Sylvia N., Yasin B., and Iddi Z.. Harriet N. has a business in charcoal sales and wants to stock more charcoal. Sylvia N. is currently operating a stone quarrying business and wants a loan to purchase more quarrying equipment. Yasin B. operates a stone quarrying business and wants to add more capital. Iddi Z. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan to increase inventory.

loans.use: To add more working capital to fish business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 34 years old and a mother of two children. Juliana was selling only eggs when she got a loan from Sinapi three years ago. Since then, she prepares and sells various Ghanaian dishes [including fufu and banku (starchy accompanients to stews and sauces), rice balls, boiled yams, and red-red (boiled beans with palm oil)] to workers in Obuasi.

Juliana wants to use her new loan to purchase more ingredients--fresh yams, beans, palm oil, ripe plantain, bags of rice and bags of maize--to prepare her dishes. She plans to move her work space from her house to a place in the business center.

Juliana is a member of the group called “Nyame Nhyira” (meaning God’s Blessing). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase fresh yams, bags of beans, gallons of palm oil, bags of rice, bags of maize, etc.

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok S. is 68 years old. She lives with her husband, pictured here, and has six children. Most of her children have married and moved out of the house. Mok farms together with her husband, and earns a total of around $1 a day. Mok would like to invest in a water pump system to irrigate their crops, and cut down of the expense of using their neighbor’s pump, which is extremely far from Mok’s farm. Mok would use this money to further her farm and support her family.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
Ventura is 37 years old, is single, and is a merchant. She also works as a receptionist for the city government of Paraguarí.

Ventura started her business over twelve years ago, opening a small booth where she sold undergarments. Thanks to a loan from the “Fundación Paraguaya,” she was able to strengthen her business which has helped her to gain the large clientele she now has and has noticeably improved the quality of her life.

Ventura needs a loan to purchase garments for the season, now that winter is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ventura tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera, comerciante, también trabaja como recepcionista de la gobernación de la Ciudad de Paraguarí.

Ventura inició su actividad hace más de 12 años, abriendo una pequeña casilla en donde vendía lencería, gracias al crédito adquirido de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo consolidar su negocio, lo que la ayudó para que actualmente cuente con una numerosa clientela y ha mejorado notablemente su calidad de vida.

Ventura necesita del crédito para adquirir prendas de temporada, ya que se avecina el invierno.

loans.use: Purchase of Winter Clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of pants and shirts to restock a small business.

loans.name: Jaime Elías

texts.es:
Jaime is 22 years old, and lives with his family in a rented house. He is an optimistic farmer who grows potatoes and corn. Jaime has been doing this work for four years with the same enthusiasm as when he started. He enjoys spending the day in the company of his fellow farmers, who are pleasant people. But above all, farming earns a satisfactory income. The problem is that because of the cold climate and frosts, one has to be careful in caring for the crops. Jaime is primarily motivated by his family's wellbeing. He needs a loan to invest in land, which will help him increase the number of hectares that he can use to cultivate crops, and thereby sell a larger quantity of products in the capital city.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Jaime tiene 22 años, junto a su familia vive en una casa alquilada. Es un optimista agricultor que trabaja en la siembra de papa y maíz, actividad que realiza hace 4 años con el mismo entusiasmo con el que inició. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo, es que puede compartir con sus compañeros de trabajo la jornada, que en compañía es bastante grata y sobre todo que esta actividad le brinda satisfactorios ingresos.El problema es que por el clima frío y las heladas, por ello debe ser muy precavido para el cuidado de sus sembríos. El principal motivo de su esfuerzo en la agricultura es su familia y el bienestar de los suyos. Jaime requiere el dinero que solicita para invertirlo en la compra de terrenos que le ayuden a incrementar sus hectáreas de cultivo y así, comercializar mayor cantidad de productos llevándolos a la ciudad capital

loans.use: Purchase of land to increase his arable land

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta C. est âgée de 22 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des graines d’arachide et à les transformer en pate afin de la revendre. Elle va aussi acheter et revendre du nététou (graine d’un arbre transformée en produit alimentaire local). Son commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins familiaux. <b>Elle remboursera ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Fanta C., 22, is married and the mother of 3 children. She would like to use this loan to bolster her business which consists in buying peanuts and transforming them into peanut butter to sell. She is also going to buy and re-sell nététou (the seeds of a tree which are transformed into a local food product). Her business allows her to contribute to family expenses. She will reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and re-sale of nététou, the seeds of a tree transformed into a food product

loans.name: Josefa Sabina

texts.es:
Doña Josefa tiene 46 años de edad, estudió quinto de primaria, es viuda y progenitora de cuatro hijos (uno casado y tres solteros). Vive en el Jr. Trujillo s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Desde el año 2001 es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz. En un inicio obtuvo un crédito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles con el que compró galletas, gaseosas, golosinas para equipar su tienda de abarrotes. Desde los 15 años de edad aprendió a vender mana y frutas por cuenta propia, a los 19 años de edad formó su hogar, su esposo era ganadero y juntos empezaron a vender verduras, carne de alpaca y abarrotes. Actualmente vende ropa, chompas, casacas, pantalones, ropa para niños, etc., los cuales los lleva a las ferias de Ancomarca, Capaso y Vilcanota. Josefa compra mercadería de Juliaca, Desaguadero.

Con este crédito de S/.2,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprará 01 docena de chompas a S/.160, 01 paquete de pantalones de lana a S/.85, 01 docena de casacas a S/.250.00, etc.

Su meta es instalar una tienda de ropa y abarrotes en Mazocruz y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Doña Josefa is 46 years of age, studied to the fifth grade of primary school, and is a widow and mother of four children (one married and three single). She lives in Jr. Trujillo, district of Mazocruz, province of El Collao, Puno. Since 2001 she has been a member of the community bank "Generación 2000" in Mazocruz. At the beginning, she obtained a loan for 300 Soles with which she bought cookies, sodas, and sweets to stock her little grocery store. Since she was fifteen years old, she learned to sell fruits on her own. At age nineteen, she made her home; her husband was a rancher and together they began to sell vegetables, alpaca meat, and groceries. Presently, she sells, clothes, sweaters, dress coats, pants, kids clothes, etc., which she carries to the markets of Ancomarca, Capaso, and Vilcanota. Josefa buys merchandise from Juliaca, Desaguadero. With this loan of 2000 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy one dozen sweaters at 160 Soles, one pack of wool pants at 85 Soles, one dozen dress coats at 250 Soles, etc. Her goal is to install a clothing and grocery store in Mazocruz and to see her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters, wool pants, dress coats, etc.

loans.name: Mohruhsor

texts.ru: Хисорова Мохрухсор жительница района Гиссар.Возраст  31 год,замужем,имеет 3 детей.Клиентка занимается куплей продажей детской одежды.Торгует на местном рынке района Гиссар.Иммет опыт в бизнесе более 6 лет. На кредит клиентка хочет закупить сезонную одежду. Планирует погасить кредит в течении  12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mohruhsor H. resides in the Gissar region. 31-years-old, married and the mother of three children, she buys and sells children's clothing. She plies her trade at the local Gissar regional market, and has more than six years' experience in the business. Mohruhsor wants to purchase seasonal clothing with this loan, and plans to repay it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap K. is a 29-year-old who has three children, all of whom still young, and they live in Ptasrong Commune, Pursat Province. Her husband, Mr. Saov Shon, is 28 years old. They are both local farmers who grow rice and vegetables for revenue to buy food for their kids to eat. Pheap requests a loan of 1,500,000 riel ($375) to purchase a buffalo for plowing their farmland for their rice crop yield. She hopes that a loan will help her to increase rice production higher than previous years. (Mrs. Pheap was not available, so her husband is pictured instead).

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet Y. is 43 year old and married woman with six children.  Three of her children have completed high school while the youngest three are still in school.  Janet runs a business selling a variety of footwear, ranging from shoes to slippers, for all age groups.  

She has managed this business for three years.  Janet buys her goods from big cities and sells them at the local markets. According to her, business has been going well, despite her limited working capital.  It is Janet’s dream to expand her business by trekking to other towns to market her goods. This will require an increase in her working capital, hence, the request for the loan. 

Janet is in the “Kristo Tease” (meaning, Christ lives) Trust Bank group in her community.  In this group, the members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of footwear

loans.name: Mercy B.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Mercy K. from Mbeya. She is married with one child who is four years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans whose parents died of AIDS. Mercy has been running a tailoring business since 2006.

She works at the business for 13-16 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Mercy currently earns about 210 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 550 USD in order to purchase threads for making clothes. In the future, she plans to start making other types of clothes. Mercy thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase threads for making clothing

loans.name: Shelby

texts.en:
Shelby lives in the small rural village of Yeban Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 39 years old and married to a farmer named Domelio. The couple has three children. Xyrus, who is 15 years old, is in the third year of high school. Xymund is 8 years old and in grade two. The youngest, Rochelle, is 6 years old and still in kindergarten.

Shelby maintains a village store. It has been an important source of income for her family, supporting both their farming needs and the basic needs of the family. Shelby works hard and recognizes that an entrepreneur must have a good attitude in order to maintain her customers.

Shelby is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000.00 to expand her store with additional products, such as candies, soft drinks, breads, and other basic commodities that are in demand. By expanding her business, she hopes to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Mr. Moa Un Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people who live in Preaek Pang village in Kandal Province have formed this village bank loan. All the members will use the loans which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. Moa U. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. On his farm, he now faces a small problem because his field has infertile soil which is affecting the crop. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. He will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support the field to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Lis Pong, is a recycling collector who buys waste such as empty bottles, cans, plastic and so on to re-sell in a recycling factory. Mr. Moa U. is 35 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are recycling collectors while two others help him in farming and the youngest one is attending the local school. Another loan member, Mr. Khorn K. did not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his field and to buy fuel to support the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Shahzodamo

texts.ru: Холматова Шахзодамо проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 35 лет, Не замужем. Домохозяйка. Занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. Опыт в бизнесе уже восемь лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить молодую корову. Она нужна ей для того чтобы получить породистое потомство. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shahzodamo H. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 35 years old, unmarried, and a housewife. She breeds cattle. She has eight years experience in business. She plans to take out a loan to buy a young cow. She needs it to establish a pedigreed bloodline. She can repay the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying young cows

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba S. is fifty years old. She is a widowed woman with four children who are all independent. Her husband died from a prolonged sickness. Araba had to struggle to provide for the basic needs of her children.

Araba is a very active and hard-working woman in her business. She went into business right after completing elementary school. She did not have the opportunity to attend high school. Araba sells cereals such as maize, groundnuts, and beans, and other food items. She buys these crops directly from the farmers at a relatively low price. She sells them at the local market in the town where she lives with her family. She also treks with some of her goods to nearby markets to sell.

Araba says she wants to use the loan to buy the goods in bulk so that she can distribute them to more customers. Araba belongs to a village bank called "Otease" which means "He lives." She would grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more cereals

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes  du groupe  Danaya  qui sont toutes mariées ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la restauration, la vente de tissus wax, de  pomme de terre, de fruits  etc.
Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter et d’accroître leur chiffre d’affaires.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter 10 paniers de condiments,  200 kg de riz pour la restauration, 25 sacs de 100 kg d’oranges ,15 panier de fruits (mange et orange) et 30 sacs de 100 kg de pomme de terre . Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et au Burkina Faso pays frontalier du Mali. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  et souvent de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant et en détail.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour subvenir aux frais de scolarité et de santé  des enfants  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Danaya are all married and average 36 years of age and 2 children each. They live in monogamous families in Médine, a district in Sikasso City, third administrative region of Mali. They do a diversity of work, including food catering, selling Wax cloth, potatoes, fruit, etc.

The group members are on their seventh collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing customer base and to increase their turnover.

With this loan, they intend to buy ten baskets of condiments, 200 kg of rice for catering, twenty-five 100-kg sacks of oranges, fifteen baskets of fruit (mangoes and oranges), and thirty 100-kg sacks of potatoes. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in Burkina Faso, a country bordering Mali. The merchandise is sold retail, in cash transactions, to customers composed of women and men, at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and often door-to-door.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 28,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used to meet schooling and health care costs for the children, and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María  es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
María  es casada tiene 50 años, 1 hijo de 29 años, que trabaja. 
María  tiene un locutorio, ella empezó vendiendo cerveza y gaseosa, quería poner una bodega pero por su casa habían muchas, lo que por su barrio no había era locutorio, es cuando decide poner un locutorio el cual ella lo administra. 
María  necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la  construir su casa para poner un internet.
Desde que María está en Finca aprendió a horrar, a ser solidaria con la gente, ahora tiene más amigas que pueden compartir de inquietudes del negocio.
El sueño de María es terminar su casa y poner un internet.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community bank of Los Viñedos.She is 50 years old, and is married with a 29 yr old son who works. Maria owns a long-distance call center where she has started selling beer and sodas. Originally she wanted to put in a small grocery store, but there where many in her neighborhood. The thing that was missing was a place to make long-distance calls, which is why she decided to put in the call center that she currently runs. Maria needs a loan of 1200 Sols so that she can expand her house (out of which she operates the business), and add on an internet cafe. Since Maria has been in FINCA, she has learned to save and to be there for people, and now she has more friends who can support her through the worries that come along with owning a business. Maria's dream is to finish construction on her house and put in an internet cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Tuna

texts.en:
Tuna E. makes a living selling tomatoes and green vegetables, and is applying for this loan to open up a butcher's shop. She is 35 years old and married a businessman who owns a shop in the nearby Juba market. Tuna has five children who attend school. With the extra profits made possible by expanding her business, Tuna hopes to build her own home.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to open up a butcher's shop

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac A. is married and has 1 child. He has received primary schooling. Isaac is a fisherman in Abotoase, a small fishing community near Hohoe. His wife is a hairdresser whose business is not very big and generates little income. Isaac uses all of his income taking care of the financial responsibility for the child and other housekeeping expenses.  With the high demand for fish in the community and beyond, Isaac will use the loan to purchase a bigger net for fishing. Isaac plans to save the new profits from his expanded business.

loans.use: Purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Sabougnouma  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Sabougnouma 4 sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 2 enfants et  vivant dans des familles polygames à Djambougou  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé,  sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leurs troisièmes collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences,  des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 17.5 hectares.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêts et  aider les maris à subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Sabougnouma 4 group are all married and average 36 years of age and 2 children. They live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. They mainly grow peanuts and millet. They are seeking their third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans ended without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 17.5 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women. They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 85) per campaign, to be used to repay the loan and help their husbands to provide for the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 17.5 hectares

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Carol A. is a single mother with one child, aged 5 years. She runs a coffin and furniture business. She has been operating this business for one year now. She solely depends on this business to pay rent, feed her family and pay school fees for her daughter. Her dream is to invest in her daughter through education and open branches in other regions. She is requesting a booster loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more timber for her business.

loans.use: Boost business by buying more timber

loans.name: Asifiwe

texts.en:
Asifiwe is a member of the Ikweta centre,she is 26 years old woman she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 4 and 1 years.

Asifiwe started he own food business selling  fruits,tomatoes, and vegetable 2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 20,000 Tsh.

This is Asifiwe`s first loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits and vegetable.

With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan Asifiwe hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy morem vegetable and fruits

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita P. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Julita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Julita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her busness

loans.name: Karla Evangelina

texts.es: Karla Evangelina P. de 31 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque, junto a su esposo y su hijo de nueve años de edad. Ella posee una tienda en su casa en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, los cuales logra venderlos muy bien, ya que posee una buena clientela. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder invertir más en su negocio y comprar más productos, los cuales tienen mucha demanda en el lugar. Su deseo es mejorar sus ventas para poder contribuir junto a su esposo y tener una vida mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Karla Evangelina P. is 31. She lives in Tonacatepeque with her husband and nine year old son. She has a store in her house where she sells basic needs products. She is doing very well selling them. She has a good client base. She is asking for a loan to be able to invest more in her business and buy more products. There is much demand in her place. Her wish is to improve her sales to be able to contribute with her husband and to have a better life with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rukiri 2 Group

texts.en: B. Lucas is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is a determined and hardworking man who owns a retail shop and an alcohol store in Nyarukika trading centre. He has done this for 15 years. He is 42 years old and married with 6 children, most of whom are in secondary school; he takes care of 2 dependants. Due to Lucas’ good service, he is able to make a sizable profit, which he uses to take care of his family and to acquire other family properties. Lucas would like to continue with his business; indeed, he wants to expand by offering more products and thus increasing income. He is seeking a loan to help restock his business with more products such as beer and wine, in order to make more of a profit. He is really grateful for his loans.

loans.use: restocking his retail shop and buying beer and wine

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis O. is married and has six dependants. He has received schooling through junior high. Francis is a young entrepreneur who does furniture and other carpentry work in Abotoase, which he has done since 2004. Francis uses his income to finance the children's educational expenses and take care of the home single-handedly. Francis will use the loan to purchase wood to process into furniture for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Francis plans to reinvest.

loans.use: Francis will use the loan to purchase wood to process into furniture for sale.

loans.name: Jovymar

texts.en:
Jovymar A. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 18 years old, married, and has 1 child who is an infant. To make a living, Jovymar owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovymar is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jovymar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, and is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jovymar from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Juan Leonardo

texts.es: El señor Juan Leonardo V. , es un hombre agricultor desde hace mas de 40 años , gracias al apoyo que obtuvo de sus suegros que le brindaron un predio baldío para que lo trabaje y pueda apoyar a su familia , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta que, El cultivo de piña es atacada por plagas ya que carecen de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para combatir dicha epidemia , el quiere comprar los insumos necesario para sacar una buena producción y vender a un mejor precio para poder pagar el desembolso e invertir en casa de habitación que todavía le hace falta construir , don Juan habita en un barrio pobre del municipio de su familia junto a su esposa y ocho hijos todos independientes , los sueños de don Juan es poder comprar un camión pequeño para trasladar el producto al mercado ya que tiene que pagar y eso le merma la ganancia .
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Leonardo V. has been working as a farmer for more than 40 years, thanks to the support of his parents-in-law, who gave him a vacant piece of land to work and use to support his family. The biggest difficulty facing Juan is that the pineapple crop is attacked by pests as he lacks fertilizers and the materials necessary to combat such an epidemic. He wants to buy the necessary products to achieve a good harvest and sell at the best price, in order to be able to make a down payment on completing the necessary construction on his house. Juan lives in a poor neighborhood in his town with his family and their eight independent children. Juan's dream is to be able to purchase a truck to take his product to the market, as now he has to pay for this service, subtracting from his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and pesticides to protect his harvest.

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en: Kwadwo is fifty-two years old. He is married with two kids aged four and one. He operates a pharmaceutical shop in his neighborhood and sells various kinds of drugs like blood tonic, pain killers, and malaria drugs. Many local people patronize his pharmacy for first aid drugs and cures when they are sick. He wants to use the loan to increase his supplies of drugs to include others that are frequently requested by his customers. He hopes to raise a good income to take care of his family.

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical drugs in bulk.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la producción de leche la cual  comercializa  a Pil Andina, planta Industrializadora de leche.
 
Vive en la comunidad de Chijipina Chico  sector Achacachi de Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa y sus  cinco hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. 
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Alfonso raises cows and produces milk, which he sells to Pil Andina, an industrial milk plant. He lives in the community of Chijipina Chico in the Achacachi sector of Omasuyos province, in the departament of La Paz, which is located 4 hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and their five school-aged children. The loan will be used to purchase an improved breed of cattle, which will increase his milk production and as a result, increase his income. This is his second loan with IMPRO. Their evaluation qualified him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to increase his production of milk

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es:
el sr. Jose G. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en la colonia Brisas del Valle en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, Jose es zapatero, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. con esta actividad a sacado a su familia adelante.
en estos momentos necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para fabricar los zapatos, ya que viene la temporada escolar y aqui es donde el vende un poco mas.
el sr. Jose es una persona de edad y esta es la unica actividad que el puede realizar para ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Jose G. is 65 years old and lives in the Brisas del Valle area in the city of Tegucigalpa. Jose is a shoemaker, and has worked in this business for many years. With this activity, he has gotten his family ahead. Now he needs credit to purchase more materials to make shoes, as the school term is about to begin, and this is when he makes more sales. Jose is elderly and this is the only activity he can carry out to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather, laces, threads, templates

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has two grinding machines that she uses to grind foodstuffs including beans, corn, tomatoes and pepper. She also sells garri, rice and yam flour. A hardworking woman, Hannah leaves her home as early as 5 a.m.to buy foodstuffs in large quantities to sell to her customers at retail prices. In this business for a long time, she is now requesting a loan of NGN100,000 to purchase more food to sell.

Hannah, 50 years old, has five children and is married to a commercial driver who also supports the home. She is a client of LAPO, an organization committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Hannah says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Ou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao O. sells clothes and her husband, Mr. Phall Pork, is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support his family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sao O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more clothes to re-sell door-to-door. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is an employee in a garment factory, while two others are attending the local public school, and the other one is too small for school. 

This village bank includes 12 people who live in Doung Khpos village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sao O. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. They they will use their loan for different purposes. Mrs. Him Seum and Mrs. Saroeun Seum are group guarantors so are included in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Denis Rafael

texts.es:
El joven Denis se desempeña como profesor de personas discapacitada( sordo – mudo) el cual estos alumnos oscilan entre las edades de 4-12 años donde tiene dos años de laborar para el ministerio de educación es casado con una hija de 3 años de edad.

Este crédito es para sufragar los gastos de su hogar ya que actualmente quiere meter en su casa los tubos para las aguas residuales y así mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Denis teaches disabled students (deaf-mute) whose ages range between 4-12 years. He has worked for the ministry of education for two years. He is married with a three year old daughter. This loan is to cover household expenses as he currently wants to put sewage water pipes in his house in order to improve the housing conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing expenses

loans.name: Rosalinda's Group

texts.en:
Rosalinda T. is from the village of Gomez San Isidro. She is 40 years old. Rosalinda is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosalinda T..

Rosalinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Onn

texts.en:
Mrs. Onn K. (pictured here) has asked for a Kiva loan one time already. Because the main source of income is from her daughter’s tailoring business, she is asking for her second loan of US $500 to purchase additional materials for her daughter’s tailoring business.

It would be better for Onn’s daughter to operate her business and respond to her customer’s needs as well.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her daughter’s tailoring business.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang T., 60, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia – an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer and grows rice for an income of about $1 US per day. Her husband is a farmer too, earning an income of $1 US per day to help cover the family expenses.

T. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner in Cambodia. T. is pictured with her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 42-year-old, single man. He lives with his two parents and is the sole income provider for his family. He has been working as an accountant since 1995. He operates his business out of his home. 

He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., in order to purchase two computers for his work. This will be his first loan from Ameen. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to buy 2 new computers for his accounting business

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana O., 49, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Antonio O., an operator, they are blessed with six children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn income so that their family can have a better life. To that end, she has been managing her own variety store, while renting out some apartment rooms. She also sells native rice cakes on the side.

Cresenciana has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. Cresenciana is able to be consistent in paying her dues because she used the loan money to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of additional capital to aid in buying groceries needed to replenish her varitey store's inventory. She will also invest some of the loan to purchase raw ingredients needed for her rice cakes. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy inventory and raw ingredients needed for her rice cakes.

loans.name: Shamsa

texts.en:
Shamsa is a happily married woman with a child who has already finished schooling and a husband who works as a coxswain. She owns a house with electricity and piped water.

Shamsa has been selling fresh water in a shop for over ten years, neighbors being her main customers. In addition she owns houses for rent as her other source of income. With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase a tank and a pumping machine. She cited machine breakdown and power Shortage as a major challenges in her business.

Shamsa hopes to invest in a hardware store some day. She decided to join Yehu because of its mission to provide sustainable financial services to rural social-economically-marginalized entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and a pumping machine

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María Inés tiene 57 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. San Simón, Departamento D.  Morazán, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, y su actividad es agropecuaria.
 Se dedica a la siembra D. maíz y crianza D. animales D. corral, siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad ya que vive en una zona rural que se presta para esta actividad, María necesita un préstamo para compra D. fertilizante y abono para obtener una buena cosecha D. maíz.
Esto ayudaría a garantizar que la familia D. María tenga un cosecha que les permita vender una parte y utilizar otra para el gasto del hogar, con la confianza que las lluvias sean favorables para la cosecha.
Su Objetivos son ayudar a su familia, generar ingreso para las necesidades básicas, y darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María Inés, age 57, lives in the San Simón municipality in the Morazán department. She lives with her husband and their three children. Her activity is farming. She plants corn and raises farm animals. She has always done this work because she lives in a rural area, which lends itself to this activity. María needs a loan to buy chemical and natural fertilizers in order to have a good corn harvest. This will help to guarantee that María’s family has a harvest, which will allow them to sell part of it and use the other part for household expenses. This is dependent upon the rains being favorable for the harvest. Her objectives are to help her family, to generate income for their basic needs, and to give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy natural and chemical fertilizers

location.town: Canton San Francisco, San Simon, Morazan.

loans.name: Esun-Erdene

texts.en:
Esun-Erdene P. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Tuv province, central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Suhtulga, is 41 years old and is a herdsman. Her children attend a local middle school. 

During the day, Esun-Erdene operates a food retail trading business at a small food stand/ kiosk which is located in front of the local primary school. She started her business in 2000 and after years of successful operations Esun-Erdene has managed to increase her working capital and hopes to expand her workplace as a food store.  She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to expand her small food stand.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Shown in the photo are Son V. and her husband who have spent their life cultivating crops. This is a skill they learned from their grandparents. This couple was married years ago and they have three children. Two of the children are married and one is single. Growing crops is an annual action with which they have had great success for several years. The family is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing; however, the family doesn’t have capital to use on their farm. So Son V. discussed this with her husband and decided to seek a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva de 36 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. El negocio a la que se dedica es la venta de celulares, tarjetas, accesorios para equipos móviles, por lo que cuenta con un puesto ubicado en el mercado más concurrido de su localidad. Durante todo el día atiende a sus clientes, quienes acuden a su establecimiento a buscar algún servicio. Lleva 2 años en este negocio, manifiesta sentirse satisfecha con su negocio y por las rentas que le genera, además se distrae conversando con cada uno de sus clientes. En adelante le gustaría ampliar su negocio con nueva mercadería, y también quiere terminar de construir su casa y ahí poner otra sucursal del negocio que realiza. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que este apoyo le será de mucha utilidad para su negocio, es por ello que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará celulares y más accesorios para ello, puesto que le es muy rentable, además puede aumentar la cantidad de mercaderías que vende.
texts.en:
Eva is 36 years old and is the hard-working mother of a family. She lives in her own home together with her husband and 3 children. Eva sells mobile phones, phone cards and mobile phone accessories. She has a stand located in the most popular market in her zone. All day she attends to her customers, who go to her establishment looking for different services. Eva has had this business for 2 years, and she feels satisfied with the business and the profits it generates. She also enjoys talking to her customers. In the future Eva wants to expand her business with new merchandise and also finish building her house, as well as install another branch of her business. This is Eva's first loan with MFP and she knows that this support will be very useful for her business, so she promises to meet the repayments when they are due. With this loan she will purchase mobile phones and more accessories for them, something which is very profitable, and she can also increase the amount of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mobile phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is a construction worker who is especially talented at completing projects that are made of wood. He went into this line of work five years ago and opened his own business in 2007. Despite his youth, he is happy to take on big projects and is making a good reputation for himself in this line of work. Thanks to the income generated by his business, he is now able to help his father meet their family's expenses. He is applying for a $1,000 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy the wood he needs to complete a new building project. In the future, he is planning to expand his business and open up a construction office for his company.

loans.use: to buy wood to complete a construction project

loans.name: Manos Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen Emiliana, tiene 53 años D. edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos los cuales ha sacado adelante y les ha dado profesión trabajando mucho y con el apoyo D. su esposo.
La Sra. Carmen Emiliana forma parte del grupo "Manos Forjadoras", integrado por 9 personas resientes del distrito D. Comas.
DesD. hace 32 años se dedica a atender su kiosko D. periódicos y revistas ubicado en una zona muy comercial del Centro D. Lima, desD. los 21 años siempre aompañada D. su esposo inició con éste negocio a consecuencia del despido D. trabajo D. su esposo, se vieron en la necesidad D. aprovechar que su esposo aprendió D. muy niño ésta actividad cuando ayudaba a su padre.
Gracias a éste trabajo han logrado pagar los estudios superiores D. sus hijos, construir su casa y sobretodo su satisfacción personal.
Con el préstamo recibido invertirá en la compra D. coleccion D. carros en miniatura que esta promocionando un diario local.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Emiliana is 53 years old, married, and has three children for whom she wants to succeed and proviD. the opportunity to pursue a profession. She works hard and has the support of her husband.

Carmen Emiliana is part of the group “Manos Forjadoras” (Forging Hands), which consists of nine members who live in the district of Comas.

For the past 32 years, Carmen Emiliana has been managing a newspaper and magazine kiosk in a commercial area in cental Lima. Since she was 21 years old, her husband has been helping her with this business since it was started because he was fired from his previous job. She took advantage of her husband’s knowledge of this business since he learned all about it by helping his father when he was a young boy.

Thanks to her work, Carmen has been able to pay for her children’s college education, build a house, and achieve personal satisfaction. The loan she received will be invested in the purchase of miniature cars that are being used to advertise a local newspaper.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase miniature cars that are being used to advertise a local newspaper

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa M. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she operates a tricycle transportation service. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $113 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy S. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. He is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Randy owns and operates a transportation business providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Randy has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,100 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Randy joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Randy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be his sixth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Reyna Isabel R. A. es trabajadora Activa de la empresa D.G.I desempeñándose como Responsable de Agencia tiene doce  años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo esta solicitando para ampliarle un cuarto más a su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs Reyna Isabel R. A. is a hard-working woman.  She works for the D.G.I (the Nicaraguan General Revenue Service) as a branch manager.  She has been working for the D.G.I for twelve years.  She has had two loans from CEPRODEL and each one has been used to buy building materials to extend and improve her house.  She is requesting this loan to add a room to her house.  Her loans with CEPRODEL have been of great benefit to her as they have helped her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Sand, cement, stone and blocks

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Madame   Amy D. habite a Bambilor. Elle est âgée  de 54 ans.  Elle est veuve et évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle pratique l’achat et la vente de poissons et de légumes. Les revenus qu’elles se procurent lui servent à soutenir ses enfants. Elle est sociétaire au guichet de Bambilor depuis juillet 2010 et sollicite un financement de 100000frs en vue  d’accroitre son fond de commerce pour mieux développer son activité de vente de poissons. L’accroissement de ses revenus lui permet de mieux prendre en charge le petit déjeuner et le diner de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy D. lives in Bambilor. She is a 54-year-old widow, and she has been working in sales for more than ten years. She does business buying and selling fish and vegetables, and the income she earns is used to support her children.

Mrs. D. has been a member of the Bambilor branch of the UIMCEC since July 2010. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs in order to increase her working capital to grow her business selling fish. The increase in income will allow her to better meet her family's breakfast and dinner expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in Kasur, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its leather industry. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in the Chaki Piaray Lal area. She is married to A. A. who has a shopping bag selling business. He purchases them in wholesale and sells them to shoppers in various markets, who use them to keep their purchases. He has been operating this business for over 10 years and earns a good income from it.

Shahnaz supports her family by doing embroidery work. She receives orders from neighboring clients and fulfills them on time to earn an income. This income helps her to pay the utility expenses and her children's school fees. She has three sons and three daughters. Her eldest daughter helps her with the embroidery business and the remaining children attend school.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy shopping bags in bulk for resale. She hopes that the loan investment will bring good profits to her husband and that his business will grow further. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In her previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy shopping bags for resale.

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.en:
Muhamadi is a 32-year-old married man with three children. He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo Uganda. He is a motorcyclist and has been in the transport sector for five years. 
He dreams of educating his children so that they can have a better future and putting up a permanent house and his business goal is to have atleast three motorcyvles.
Muhamadi wants a loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying another motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Elmer Farid

texts.es:
Elmer, es un joven propietario de un equipo de pesca (lancha), tiene 37 años de edad, reside en Usulután, vive con su familia tienen casa propia, el negocio de la pesca lo tiene desde hace 15 años, ha logrado comprar dos equipos de pesca, en el lugar donde viven esta cerca el mar y fuente de empleo para las personas de cerca como Elmer que a través de la pesca a mantenido a su familia por años. 
El está necesitando un préstamo para complementar la cantidad de dinero para la compra de un motor, ya que tiene incompleta una lancha para utilizarla.
Su objetivo es tener en óptimas condiciones su transporte para realizar su trabajo diario, ayudar a su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida de estos.
texts.en:
Elmer is a young man of 37 who owns his own fishing equipment (boat).  He lives in Usulután with his family and owns his own house.  He has had his fishing business for 15 years and was able to purchase two fishing boats.  He lives very close to the ocean.  This provides him and other residents in his area with a source of employment and has supported his family for years.  

Elmer has a boat that can't be used because it doesn't have a motor so he is requesting a loan to supplement his own money to purchase one.  His goal is to have his boats in optimal working condition in order to be able to do his job every day, help his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for his fishing boat

loans.name: Guljan's Group

texts.en:
Guljan R. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 21 and married. She has a 3-year-,old daughter. Three years ago with the initial investment of 1000 soms, Guljan and her husband started to resell coal. And now in this way, they earn 9000 soms per month. Guljan applied for the loan because she needs money to cover their family expenses.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: For personal needs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza, tiene 37 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Rosa es panificadora, se dedica a la elaboración de panes chaplas, aprendió de ésta actividad desde muy niña pues su madre era panadera. Ahora se dedica a ésta actividad con su pareja, por el momento trabajan en un hormo alquilado, atienden a clientes fijos y distribuyen en algunas bodegas y tiendas. Rosa solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura entre otros para la elaboración de panes chapla.
A Rosa le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por las capacitaciones que recibe por parte de su promotora, le hace reflexionar, y también porque puede acceder a los créditos .
El sueño de Rosa es poder tener su propio horno, ampliar para elaborar otro tipo de panes y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank named Granito de Mostaza (meaning Little Grain of Mustard). She lives with her life partner and they have 3 children togther. She is a baker and she makes Peruvian flat breads. She learned this business as a young girl from her mother who was also a baker. She manages her business together with her partner and currently they use an oven that is rented.  They have a steady clientele and they also distribute to a few grocery stores and convenience stores. Rosa requests a loan to invest in the purchase of flour, yeast and other ingredients she needs to make flat breads. 

Rosa enjoys the meetings with her communal banks, especially for the training she receives from her facilitator because it makes her think, and for the access to loans. 

Rosa's dream is to have her own oven and to start making other types of breads. She also wants to see her children grow up to have careers.

loans.use: To purchase flour and yeast.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman who lives in Compostela, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  pig fattening and kitchen utensils buy and sell businesses. Her husband Dioberto, who is 38 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are 6 to 17 years old. Evangeline joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evangeline has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to buy feed for the pigs and more kitchen utensils to resell to save up for her children's future education. Evangeline is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase feed and supplies for the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn to sell

loans.name: Oscar Moises

texts.es: El señor Oscar Moisés A. M. , tiene la edad de 30 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya , ellos tienen un hijo el cual tiene serios problemas de visión lo cual ellos ah luchado juntos para que operen al niño , don Oscar desde hace doce años trabajas las tierras que su suegro heredo a su esposa ; agradece Afodenic por brindarle la confianza de trabajar una manzana de piña ya que esta antes salía pequeña y de color rojizo.  Esta vez su situación e s diferente ya que gracias al cuidado y al asesoramiento de nuestro  agrónomo logro tener hijos de piñas y poder sembrar más. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para la plantación.
texts.en: Mr. Oscar Moises A. M. is 30 years old and he lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives together with his wife who works as a merchant selling fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market. They have a son who suffers from serious vision problems which is why they have both worked hard to give their son an operation. Oscar has been working the land for the past two years, an inheritance given to his wife by his father-in-law.
