He is thankful to Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) for providing him the support to continue work at a pineapple plantation.  The pineapples use to produce small reddish fruits. This time it will be different because thanks to the care and agricultural assessment he managed to have pineapple sprouts and he is now able to plant more. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and materials for his plantation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other agricultural products

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a seller of RTW (ready-to-wear) clothes in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells shirts, jeans and also slippers. She has been in this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more clothes to resell.

Martina is married to a driver. They have 2 kids aged 6 and 12. Martina says that she and her husband work hard to provide for their family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: John Memusi

texts.en:
John Memusi is 30 years  old.  He is married and has three children. He has been in the livestock trading business for the last two years.

John was introduced to KADET LTD by KADET staff in his area of residence.  He is applying for his first loan which he plans to use to purchase more animals for sale. He intends to use the returns from this loan to reinvest in his business and to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous businessman in the area and to educate his children to higher levels of education. He an assiduous man despite  his age who struggles to achieve his goals when funded.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Danis Esther

texts.es: Danis Esther tiene una microempresa donde ofrece servicios de telecomunicaciones y también vende mercancía en general. Ella vive en el barrio el Limón con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 8 años cada uno. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y tiene como  meta invertirlo en la compra de una fotocopiadora, para aumentar los servicios de fotocopiaje que aún no presta en masas, tal como  su clientela lo  requiere,  pues ha aumentado y Danis  necesita ser más competitiva en su negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, aprovechando su infraestructura física y su mercado actual, donde ofrece servicios de telefonía nacional e internacional , fax e internet y fotocopiaje; así Danis mismo vende mercancía mediante guías especializadas, como productos de belleza y de aseo personal, además de cosméticos y accesorios femeninos . Su meta es diversificar su negocio, adicionando productos de papelería porque quiere crecer y responder a su gran desafío de tener su propia  casa. Mientras tanto sus negocios le ofrecen una rentabilidad no menos del 20,7%  y sus inventarios rotan cada 4 días y ella se esmera permanentemente por trabajar en función de hacer de su negocio una empresa estable, para unida a su familia  alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Danis Esther has a micro-business selling telecommunication services and general merchandise.  She lives in the "Limón" neighborhood with her husband and her eight-year-old twins.  This is her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She plans to use it to buy a photocopy machine to increase her copying services since she is unable to provide large volume service, which is in demand.  Danis needs to be competitive in her business in order to generate more income.  She wants to take advantage of the physical infrastructure she has and the current market, offering national and international telephone, fax, internet and photocopy services.

Danis also sells merchandise through specialized catalogues such as beauty products, personal care, cosmetics and ladies' accessories.  Her goal is to diversify her business by adding stationery supplies and grow enough to be able to have her own home.  Meanwhile, her business gives her a profit of 20.7%, with a turnover of 4 days.  She works hard to make her business stable so that she and her family can carry out their dreams.

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine

loans.name: Sarait

texts.es:
La señora Sarait es socia del banco comunal Shipibas del Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija menor de edad.
Tiene su negocio que funciona en su propia casa, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, zapatos y demás accesorios para damas, lleva 2 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 6 blusas, 9 pares de zapato, 5 carteras, 6 pantalones, 6 shores,  1 maniquí. 
Esta formalizando su negocio, antes vendía ofreciendo a sus amistades, ahora cuenta con un local propio y espera contar con todo sus documentos para poder abrir su local, solo espera que le vaya bien y que Manuela Ramos siga otorgándole los préstamos para ir implementando mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Sarait is a member of the "Shipibas" communal bank in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 37 years old, married, and has one young daughter.

She has a business that she runs out of her own house. She sells clothing, shoes, and accessories for women. She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for two years.

With her new loan of 2,500 nuevos soles, she will buy six blouses, nine pairs of shoes, five wallets, six pairs of pants, six pairs of shorts, and one mannequin. 

She is in the process of formalizing her business. She used to just sell to her friends, but now she has her own storefront and hopes to have all of the papers to open her location soon. She only hopes that it will go well and that Manuela Ramos will continue offering her loans so that she can further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and wallets

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene  56  años de edad y  vive junto a su esposa en una casa propia,  en la zona rural del distrito de Illimo en Lambayeque.  El hogar de Fernando solo cuenta con el servicio básico de luz.

Fernando tiene 20  años de experiencia en la crianza de animales. El cuenta con una amplia demanda que incluye clientes fidelizados a él y a sus crías.
 
Fernando comercializa sus animales por toda la zona de Illimo y la  gran demanda con la que cuenta se debe a la buena crianza de sus animales. Él sabe que darles la mejor alimentación le trae beneficios pues sus animales crecen fuertes y sanos y por eso  no tiene reparos en invertir en ello. 

Fernando solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que utilizará para hacer mejoras en su corral y para comprar alimento balanceado para sus crías.

Fernando ha cancelado puntualmente créditos con otras entidades.
texts.en:
Fernando is 56 years old and he lives together with his wife in a house of their own. It is located in the rural region of the district of Illimo in Lambayeque. Fernando's home is only equipped with electricity.

Fernando has 20 years' experience in raising livestock. He enjoys an ample demand from loyal clients seeking his livestock.

Fernando raises livestock throughout the entire region of Illimo and a the great demand that he enjoys is based on the good practices used to raise his livestock. He knows that giving them good feed will bring benefits especially because the animals grow strong and healthy and he does not need to invest in further care. 

Fernando requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles which will be used to make improvements on his coral and to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

Fernando has repaid his loans on time with other organizations.

loans.use: to improve his corral and to purchase balanced feed.

loans.name: Retchel

texts.en:
Retchel, from the village of Sebasi Clarin Misamis Occidental, is 28 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Retchel owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Retchel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more canned goods and snacks to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Cremildo Elias

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Xai-Xai, Provincioa de Gaza, sul de Moçambique é casado e pai  de 1 fillho de 7 meses de idade. Fez somente 7ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras na altura. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Xai-xai para Maputo com seus pais ainda menor de idade. Trabalha numa empresa denominada ICL-LDA ha mais de 9 anos e tem um negocio proprio que o ajuda aumentar o rendimento familiar. Recebe um salario de 5.500.00mt por mês e cerca de 4.000.00mt apartir do seu negocio onde aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar alguma parte por mês na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de vizinhos do seu bairro que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (pedra, areia, cimento, ferro e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem problemas e vai solicitar novos emprestimos para iniciara um negocio para a sua esposa.
texts.en:
Cremildo was born in the city of Xai-Xai, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of one 7-month-old son. He only went to school through the seventh grade and had to drop out because of his family's financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He and his parents left Xai-Xai for Maputo when he was still young. He's worked at a company called ICL-LDA for more than 9 years, and also has his own business, which helps the family supplement their income. He receives a salary of 5500 meticals a month and earns around 4000 meticals through his business. He uses the income to cover household expenses and is able to set aside a portion of his earnings in a savings account each month.
He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from neighbors who are also clients of the institution. This is his first loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (stone, sand, cement, rebar, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.
He is confident that he will be able to pay off the loan without difficulty and request new loans to start a business with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (stone, sand, cement, rebar, etc.).

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 25 years old, single, with no children. She has been running a salon for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 8000.


She is applying for her first loan with KADET, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to expand her business and add a stock of wigs, gel and braids. With the anticipated profit from the business she will pay for her education and study further.  Her hope is to expand her business, which will support her education fees.

loans.use: To buy wigs, gel, and  braids for her salon

loans.name: Souen

texts.en:
Souen is a basket seller who earns $3.50 a day. She lives with her two children, one of whom is a farmer and earns $1.50 per day. Every month, Souen spends $50 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses.

Souen is requesting a loan of $500 to buy medical treatment for herself. This loan will help her to get well and be able to continue her career.

In the future Souen hopes to buy more baskets to sell so that she can earn more for her family.

loans.use: to buy medical treatment for herself.

loans.name: Aljadis Esther

texts.es: Aljadis vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 7 a 13 años, ella inició su negocio cuando procedente de su pueblo llegó a Cartagena en búsqueda  de trabajo y como no consiguió, se dedicó al comercio. Inicialmente con calzado entre sus más cercanos vecinos y amigos, hasta que gradualmente creció y diversificó sus productos agregando ropa, cosméticos y perfumes. Su meta es ensancharlo y aumentar su clientela, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para atender la demanda creciente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa, perfumes, calzado y cosméticos en general. Su desafío es tener un almacén con todo lo que sus clientes necesitan y ella con sus esfuerzos se direcciona para lograr superarlo, pues espera lograr construir una educación de calidad para sus hijos con el fin de que puedan ser exitosos.
texts.en:
Aljadis lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and three children whose ages range from 7 to 13.  She started her business when she arrived in Cartagena from her town seeking work.  Since she didn’t find work, she decided to go into commerce.  She started out selling footwear among her neighbors and friends until she gradually grew and diversified her merchandise adding clothes, cosmetics and perfumes.  Her goal is to expand and increase her clientele but her working capital is insufficient to meet growing demand.

This is the reason behind her request for a Kiva loan that she’ll use to buy clothes, perfumes, footwear and cosmetics in general.  Her challenge is to have a store stocked with everything her customers need.  She intends to overcome it through hard work because she hopes to build a quality education for her children so that they will be able to be successful.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, footwear and cosmetics in general.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy natural medicine and products

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 47 year old single woman who owns a grocery shop. She does not have a husband or a son to take care of her, and she did not want others to pity her, so she started this business 4 years ago as a good source of living.

Fatima has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles. Her previous loan was very impressive. It reflected positively on her business development and on the product diversity in her store. She is requesting a new loan to fulfill her customers' needs and meet their requests. She wants to keep her shop filled with every thing they need, all the time, to keep them loyal to her and to emphasize the continuity of shopping at her shop. Fatima will work hard on expanding her business, and hopes to start wholesale trade in the future.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise for the summer season and upon her customers request

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 62 años , vive con su madre en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se dedica a las tareas del campo de las cuales aprendió lo esencial, actualmente es jubilada y por su avanzada edad ya no es posible realizar mucho esfuerzo físico en el campo. Por tanto ha optado por dedicarse en la venta de comida al paso, especificamente en la preparacion de salchichas con papas fritas, en un stand móvil, que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Esta actividad lo realiza por las tardes hasta alta horas de la noche. Por otro lado, también se dedica al tejido a mano, producto final que son vendidos. Estas actividades que realiza la mantienen con mucha vitalidad y disfrute de su vida. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito no MFP, fue invitada a formar parte del grupo solidario a la que integra por medio de uno de sus vecinos y por la información que ha recibido ha decidió tener un préstamo de la que tiene definido el uso que le dará. Y en esta ocasión comprará  al por mayor cubiertos y platos descartables al por mayor, mondadientes, aceite y algunos ingredientes mas para su negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old, and lives with her mother in her own home.  Since childhood, she has worked in the fields, where she learned what was essential. Currently she is retired, as due to her advanced age it isn't possible for her to expend much physical effort in the fields.  For this reason, she has opted to work selling food as a street vendor, specifically preparing hot dogs with french fries from the mobile stand which is the principal tool required for her work. She does this activity in the evenings, until the late hours of the night.  On the other hand, she also works doing weaving by hand and selling her finished products.  These activities keep her going with great vitality and enjoyment of her life.

This is her first time requesting a loan from MFP.  She was invited by one of her neighbors to be part of the solidarity group she joined, and based on the information she received, she decided to take a loan that will be used for the purpose she describes.  On this occasion, she will purchase disposable cutlery and plates at wholesale, toothpicks, oil, and other additional ingredients for her food business.

loans.use: to buy disposable cutlery and plates, and ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en: Zeynab  is 59 years old and engaged in running a pharmacy. She has had her pharmacy store for the last seven years. She is married and has two children. Her store has good location- near the central city bazaar. Zeynab`s monthly income is 250 USD and she wishes to increase it. For this purpose she applied for 1500 AZN.  This will be her 6th loan and she has a good credit history and has respect in AqroInvest.

loans.use: purchase more medicine to increase income.

loans.name: Silvio Erasmo

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Silvio Erasmo es una persona trabajadora de bueno valores morales  se dedica a laborar como encuestador catastral, desde hace seis  años. Es casado tiene una persona a su cargo.

Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito  para comprar, cemento, bloque, hierro y pago de mano de obra para realizar un anexo de un cuarto  de su vivienda así brindarle una condición mejor a su familia, por medio de esta obra.
texts.en:
Silvio Erasmo is from the city of Managua, and he is a hardworking person with good moral values who has worked as a land surveyor for 6 years.  He is married and has one dependent.

Now he has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan.  This loan will be used to buy cement, cement blocks, and iron, and to pay for labor to add a room to his house.  Through this project he can provide better conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su mamá.

Él se dedica desde los 14 años de edad a trabajar con las estructuras metálicas, y este le genera buenos ingresos para su familia.

Él compra los diferentes materiales que necesita para realizar su actividad, en una ferretería de la ciudad, para llegar ahí debe recorrer 8 kilómetros, luego tiene que pasar por una colina para ir a preparar lo que sus clientes le solicitan y luego regresar con el producto ya hecho donde sus clientes, él no tiene medio de transporte por lo que debe pagar para que trasladen las estructuras metálicas.

Carlos solicita un préstamo para, complementar una construcción de un muro de retención de la propiedad de su mamá, ella ya inicio la construcción pero le falta material para concluirlo y Carlos desea ayudarle a ella. De esta manera evitara la erosión de tierra en su propiedad hacia el camino vecinal, al mismo tiempo mejorara su vivienda y el lugar donde realiza su trabajo, esto le ayudara para satisfacer la demanda de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 20 years old, single, and he lives with his mother.

Since the age of 14 he has been working as a blacksmith and this generates a good income for his family.

He busy different materials that he needs for his work from a hardware store in the city. To get there he must travel 8 kilometers and he also has to pass over a hill to start making the items that his clients. He later delivers the product already made to his clients. He doesn't have a mode of transportation which is why he needs to hire someone to transport these metallic structures.

Carlos requests a loan to complete the construction of a retaining wall for his mother's property. She already started the construction but she still needs materials to finish it, and Carlos wants to help her. This way they will stop the erosion of the grounds of the property facing the neighbors. At the same time he wants to improve his house and the place where he works. This will help him satisfy the demand for his work.

loans.use: to finish building a retaining wall for his home.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a single woman. She has a child who is 13 months old. She describes herself as polite, aggressive, and ambitious. She operates a clothing sales business where she sells sweaters. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy open-air market and her primary customers are retailers who buy to sell to end users. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add to her stock of sweaters to boost business. Her business goal is to start importing sweaters in bulk from abroad within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a plot for herself.

loans.use: To buy more sweaters to sell

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a married man, 33 years old, with a 6-year-old child. His wife is a businesswoman. Boniface runs a general store, in which he sells detergents, beverages, food items and cereals. The business is located in a shopping center. He has had the business for a year now and its helping him to raise his young family. 

Due to the economy now, the challenge Boniface faces is the drastic increase in prices of cereals. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to increase the inventory of cereals. His future dream is to acquire bigger business premises. He also hopes to give his children a good education to the university level. He describes himself as honest and outgoing.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of cereals.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials to repair her fishing boat.
She has been in this business for four years now. In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 60,000 Kes loan to purchase more goats for resale. In the future, Mlongo aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mlongo has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain the motorcycles she uses in her business. 

Annaliza has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a sari-sari (convenience) store.

Annaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to maintain the motorcycles she uses in her business.

loans.name: Koemlun

texts.en:
Koemlun (pictured above) is single. She now runs an ice coffee shop with her sister and also sells fast food at the same time. In addition, Koemlun’s sister runs a business selling and repairing cell phones. 

Koemlun is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy additional cell phones for her sister to resell and she will also use a part of the loan to purchase materials needed in her business of selling fast food.

loans.use: to buy additional cell phones for her sister to resell and she will also use a part of the loan to purchase materials needed in her business of selling fast food.

loans.name: Monyonmu

texts.en: Monyonmu is 21 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with two children aged 3 and 9 years old; the oldest one attends school and both of them live at home. Monyonmu has been selling slippers for the past three years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she has learnt this business from him. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (slippers) for her business; in future she wants to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (slippers) for her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single man, working in manufacturing metals such as aluminum windows and closets.

Ali is a hard worker.  He seeks perfection and improvement in his business.

Ali is energetic and talented. He has eight years of experience in this business. At the beginning, he started working with his brother. The hardest part in his working history was when he decided to split the businesses and start his own career. This step forward made him work hard to gain customers' trust and gain new ones.

Ali is improving his business as much as he can. To do so, Ali applied for a "Youth Loan" from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary glass requested for a project he had to accomplish. This loan is very necessary to his business. It will help in increasing his income and at the same time it will reflect positively on his reputation in the market.

Ali hopes he can expand his business more in the future, through increasing his customers and employees.

loans.use: to buy necessary glass for his business.

loans.name: Hadam's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2012.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même village,elles ont comme activité principale l'agriculture.

Maodo qui se trouve à l'extrême gauche et levant la main,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 61 ans est mére de 04 enfants.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter des semences de riz et d'arachide.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2012.  All the members of the group come from the same village and they all work in agriculture.

Maodo (on the far left of the photo with her hand raised) is the group representative.  She is 61 years old, and mother to four children.  She has good experience in agriculture as she has worked in this business for several years.

Maodo will use her loan to buy seed for rice and peanuts.  Her aim is to increase the level of her savings and contribute to the expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy seed for peanuts and rice.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam is 41 years old. He is married, the father of three adult children, and an exemplary family man. His wife is a homemaker. Rustam provides for his family by himself. He has driven a taxi for nine years. He is happy with everything about the car, and has started to enjoy working in this area more. He has spent all of his savings on buying the vehicle, and now needs to have money for the vehicle upkeep and amortization. Rustam is certain that if he receives this loan and maintains the vehicle in the best condition, his car will serve him for a long time and result in a good income.

loans.use: to maintain and amortize his vehicle.

loans.name: Haramani

texts.en:
Haramani is 38 years old. She is a divorced woman who lives in a village of Koraput district in Odisha with her parents and two children. Haramani's children are studying in a government school near her village. 

For lack of other opportunities, Haramani herself, though educated till class 8, has been running a grocery shop from her home for the last eight years to add to the family income. If Haramani wants to expand her business and really benefit from increased inventory, she must buy the goods in wholesale quantities. As the market prices keep fluctuating, buying in bulk guards against price spikes, and hence ensures decent profits. She is, therefore, seeking a loan of 35,000 INR to purchase in bulk grocery items like edible oil, spices, condiments, sugar, and biscuits for her shop.

loans.use: to purchase edible oil, spices, biscuits, sugar and cereals in bulk to resell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is married with four children and two of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members . She makes snacks from home on retail basis ( crisps,muffins,sumbusas, and daddies ) and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more a bag of charcoal ,cooking oil,baking flour,spices,packing bags .  She sells to all categories of people but on retail basis seven days a week.  She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler .  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to  piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy cooking oil,baking flour,spices,packing bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Specie wants to buy varieties of African attire materials (vitenges

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka Adhiabo is married and has two children, one of whom is going to school. She has been in the business of running a grocery store for the last three years. She has been trained in loan management and use by Rafode.

Given the loan, she wants to stock her business so that customers can get any commodity they need from the store. This will enable her to increase her profit.
She intends to use the profit to buy a plot and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Bisansio Juma

texts.en: Bisansio is married and as yet has no children. He has not undertaken any formal training and he is an active member of the community’s drug awareness team. He started his business in 2003. This is his second loan with PEMCI. He has finished his first loan successfully, which has enabled him to expand his business and he has been able to open another shop and provide employment to his younger brother. With a second loan from PEMCI, Bisansio plans to strengthen his second shop and stock it fully so as to be able to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: Bisansio would like to boost his business

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en:
Marguerite J. is the owner of Fritura Margo, a grocery store service in La Union where she sells food products like chicken, plantains, butter, and sugar, as well as essentials like oil for cooking meals. Since she is without a physical storefront, Marguerite is often seen walking the streets of her community faithfully delivering her customer’s orders to their homes. She will use this first loan to expand the inventory of her store to better meet the needs of her customers. Originally from Haiti, 60-year-old Marguerite is a single mom who enjoys spending time with her oldest son, Leonel, when she is not tending to her business.

Note: Marguerite is one of five microentrepreneurs in her solidarity group - part of an Esperanza Bank of Hope, which they have named "La Union". All of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Marguerite would like to purchase chicken, plantains, cooking oil, butter and sugar.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence O. says that LAPO came to her rescue in 2000 when she was in need of money to boost her business. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is from Benin City and sells provisions and drinks to the public. If given an $800 loan, she promises to expand her business and buy more drinks and provisions.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks & provisions

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Mrs. Agnes O. is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Asaba, Delta State. She is married and has six children. She mills grains and sells provisions and drinks. She studied this business for two years before opening her store in 2003. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more provisions and drinks to sell. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Muazzamhon

texts.ru:
Muazzamhon, 41, widowed mother of 3 children. She sells clothing for children on the central market. Recently, Muazzamhon was struck by the tragic loss of her husband. Now, Muazzamhon is solely responsible for the welfare of her family. She has been a MicroInvest client for half a year. Muazzamhon wants to use this loan to expand assortment of winter clothing.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Muazzamhon 41 год, замужем имеет 3 детей. Занимается продажей детской одежды на центральном рынке. Недавно у нее случилось несчастье в семье – умер муж. Теперь вся ответственность по содержанию семьи лежит на ней. С Микроинвест сотрудничает полгода. Хочет получить новый займ для расширения зимних видов детской одежды

loans.use: To expand assortment of winter clothing

loans.name: Florencia's Group

texts.es:
Florencia, Celedonia and Martha have belonged to Los Laureles Comunal Bank for 1 year. In their Communal bank they learned to be punctual, responsible, to love their fellows, and to save. Florencia is married, 39, and has 3 children and sells vegetables in the markets of the ayacuchan jungle and at the markets, she brings fruits to sell in the Nery Garcia market. On the other hand, Celedonia lives with her significant other, she is 48 and has 6 children and has a restaurant. Previously she was selling shoes at wholesale in the Santa Clara market, and her sales she made through credit and one of her clients left without paying; with the capital that she lost she had to start over with the business of selling food. While Martha sells “salchipollos” (fries and chicken nuggets) in the doorway of her mother-in-law’s house, an activity that she has been doing for 2 years. Furthermore Martha weaves cards that she sells to friends and relatives. Florencia, Celedonia and Martha need loans of 1000 soles, 1000 soles and 400 soles that they will invest in the purchase of chickens, rice, sugar, potatoes, celery, leeks, carrots, barley, cereals, oil, noodles, milk, sodas, beers, disposable plates and napkins. The dreams of Florencia, Celedonia and Martha are to buy land, construct a house, purchase a car to be able to transport their goods and that their children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Florencia, Celedonia y Martha pertenecen al Banco Comunal Los Laureles desde hace 1 año. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables, a querer a sus semejantes y a ahorrar. Florencia es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos y vende verduras en las ferias de la selva ayacuchana y de las ferias trae frutas que vende en el mercado Nery García. Por otro lado Celedonia es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos y tiene su restaurante. Anteriormente vendía zapatillas al por mayor en el mercado Santa Clara, y sus ventas las hacia al crédito y unos de sus clientes se fue sin pagarle, con lo cual perdió su capital y tuvo que iniciar de nuevo con el negocio de venta de comida. Mientras que Martha vende salchipollos en la puerta de la casa de su suegro, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años. Además Martha teje carteras que vende a amigos y familiares. Florencia, Celedonia y Martha necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 1000 soles y 400 soles que serán invertidos en la compra de pollo, arroz, azúcar, papa, apio, poro, zanahoria, arveja, cereales, aceite, fideo, leche, gaseosas, cerveza, platos descartables, servilletas. Los sueños de Florencia, Celedonia y Martha son comprar un terreno, construir su casa, comprar un carro para poder transportar su mercadería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Florencia, Celedonia and Martha need loans of 1000 soles, 1000 soles and 400 soles that they will invest in the purchase of chickens, rice, sugar, potatoes, celery, leeks, carrots, barley, cereals, oil, noodles, milk, sodas, beers, disposable plates and napkins.

loans.name: Upper Kawuga C(2063) B Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Juliet B..  She is currently in the business of livestock farming and is requesting a loan to invest in a piggery business.  Juliet is 25 years old and is married with one child, aged 1.  Each week, Juliet makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to invest in a poultry business.  Juliet is joined in her small group by Betty N., Flora N., Mary N., and Rose N..  Betty N. is currently in the business of brick-laying and is requesting a loan to expand her brick business.  Flora N. is currently in the business of second-hand clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for sale.  Mary N. is currently in the retail shop business  and is requesting a loan to increase stock.  Rose N. is currently has a grocery store and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items.

loans.use: To expand livestock business

loans.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en:
My name is Balqees BibiI, the group leader. I am a widow from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I have five children. After my husband’s death, my sons undertook the responsibility to earn money for the family. They manufacture iron gates and therefore need a loan to buy iron in bulk.

The other women in my group would like a loan for the following uses; Shokat B. will buy wood , Zohra B. also needs to buy iron in bulk, Nusrat is borrowing money so her husband can buy a rickshaw and Kishwer B. would like to purchase a sewing machine.

I have known these women for many years and completely trust them. A small loan can bring big changes to our lives.

loans.use: Buy iron in bulk

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, 38 years old, is very active and enterprising.  She is married to Nicolás Mora and together they have five school-aged children. 

Norma recalls that, due to scarcity of work, she decided to help her husband with the family’s finances.  For the past three years she has dedicated herself to the sale of clothing, notions, and cosmetics throughout her neighborhood as working nearby makes it easier to continue to care for her children. 

The credits obtained through the foundation helped her purchase more merchandise and augment her sales which, in turn, created better revenue.  Her friends admire her greatly given she is a dedicated mother and wife, in addition to being good at sales. 

Today she seeks a new loan to be able to buy a lot of merchandise that her suppliers offered her at a good price and she wishes to take advantage of this opportunity; in this way, she can offer her wares at competitive prices without affecting her returns. 

 Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer. 

Norma tiene 38 años, es una persona muy activa y emprendedora, ella está casada con Nicolás Mora. El matrimonio  tiene 5 hijos, todos menores de edad, dos de ellos van recién a la escuela. 

Norma cuenta que debido a la escasez de trabajo, ella decidió ayudar  a su esposo con la economía familiar y desde hace  3 años se dedica a la venta de ropas, mercerías y cosméticos en forma independiente recorriendo el barrio de su casa, ya que tampoco desea abandonar a sus hijos y trabajando cerca de la casa le resulta más fácil.

Los créditos obtenidos con la fundación  le ayudaron a comprar más mercaderías y aumentar el volumen de ventas y con ello mejorar sus ingresos. Sus amigas la admiran bastante ya que Norma es una madre y esposa muy dedicada, además de ser muy buena vendedora.

Hoy ella solicita un nuevo crédito para poder adquirir un lote de mercaderías que sus proveedores le ofertaron a buen precio y desea aprovecharlo; de este modo ella podrá ofrecer buenos precios sin afectar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Notions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Safia's Wema Group

texts.en:
Safia is married with four children (ages 7, 11, 15, and 17). She runs a tailoring business where she sews dresses. From this business, which started 13 years ago, she makes a monthly profit of about $55.

Safia hopes for a loan to purchase more material for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members belong to loan group Wema. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married with a 12-year-old son. He started his business selling footwear 18 years ago. Financial assistance from Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine has helped Ivan grow and expand his business. Today he has two vending kiosks and his wife helps him run the business.

Ivan is planning to use this loan of 2500 Grivnas to purchase 100 pairs of shoes to sell in his kiosk. He believes an assortment of merchandise will boost his sales and help him generate additional profit. Ivan’s goal is to continue refining his business skills so that he can keep his venture growing and provide for the needs of his family.

(Note: this is a short-term “express” loan that will be repaid in two months.)

loans.use: Purchase 100 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng S., a 50-year-old widow, and her daughter, Miss Maly Roeun, 23, live with Loeng’s elderly parents in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh.  Assisted by Maly,

Mrs. Loeng has been selling fruit and sugar cane juice for eight years. She buys a wide variety of produce such as apples, bananas, longan fruit, and oranges from the market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in the village market. Now Loeng is requesting a loan of $650 to expand her business and buy one sugar cane juice machine.

loans.use: To expand her business and buy one sugar cane juice machine.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo has always had some sort of business as a source of family income. He started approximately 8 years ago, working from a room in his house. He decided to start selling snacks to the local kids, which allowed him to earn profits. With the help of microloans, his business steadily grew until finally becoming a general store.

He needs a loan of $225.00 USD, which he will repay in 1 month, in order to purchase goods and boost his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorenzo desde siempre ha tenido una actividad comercial para contar con un ingreso para el gasto de la familia. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 8 años en una habitación de su casa, decidió empezar vendiendo frituras a los niños, lo que le permitió capitalizarse y con el apoyo de los microcréditos ha ido creciendo hasta establecer una tienda de abarrotes.

El necesita un préstamo por US $225 que pagara en 1 mese para comprar mercancía e incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria I. is a fashion designer who sews in her house. She makes lovely Nigerian designs. She has been sewing for a long time now, and her customers are happy with her designs. Victoria is 39 years old and married with two children. She lives in Mebamu, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $600 to buy more tailoring materials. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Lesbia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia S. se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente cocinera ya que desde hace varios años se dedica a su negocio de elaboración y venta de comida y bebidas teniendo su propio establecimiento en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua.

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la elaboración de los alimentos. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será aprobado y así continuar en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Lesbia Sanchez is known to be an excellent cook and for many years has been making and selling food and drinks from her own establishment in the county of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua.

Now her motive for coming to Ceprodel is to get credit to make the food she sells. She confidently awaits her credit being approved so that she can continue with this economic activity.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials/Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has been selling food items in Zanzibar for four years. She works from 7:00am to 6:00pm daily and earns a monthly profit of approximately $110. Her business has grown nicely to this point, but she is taking out her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to increase the rate of growth and her profit by infusing her shop with more goods to sell.

Amina is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children, aged 7, 18, and 20.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo B. is a 30 year old married father.  He lives in the village of Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital.  To provide for his family, Koffi operates a taxi-moto business.  With his motorcycle, Koffi picks up passengers along the road and drops them off at their destination.  This service is always in demand in Wome, as there is no electricity in this village and people must often travel further than walking distance to take care of business.  Koffi hopes to buy a new moto.  With the profits he will earn from his business, Koffi can continue to send his children to school and provide for his wife and family.
texts.en:
Kodzo B. is a 30 year old married father. He lives in the village of Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. To provide for his family, Koffi operates a taxi-moto business. With his motorcycle, Koffi picks up passengers along the road and drops them off at their destination. This service is always in demand in Wome, as there is no electricity in this village and people must often travel further than walking distance to take care of business. Koffi hopes to buy a new moto. With the profits he will earn from his business, Koffi can continue to send his children to school and provide for his wife and family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a new moto

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. is a fifty-year-old widowed mother of one child. She produces palm oil and treks to towns to market it. She also owns a palm plantation farm from which she gets most of her palm nuts to prepare the oil. She has been in business for four years. 

According to B., the palm nuts she harvests from her farm alone are not enough to prepare the quantity of oil needed to meet the demand of her customers. This also limits the number of markets she can trek to in order to do business. 

She wants a loan to invest into her business by buying more palm nuts so that she can increase her production. B. is in the “Tumi Wura” Trust Bank in her community. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To expand buy palm oil production business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Mary is 30 years old and her husband is a finance officer. She has five children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation. BRAC encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie B. lives in Barangay Lapogan, Tumuini, Isabela.  The village is located between the boundary of Ilagan and Tumauini, Isabela.  She is already 42 years old and married to Apolinario, a baker.  They are living with their only son Jay–Pee who is now 20 years old and a graduate of automotive course.  Their eldest daughter died of leukemia. The village where they live is an Agrarian Reform Community where main sources of income come from rice and corn farming. 

She is hoping that she will be able to avail a loan amounting to PhP4,000 for her direct selling business. Elvie is a selling agent for Avon and Natasha cosmetic products outlet in the town center, where she purchases the orders of her costumers from their village. She is earns income on commission basis at 25% for every PHP100 sales. She hopes to increase her business capital and income especially that she expect peak sales this coming month because it is harvest season for corn in their village.  She and her husband do not have other sources of income but she is still thankful that through their income they were able to send their son to school and finish a vocational course.  

Elvie intends to do her best to prosper her business and save some of her income for emergencies.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her direct selling business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence B. is fifty-four years old. She is a divorced mother of two children, both of whom are boys. She says that one of her sons has just completed senior high. The other one has travelled abroad for greener pastures. Florence says that she lives with a sister while her son is also currently living with an uncle in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Florence deals in printed textile fabrics. She says she procures a variety of fancy prints from a textile depot in Accra and sells in Berekum. Florence does not sell in a store house but treks to sell her products and hawks as well. She has been in business for eight years. Florence wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more fabrics. She hopes to put up her own apartment.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles in bulk

loans.name: Milad

texts.en:
Milad is a 53 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. For 15 years, Milad has owned a pastry shop where he sells Lebanese sweets.

Previously, Milad received a loan that helped him improve his shop. Milad is famous because he is known for his good sweets. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When Milad first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulty. He opened it because he enjoyed making and selling pastries and wanted to have an independent work life.. In the future, he plans to expand and improve his work. 

He is requesting a loan of 2500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase raw materiA. and change the décor of his shop. He successfully paid his previous loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase raw material and change the décor of shop

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.
Andrea es soltera, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, estudiante de industrias alimentarías, Andrea se dedica a la preparación de chocolates de manera artesanal, sus ventas son a pedido que le realizan sus amigos, familiares, clientes que ya tiene.
Andrea necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que era invertido en la compra de chocolate cobertura y moldes.
Andrea sueña con terminar sus estudios, construir su casa y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Banco Comunal Confianza (Confidence Communal Bank). She is single, 24 years old, has one son, and is a student of the food industry. She prepares handmade chocolates and her friends, family, and existing customers make up her sales. Andrea needs a $200 loan to purchase melting chocolate and molds. She dreams of both her and her son completing their studies and building a house.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase melting chocolate and molds.

loans.name: Emmanuel Jr.

texts.en: Emmanuel A., Jr. is forty-one years old and married with two school age children. He lives in Dipolog City. He is asking for a loan of $225 from the Kiva field partner, Paglaum MPC. He needs to have additional capital to finance his retail meat business.  Emmanuel is an active member of the Paglaum MPC and has taken advantage of five loan cycles in the past. Out of his sacrifices, he hopes that he can offer a better future for his family and support the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy livestock to butcher and sell

loans.name: Lizeth Margarita

texts.es: La señora Lizeth Margarita Z., tiene 32 años de edad, reside en el  Barrio Los Solises en la ciudad de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 8 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos el cual lleva doce años en las ventas, inicio con ahorro en busca de nuevas alternativas, con este crédito quiere invertir en compra de ropa y variedad de cosméticos para ofrecer a sus clientes y vender mas, para obtener buenas ganancias, este es su quinto ciclo y da las gracias Afodenic por los logros alcanzados. Sus planes a futuro es poder tener una tienda, dar estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lizeth Margarita Z. is 32 years old and lives in the Los Solises neighborhood of Managua with her two children, ages 7 and 8. She has been in the business of selling clothing and cosmetics for 12 years and began saving and looking for new alternatives. With this loan she wants to invest in purchasing more clothes and cosmetics to offer her customers as well as obtain good sales. This is her fifth cycle and she thanks Afodenic for the achievements. Her plans for the future are to be able to have a store and to give her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Con Esfuerzo Triunfaremos - Group 1

texts.en:
Cristobalina C. is a 39-year-old woman. She is married to Alejandro Lopez and they have two children ages 19 and 13. She sells clothing on the street of San Pedro de Macoris. People recognize Cristobalina as a good seller who always knows what her customers want and what is currently in demand.

Because the summer is approaching and temperatures are rising, Cristobalina will use this loan to purchase light, fresh children's and women's clothing to sell. She often purchases in San Pedro, but sometimes she goes to Santo Domingo, the capital city, to purchase clothing in the commercial district.

Cristobalina is working hard to generate profits that will help her cover the expenses to finish her house. She started building a couple years ago, but has to build "one wall at a time," because construction materials are rather expensive. She hopes not only to finish her house with her business profits, but to also support her children's chidren's education and see them "achieve realization in their lives."

Please help us to continue supporting Cristobalina and the rest of this Bank of Hope. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase new women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Terrano Group

texts.en:
Fatuma I., age 41, is married with three children ages 22, 19, and 17. She has been selling food and water for 7 years. She works daily from 5am until 10pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $138.

This will be Fatum’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use this loan to increase business capital and pay school fees.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, Terrano which totals 22 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Fatuma is 1st on the left standing second row.

loans.use: To expand store inventory and pay school fees

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: La Señora María Elizabeth López López tiene la edad de 21 años. Actualmente es casada. Solamente tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica de María es la venta de mercadería en general. María comenzó este negocio en compañía de su Mama,  hace 35 años ya que desde muy joven  aprendió este negocio y decide seguir adelante con la actividad. Por lo que ahora solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de perfumes, pantalones,cremas, faldas y camisolas. Por lo que necesita diversificar para que sus clientes tengan mayores oportunidades de comprarles sus productos. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio de tal forma que le permita mejorar la situación económica de su familia y brindarle a sus hijos la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Ms. María Elizabeth López López is 21 years old. She is currently married and has only one child in her care.

Maria's business is selling general merchandise. She started this business in the company of her her mother who has 35 years of experience in the field, starting from a very young age, and who decided to continue with the profession. She is looking for a loan to buy perfume, pants, creams, skirts, and camisoles, in order to diversify her merchandise and give her clients more opportunities to buy from her.

Her goal is to increase her business to better the economic situation of her family and provide her children the best education possible.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine-V Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying new merchandise

loans.name: Marguerite Ndew

texts.fr: Marguerite Ndew T., 40 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants en charge. Son activité est le commerce de produits halieutiques (poissons fumés, poissons séchés, escargot de mer et  coquillage). Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son activité. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Marguerite Ndew T., age 40, is married and has four children to support. Her business involves commerce in seafood products (smoked fish, dried fish, whelk, and seashells). She wants a loan to bolster her business. Her revenues allow her to help with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell seafood products

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a member of the Mtivila A borrower group,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.her child is aged 9 years.

 Robina started her own charcoal business 1 year ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 160,000 Tsh.

This is Robina`s first loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal.

With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan Robina hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina C. is from the village of Macabayao,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Crispina is widowed and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Crispina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling various food products in the local community. Crispina has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Crispina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crispina is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Crispina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Okeremute

texts.en:
Okeremute is 29 years old and married with three children. To make a living, she sells VCDs (video CDs).

Through the Lift Above Poverty Organization she hopes to obtain a loan of 140,000 NGN to purchase more VCDs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Rio Blanco Group

texts.es:
Jessica Raquel R. L., María De La Concepción 	P. y María De Los Ángeles A. son las constituyen al grupo Rio Blanco. La coordinadora del Grupo es Jessica Raquel R. L., ella vende cosméticos de la marca Avon y productos de limpieza entre sus vecinos y conocido.

Mientras María De Los Ángeles A.  vende todo tipo de comidas derivadas del cerdo como nacatamales, frito, chicharrón, moronga y María De La Concepción P. vende ropa usada y nueva.

loans.use: comprar lapiz labial, rimel, delineador, cremas y base entre otros.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 36 years old and married with three children. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria.

Mabel has a store where she sells groceries. She hopes for the loan of N60,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

Mabel hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma, de 34 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en una habitación alquilada y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para salir adelante. 

El puesto de coches para niños de Irma está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable y tiene muchos clientes, quienes la buscan por los modelos novedosos que tienen sus coches.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva realizando esta actividad 8 años y considera que lo más difícil es traer los juguetes desde la ciudad de Tacna (al sur del Perú), ya que el viaje es muy largo y cansado, causando que pierda mucho tiempo en conseguir su mercadería. 
Para el futuro, espera instalar una tienda más grande donde pueda vender muchos más coches con más tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Irma con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable, siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más coches para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.	¿Qué es lo que comprará con este dinero?
texts.en:
Irma, 34 years-old, is a hard-working and happy woman who lives in a rented room and is ready to work hard to get ahead. Irma has a stand located in San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca) where she sells toy cars for children. She is very happy with her business as it is very profitable and she has a lot of customers who are attracted by the original designs of her cars. What she likes the most about her job is conversing with her neighbor vendors at the market. She has been in this business for 8 years and for her the hardest part is bringing the toys from the city of Tacna (southern Peru), as the journey is long and tiring, and causes a lot of lost time in obtaining the merchandise. In the future, Irma hopes to establish a larger store where she can sell many more cars more comfortably. This is Irma's first loan with MFP, but she knows she must pay on time and be ready to pay it back. In her communal bank she is very responsible and makes sure the other members adhere to their commitments. With the 1000 soles from this loan Irma will buy more toy cars to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of merchandise

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en: Laxmi F. is from the village of Olingan. She is 59 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Laxmi owns and operates a business providing transportation services such as motor cab to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In the photo, Laxmi is shown with her husband who operates the motor cab. In 2006, Laxmi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital for her existing sari-sari (variety) store. Laxmi is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.

Margarita, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio D. ventas D. bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 06 paquetes D. gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes D. gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Margarita, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas D. pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “El Tiempo es Oro” (Time is Gold), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three dependent children.

Margarita is a hardworking and determined woman who decided to start her own business selling soft drinks out of her home, which is a well-suited location. She manages her business without a set schedule and does not have to report to a boss. Margarita says that she started her business with 300 soles and bought six packs of sodas. Her products sold very well so she gradually invested in more merchandise. Today she continues to manage this same business and is known among her customers, who are her neighbors, relatives, and friends.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase packs of sodas in different flavors, sizes, and brands. Margarita will also use part of the money to buy both carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. She has several goals ahead of her and feels motivated to fulfill all of her dreams. Margarita is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing assistance in her time of need. She has been responsible in making her payments and plans to continue in the same manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & mineral water

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 9 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Pun. Ella tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de pan y jugo.
Celia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò ingredientes para hacer el jugo.
Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar azúcar, pan, y frutas.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Celia has been a member of the communal bank, "Great Power" for 9 years, in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 28 years old, is married, and has 4 kids. She finished seconday school and is dedicated to the buying and selling of bread and juice. Celia told us that with her first loan from the Movement Manuela Ramos, in the amount of 300.00 soles, she bought ingredients to make the juice. She is soliciting 1,500.00 soles with which she will be able to buy sugar, bread, and fruit. Her dream for the future is to have her own house in Ilave and for her children to be professionals. The thing she likes the most about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, bread, and fruit

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia de 24 años vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su hijo Joe de 1 año y lo que más desea es darle una buena calidad de vida.El persistente trabajo de Delia poco a poco va dando resultados, el restaurante que con tanto esfuerzo aperturó cada día tiene mayor cantidad de  clientes. Y es que su negocio, es uno de los lugares más concurridos, debido a la gran atención que brinda, pero sobre todo a la deliciosa sazón que tienen sus comidas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, ya que es la administradora del restaurante, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es satisfacer a sus clientes y brindarles un buen servicio, ya que las personas son muy exigentes, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Con el tiempo, espera que su restaurante crezca y se convierta en uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad.Es el primer préstamo de Delia con  MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas sillas y mesas para mejorar el ambiente de su restaurante, y así atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Delia is 24. She lives in a rented room with her one year old son, Joe. What she wants most is to give him a good quality of life. Delia’s persistent work is, little by little, giving results. Her restaurant, which she opened with such effort, is getting more customers everyday. Her restaurant is one of the most popular places because of the good service she offers, and, above all, the delicious seasoning she gives her food. What she likes most about her work is running the restaurant. She has been in this business for three years. The most difficult part is satisfying her customers and giving them good service. Some people are very demanding. Even so, she knows that this is her work, and she has to do it. In time, she hopes her restaurants grows and becomes one of the most well known in the city. This is Delia’s first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay it on time because she does not want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy new tables and chairs to improve the atmosphere in her restaurant. That way she will attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equip her restaurant with new furniture

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom C. is 42 years old. She is the village bank president of a group that consists of 18 people located in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal Province. The members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Sarom C. and her husband, Mr. Orn Oeng, are farmers who own a one-hectare field where they cultivate rice to support their famiL. members. But now they face some problems because the soil is infertile. Thus, Mrs. Sarom C. is applying for a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will buy rice seeds. Mrs. Sarom C. is a mother of four children. Two of her children are students in the local school and the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. sells smoked fish at Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She has received junior high education.

Mary has been selling smoked fish for some time now and supports her husband in the payment of school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke and clothes to sell.

Mary hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and clothes to sell

loans.name: Djuraboy

texts.en:
N. Djuraboy was born in 1959 and is married with two children. As an aspiring and hard-working man, he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he joined IMON International, he was able to make much progress with his previous loans, which he invested mostly in crop farming. For 20 years, Djuraboy has been growing potatoes, wheat and vegetables on his land. His sons help him with the business. Djuraboy wants his children to get a good education, allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future - this is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile. Thanks to his efforts and diligence, now his elder son is studying at the University. Currently Djuraboy requests 7,000 Somoni in order to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sonia Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Trabaja en Mantenimiento de la casa comercial Mc. GREGOR S.A, un día de trabajo para ella es dar mantenimiento a la oficina además de movilizarse en los diferentes Bco. de la ciudad  de león para realizar gestiones del comercial.

El crédito que ha solicitado es para gastos de estudio universitario de su hija ya que está realizando módulos de Admón. de Empresa  la cual es de gran importancia para la formación profesional de su hija.

 Cabe mencionar que este es el cuarto crédito con nuestra institución, los anteriores han sido destinados para mejoras de vivienda ya que fue de gran ayuda para tener mejores condiciones en su hogar para su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia works as a business manager for McGregor S.A. Her work day involves maintaining the office as well as traveling to different parts of the city of León to conduct business.

The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for the university expenses of her daughter, who is taking classes in Business Administration. It is of great importance for her daughter to receive professional training.

It should be mentioned that this is Sonia’s fourth loan with our Institution. Her previous loans were used for home improvements and they have already been a great help in providing better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's university expenses

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
