Robinah is 37 years old, is single, and has three children. She is the breadwinner for her family which lives in a rented house. She dreams of owning a residential home, educating her children and setting up a wholesale shop.

Robinah has a retail shop business in Masindi town in Uganda which has been operational for three years.  She came to know about the HOFOKAM credit facility through a friend who encouraged her to grow her business with the easy, accessible and cheap credit funds.

The purpose of the loan is to buy sugar, soap and salt for her shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and salt for her shop

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong T. V., 36 years old, lives in An Ninh village, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh, where she is a married mother of three children and operates a store with her husband selling building materials out of her home. They have a monthly income of about 5.000.000 VND.  A member of  SEDA for two years, Phuong would like to borrow 8.288.000 VND (450 USD) to invest in her store. Hopefully, that plan will result in additional profit so her family can afford to buy more household appliances.

loans.use: To invest in her store

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng P. is 61 years old and is the village bank president selected by the fifteen members located in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. The members of this group loan will use the money to buy supplies, equipments and other items to support their different businesses. 

Mrs. Seng P. is a vegetable seller and her husband, Mr. Dil Pol, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which Seng grows her vegetables. Aside from selling this produce, Mrs. Seng P. is also a dessert seller. With these businesses they are able to earn a small income to support their family's living expenses. 

Mrs. Seng P. has now requested a loan to buy more vegetables to enlarge her business activities. She also wants to use part of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her husband's farming. This couple has four children, two of whom are vegetable sellers who support their mother's business. One other is a student in the local school while the last one is staying at home.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Roberto Freddy

texts.es:
Roberto 31 años de edad, es conviviente vive en casa de sus padres con su pareja y sus 
2 menores hijos. Roberto se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en su vehiculo 
propio una mototaxi la cual adquirió hace 2 años. El ya posee experiencia en el 
negocio y les brinda a los clientes buen trato y seguridad. Roberto tiene el anhelo de 
poder construir su propia vivienda por eso es que además labora como repartidor para 
una conocida polleria de la ciudad. Roberto requiere el crédito para darle 
mantenimiento a su mototaxi y así no le genere tantos gastos.
texts.en:
Roberto, age 31, is in a common law marriage. He lives in his parents’ house with his life partner and their two minor children. Roberto provides transportation services. He uses his own vehicle, a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle), which he got two years ago. He has experience in this business, and he gives his clients good service and safety. Roberto’s goal is to be able to build his own house. That is why he also works as a delivery man for a well known poultry store in the city. Roberto needs the loan to perform maintenance on his mototaxi. That way it will not generate so many expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on his mototaxi

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal out of her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Paulina is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 57-year-old borrower from Lebanon. He is married and has four children. He has more than 30 years of experience as a car mechanic. He says that his services are very good, as well as his work. He is proud of his extensive experience and honest work. He has been able to serve a wide range of clients, mainly people from his region. He decided on doing his work because he wanted to have an independent job since he prefers working on his own and wanted no need to depend on anyone. 

Today, for the fourth time, he has requested a loan from A. Majmoua, a Kiva partner, to purchase tools for his work, as well as pay his children's school tuition fees. His previous loans allowed him to improve his work and purchase more sophisticated tools. He hopes to further expand and enhance his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Léonie

texts.fr: L. Léonie est née en 1965 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Léonie vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Zévou Aga à Porto-Novo. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge, Léonie vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Léonie n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Léonie vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, oignons, piments, etc.) à son domicile. Léonie s'approvisionne à Ikpinlè au Bénin et aussi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Léonie exerce cette activité depuis dix huit ans et a déjà obtenu deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Léonie désire renforcer son activité et augmenter ses stocks de produits, afin de répondre au mieux aux divers exigences de sa clientèle et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. Pour y parvenir, Léonie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Leonie L. was born in 1965 in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. She has lived in the Zévou Aga neighborhood of Porto-Novo for about twenty years. She is married with four children, all of whom have attended school and three are still in her care. Leonie lives alone with her children and provides for their needs on her own. Leonie only attended primary school. To cope with her various responsibilities, Leonie sells sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.) from her home. She gets her stocks at the Ikpinlè market in Benin and also in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. Leonie has been in business for eighteen years and has previously obtained two loans, both fully repaid. She wants to strengthen her business and increase her stocks to better meet her customers’ diverse requirements and bolster her sales. To that end, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase baskets of fresh tomatoes, peppers and onions

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: Nergui B. is 56 years old and lives with his wife in Tuv province, central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Currently, Nergui operates a transportation business in his town. The couple has been permanently living in this place for 50 years. He transports his customers to and from many different areas. Nergui has been operating his business since 2005 with his own car.  His earnings have enabled him to afford their daily consumption.  For the future, Nergui plans to expand the house where they live.  He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts for his car and renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car and renovate his house

loans.name: Sope Elhadj Malick Sy Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE ELHADJ MALICK SY est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 21 femmes. Elles sont toutes issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de BOFFEL

Madame DIOGO D. debout à l’extrême droit sur photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 60 ans. Elle est mère de 2 garçons et 2 filles. Elle a également la charge de ses 2 petits fils. 

Son activité antérieure est le petit commerce. Avec son nouveau crédit elle va faire de l’embouche ovine

Avec son prêt elle va acheter 2 moutons et de l’aliment de bétail pour les emboucher pendant 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. 

Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille. Par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The Sope Elhadj Malick Sy solidarity group was created on 30th December 2009. It is made up of 21 women who all come from the same village and are either neighbors or friends. The solidarity group is part of the Banc Villageois in Boffel. Mrs. Diogo D., who is standing on the extreme right of the photo is in charge of the solidarity group. She is 60 years old and mother to two boys and two girls. She is also responsible for her two grandsons. Her previous activity was the running of a small business. With her new loan she is going to fatten up sheep. She will buy two sheep and food for the livestock, in order to fatten them during five months and then sell them at the weekly markets in her town. She helps her husband to take care of the family, for example covering food and health costs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two sheep

loans.name: Mañanitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Las Mañanitas lo conforman Walkiria F., Gloria de los Ángeles González O. y Darling de los Ángeles López C., tres mujeres de distintas edades pero que encaran a la vida en la lucha diaria por superarse.

Walkiria, quien es su coordinadora, se dedica a la venta de artículos varios como juguetes y adornos, ella vende tanto de crédito como de contado y utilizará el crédito para la compra de aquellos productos de mayor demanda y la introducción de nuevos artículos. Las otras socias, Gloria vende ropa y chinelas desde hace 3 años y Darling produce zapatos y los vende ambulante.
texts.en:
The group called Las Mananitas is made up of Walkiria F., Gloria O. and Darling Carranze, three women of different ages who all confront life with the daily struggle to improve their economic situation. Walkiria, who coordinates the group, works selling various novelties such as games and accessories. She uses the loans to purchase the products in greatest demand, as well as to introduce new items to sell. The other members of the group also have small businesses. Gloria has been selling clothing for three years, and Darling makes shoes and sells them around the community. They will each use their portion of the loan to invest in their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for their respective businesses.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 45 años, reside en San Miguel, tiene una relación libre, vive con su compañero de vida y dos hijos de las edades de 14,12 años, se posee un taller de reparación y venta de ruedas nuevas, usadas.
el negocio lo inicio por la necesidad económica y decidió poner un taller el cual tiene 8 años de existir, su esposo le apoya con el trabajo y tiene un empleado. Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ruedas nuevas y usadas de vehículos, esto le permitirá contar con producto que le demandan los clientes, contribuir a mejorar las condiciones económicas, generar más ingresos a base del trabajo.
Las aspiraciones son comprar una vivienda propia, apoyar a los hijos con los estudios que estos terminen una carrera universitaria que tengan una propia oficina.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, lives in San Miguel. She’s in a free union with her life partner and they have two children who are 14 and 12 years of age. She has a new and used car tire repair and sales business. She opened the shop due to economic need and it’s been in operation for 8 years now. Her husband helps her with the work and she has one employee. She is asking for funds to buy new and used vehicle tires which will allow her to have stock available to meet customer demand, to contribute to improve economic conditions and generate more work-based income. Her aspirations are to buy her own house and to support her children’s schooling so that they finish a university career and have their own office.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new and used car tires.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en:
Aliitasi V. is 44 and married with 10 children. She owns a business venture, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.  Aliitasi has 5 years of experience in this business, and needs a loan of 500 talas to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Aliitasi joined SPBD. This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Aliitasi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene B. is from the village of Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she sells coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $70 a month for this activity.

In 2010, Arlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

Arlene is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Precy

texts.en: Precy M. is from the village of Simimbaan. She is 46 years old. Precy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Precy provides jeepney transportation services in the community. Precy has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Precy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Precy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Precy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Estela Lizette

texts.es: La señora Estela R. R. es profesora de un colegio en la ciudad de el Viejo, es casada  tiene un hijo en edad escolar ha salido adelante poco a poco este financiamiento lo solicito para terminar de construir su cocina la cual la quería acondicionar,  le ha costado bastante sacar adelante su casa y en la entrevista que le hice nos manifestó su agradecimiento hacia la institución ya que por  estos créditos ha mejorado bastante su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señora Estela R. R. is a teacher at a school in the city of Viejo. She is married and has a son of school age. She has advanced herself little by little. She is applying for this loan to finish building her kitchen, which she wants to fix up. It has cost her quite a bit to improve her house, and in the interview with her, she expressed her gratitude to the institution (CEPRODEL), since she has improved her quality of life quite a bit through these loans.

loans.use: Improve her home.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 53 years old, is a tea and dairy farmer. She is married to John, a tea farmer, and they have two adult children. Joyce has been doing tea and dairy farming for the past 10 years. Her monthly income is KES 6,000. She has applied for a loan in order to purchase dairy feed and fertilizer and to provide tea pruning labour. 

With the anticipated profit Joyce intends to venture into a new type of farming - poultry. She is applying for her second loan with Kadet as her first loan was paid successfully. Her hopes and dreams are to live her old age without stress together with her husband and to see her entire family settled.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed, buy farm supplies and hire labor

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia S. lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. 

Lukia has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Lukia sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Lukia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through selling piped water. The main business challenges for Lukia include the ever increasing prices of second-hand clothes and the rainy season.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to be a wholesaler and also buy a plot of land to build a permanent business premise. Lukia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Mugisa

texts.en:
Mugisa E. is 39 years old and married with 7 children aged 2.5 to 14 years. He also has 3 dependents. His wife owns a salon. He lives in Hoirna Town, in a family of nine people and he owns his home. His goal is to educate his children.

He has been in the produce business for 3 years. He started by farming and then selling produce but now he buys from other farmers. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations of produce. He hopes in the future to buy his own milling machine. He wants the loan to buy supplies of rice.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of rice to sell
